おくのいん〔奥の院〕
〈名〉The inner shrine; the penetralia; the sanctuary; the holy of holies; the sanctum sanctorum

content:
おくのて〔奥の手〕
〈名〉One's last resort; one's last resource; one's trump card; one's best cards; a card up one's sleeve; the mysteries (of an art)

content.content: 虚勢は彼の奥の手だ
Bluff is his last resort.
泣くのが女の奥の手
Woman's last resource is tears.
奥の手を出す
to play one's trump card―play one's best cards
彼は奥の手がある
He holds trumps in his hand―has the cards in his hand―has a card up his sleeve.
奥の手を見られる
to show one's cards―show one's hand
奥の手を見てやった
I got him to show his hand.
斯道の奥の手を伝授する
to initiate one into the mysteries or the art
奥の手を尽す
to exhaust ［go through］ the mysteries of the art
ばか者は奥の手を隠し持ちきれぬ
“A fool's bolt is soon shot.”
三十六計の奥の手を出す
to take to one's heels

content:
おくば〔奥歯〕
〈名〉A molar tooth; a grinder

content.content: 彼は奥歯に物がはさまったようなものの言いようをする
He leaves things half-said―He never speaks out―He never speaks to the point.

content:
おくび
〈名〉Belching; eructation:(=する) to belch; to eructate

content.content: おくびにも出すな
Do not breathe a syllable of it.
おくびにも出しません
No, not a syllable.
彼は何用があって来たかおくびにも出さぬ
He never hints at the nature of his business.

content:
おくびょう〔臆病〕
〈名〉Cowardice; timidity; poltroonery; the white feather:(=な) cowardly; timid; timorous; nervous; craven; chicken-hearted; white-livered; lily-livered

content.content: 彼は非常に臆病だ
He is exceedingly timid―afraid of his own shadow.
僕は臆病で困る
I can not get over my timidity.
彼は臆病なほど用心深い
He is prudent to timidity.
臆病な振る舞いするな
Do not show the white feather!

content:
おくびょうかぜ〔臆病風〕
〈名〉Panic; funk

content.content: 臆病風に吹かれる
to be seized with a panic―panic-stricken―in a blue funk

おくびょうもの〔臆病者〕
〈名〉A coward; a poltroon; a dastard; a recreant; a craven

content:
おくびれる〔臆びれる〕
〈自動〉To be timid; to be nervous; to be abashed; to be afraid (to do something); to be shy of (doing something)

content.content: 学生は臆びれて英語を話さない
The student are afraid to speak English―shy of speaking English.

content:
おくふかい〔奥深い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: おくぶかい〔奥深い〕

content:
おくぶかい〔奥深い〕
〈形〉(Horizontally) deep:(より)profound; abstruse; recondite

content.content: 奥深い庭
a deep garden
奥深い哲理
profound philosophy―abstruse philosophy

content:
おくまりたる〔奥まりたる〕
〈形〉Retired (valley); secluded (place); sequestered (spot, etc.)

content.content: 奥まりたる処
a recess

おくみ〔衽〕
〈名〉A gusset; a gore

おくめんなき〔臆面無き〕
〈形〉Bold; audacious; impudent; cheeky; unblushing; brazen; brazen-faced; cool

content:
おくめんなく〔臆面無く〕
〈副〉Boldly; audaciously; impudently; coolly

content.content: 彼は臆面無く押し通すから偉い
He will brave it out―brazen it out.
臆面無く嘘をつく
He is a cool hand at lying.
よく臆面無くあんなことが言えたものだ
I wonder how he can have the cheek to say such things.
彼は臆面も無く金をくれと言った
He had the impudence to ask for money.

content:
おくゆかしい〔奥床しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=奥深くて床しい)mysterious; interesting

content.content: あの人の行動は奥ゆかしさを帯びている
His actions are invested with an air of mystery.
あの家は何となく奥ゆかしい
There is an air of mystery about the house.
人を助けておいて名前を言わずに行くとは奥ゆかしい人だと思った
That he saved a man and did not even give his name, made him an interesting person in my eyes.

content: 2. (=重々しい)grave; solemn; dignified

おくゆき〔奥行〕
〈名〉(Horizontal) depth

content.content: 地所は間口が五間に奥行が十間ある
The plot is 30 feet wide and 60 feet deep.
あの人の学問は間口ばかりで奥行が無い
His knowledge is of a wide range, but lacks depth.

content:
おくゆるし〔奥許し〕
〈名〉Initiation into the mysteries of an art

content.content: その道の奥許しを取る
to be initiated into the mysteries of the art

content:
おくらす〔後らす〕
〈他動〉To delay, procrastinate, put off (what ought to be done); to put back, turn back, keep back (a watch or a clock)

content.content: 時計がわざと後らしてある
The clock is kept back on purpose.

おくりかえす〔送り返す〕
〈他動〉To send back

おくりこす〔送り越す〕
〈他動〉To send (anything) over

content:
おくりこむ〔送り込む〕
〈他動〉To see (one) to a house

content.content: 彼を宿屋へ送り込んで来た
I have seen him to a hotel.
車夫が主人を役所へ送り込む
The rickshaman draws his master to his office.

おくりさき〔送り先〕
〈名〉(場所)the destination (of goods):(人)the receiver, the consignee (of goods)

content:
おくりじょう〔送状〕
〈名〉An invoice

content.content: 物品の送状を書く
to invoice goods

content:
おくりだす〔送り出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=物を送り出す)to send out (goods, etc.)
2. (=人を送り出す)to show (one) out; to show (one) off the premises; to see (one) to the door

content.content: 主人がていねいに送り出してくれた
The master of the house bowed us out―bowed us off the premises.
子どもを学校へ送り出したばかりだ
I have just packed the children off to school.

content:
おくりとどける〔送り届ける〕
〈他動〉To see (one) home; to see (one) safe home; to see (one) to one's door; to escort (one) home

content.content: 婦人達を家まで送り届けてきた
I have been to see the ladies safe home―escort the ladies home.
君の家まで送り届けよう
I will see you to your door.

おくりな〔諡〕
〈名〉A posthumous name

おくりにん〔送り人〕
〈名〉
1. The sender, the consignor (of goods)
2. (=見送り人)a sender-off

content:
おくりむかえ〔送り迎え〕
〈名〉Speeding and welcoming:(=する) to speed and welcome (people)

content.content: 車夫が主人を役所へ送り迎えする
The rickshaman draws his master to and from his office.

content:
おくりもの〔贈物〕
〈名〉A present; a gift

content.content: 贈物をする
to make one a present―send one a present
本を贈物にする
to present one with a book―make one a present of a book
贈物にするのだからのしを付けておくれ
Tie it with a ribbon, as I intend it for a present.
贈物を受納する
to accept a present
これは伯(叔)父の贈物だ
This is a gift from my uncle.
クリスマスの贈物
a Christmas present
新年の贈物
a New Year's gift

content:
おくる〔送る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=何をどこへ送る、誰へ送る)to send (one something―anything to a person or a place); to forward (a letter to one's place of sojourn); to despatch (a telegram); to transmit (a message); to remit (money through a bank):(商人が貨物を送る)to consign (goods to one):(船でなら)to ship (goods for some destination)

content.content: 本を郵便で送れ
Send me the book by post.
手紙が来たら出先へ送って貰いたい
I wish to have my letters forwarded to me.
この品をパリから送って寄越した
I had the article sent me from Paris.
品物を日英社宛に送れ
Consign the goods to the Nichieisha―(船でなら)―Ship the goods for the Nichieisha.
刑務所へ送られる
to be sent to prison―sent to jail
書を送る
to write one a letter―write to one
為替で金を送る
to remit money by bank-bill―remit money through a bank
兵を送る
to despatch troops
電報を送る
to despatch a telegram
電気を送る
to transmit electricity
秋波を送る
(男なら)to ogle a girl―cast sheep's eye on a woman―(女なら)―make eyes at a man

content: 2. (=送り出す)to show (one) out; to show (one) off the premises

content.content: 主人が(ていねいに)玄関まで送ってくれた
The master of the house showed me out-bowed me out.
ランプを持って玄関まで送ってくれた
He lighted me to the door.

content: 3. (=見送る、送別する)to speed (the parting guest); to see (one) off; to send (one) off; to give (one) a send-off

content.content: ステーションへ友人を送りに行ってきた
I have been to the station to see a friend off.
万歳を唱えて人を送る
to send a man off with cheers
彼を盛んに送ろうではないか
Let us give him a rousing send-off!
客を送る
to speed a parting guest
これをもって君を送るの辞となす
With this I will conclude my address to speed you.
旧年を送り新年を迎える
to speed the Parting Year and welcome the Coming Year―ring out the Old Year and ring in the New Year

content: 4. (=送り届ける)to see (one) home; to see (one) safe home; to see (one) to one's door; to escort (one) home

content.content: 婦人達を家まで送ってきた
I have been to see the ladies safe home―escort the ladies home.
彼は僕を馬車で家まで送ってくれた
He drove me home.
君の家まで送ろう
I will see you to your door.
彼は提灯を持って僕の家まで送ってくれた
He took a lantern, and lighted me home.

content: 5. (=送り込む)to see (one) to a house

content.content: 友人を宿屋へ送ってきた
I have been to see a friend to a hotel.
車夫が主人を会社へ送って帰るところであった
The rickshaman was returning from drawing his master to his office.

content: 6. (=仕送る)to supply (one with money)

content.content: 伯(叔)父が学資を送ってくれます
My uncle supplies me with my school-expenses―pays my expenses for me.
金は滞り無く送ってくれます
I am duly supplied with money.

content: 7. (=その日を送る)to live; to get one's living; to gain a livelihood; to make the pot boil; to keep the pot boiling

content.content: 彼はどうしてその日を送っているか
How does he live?―How does he get his living?
雑誌の原稿を書いてその日を送っている
He lives by writing for a magazine―gets his living by writing for the magazines.
かながなその日を送っている
He makes a bare living―picks up a scanty livelihood.
どうかこうかその日を送っている
He manages to live―contrives to keep the pot boiling―makes shift to rub through life―scratches along.
後に残れる妻や子は
My wife and little ones I leave behind―
どうしてその日を送るやら
How shall they their means of living find?

content: 8. (=月日を送る、世を送る)(どんな生活をするの意味なら)to lead a life; to live a life:(どうして日を暮らすの意味なら)to pass one's life; to spend one's time:(米国では)to put in one's time

content.content: 幸福に世を送る
to live a happy life―lead a happy existence
忙しく生涯を送る
to lead a busy life―live a busy life
彼は学術研究に一生を送った
He passed his life in study―devoted his life to study.
遊んで日を送るものでない
You should not pass your time in idleness.
読書に日を送っている
I spend my time in reading―devote my time to reading.
未亡人は淋しい月日を送っている
The widow leads a lonely life.
みじめな月日を送る
to live a wretched life―drag out a miserable existence
碌々{ろくろく}として歳月を送る
to live in vain―live to no purpose
碌々として歳月を送るものでない
You should live to some purpose.
人は額に汗して世を送る
Man must live by the sweat of his brow.
彼は安楽に余命を送った
He passed the remainder of his life in comfort.
晩年を故山に送った
He passed the evening of his life in his seat of infancy.
晩年を楽しく送った
The evening of his life was happy.
晩年を不幸に送った
He outlived his happiness.
どうやらこうらやら長い一日を送った
I have managed to live through the livelong day.

content:
おくる〔贈る〕
〈他動〉
1. To present (one with anything―anything to one); to make (one) a present of (anything); to send (me a present)

content.content: 彼が帰国する時名刀をひと振り贈った
When he went home, I presented him with a famous blade.
僕は金時計を贈られた
I was presented with a gold watch―A gold watch was presented to me.
彼はけっこうな葡萄酒を一ダース贈ってくれた
He sent me a dozen bottles of good wine.
その本は君に贈ろう
I will make you a present of the book.

content: 2. (=死後に位を授ける)to confer (a rank on the dead)

content.content: 位を贈る
to confer a posthumous rank on a deceased person
彼は正三位を贈られた
He was posthumously promoted to the Senior Third Rank.

content:
おぐるま〔小車〕
〈名〉A wheel

content.content: 因果はまわる小車
Effect follows cause―Effect can not but follow cause.

content:
おくれ〔後れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=人に後れること)backwardness

content.content: 人に後れを取る
to be behind the others in some respect
熱心の一点では人に後れを取らぬつもりだ
I hope I am behind no one in zeal.
あの人は何事にでも人に後れを取ることが嫌いだ
He hates to be behind the others in anything.

content: 2. (=後れた処)lost time

content.content: 後れを取り返す
to make up for lost time
病気して一年遊んだから後れを取り返さねばならぬ
I have played away a year, and I must make up for lost time.

content: 3. (=敗北)defeat

content.content: 後れを取る
to be defeated―be beaten

content:
おくれげ〔後れ毛〕
〈名〉(A woman's) short loose hair; stray hair

content.content: 鬢の後れ毛を掻き上げる
to comb up the stray tresses of the side-locks
美人の後れ毛は愛嬌のあるものだ
The loose locks about a beautiful face will add to the charms.

おくれざき〔後れ咲き〕
〈名〉A late flower:(木の花なら)late blossoms

content:
おくればせに〔後れ馳せに〕
〈副〉Too late; late in the day; a day after the fair; at the eleventh hour

content.content: 彼はおくればせに駈けつけた
He hastened to the scene at the eleventh hour―He arrived a day after the fair.
後れ馳せ乍ら御報知申上候
I beg to inform you, though rather late in the day, that...

content:
おくれる〔後れる、遅れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=時が後れる)to be late; to be behind time; to be behindhand; to be backward; to be overdue

content.content: この汽車はいつも後れる
This train is always behind time―always late.
今日も十分後れた
She is ten minutes behind her time―ten minutes late―today.
船が三時間後れて着いた
The ship arrived three hours behind her time―She was three hours overdue.
今朝学校へ後れた
I was late for school this morning.
今年は季節が後れている
The seasons are backward this year.
作物が後れている
The crops are backward.
帰りが後れて飯を食い損なった
I returned too late for dinner.
後れないように帰ろう
Let us go home in time.
一日後れれば一日だけ得だ
Time is in my favour.
一日後れれば一日だけ損だ
Time is against me.

content: 2. (=何が後れる)to be backward (in one's studies); to get behind (with one's work); to be behind time (with one's work); to be behindhand (with one's payment); to be in arrear (with one's payment)

content.content: 彼は学問が後れている
He is backward in his studies.
病気して学問が後れたのだ
Illness kept him back in his studies.
彼は英語は進んでいるが数学は後れている
He is forward in English, but backward in mathematics.
僕は病気して学校が一年後れた
I have played away a year on account of illness.
勉強して後れた処を取り返さねばななぬ
I must work hard to make up for lost time.
遊んでいると仕事が後れる
If I am idle, I shall get behind with my work.
彼はいつも仕事が後れる(紺屋の明後日)
He is always behind time with his work.
君はどういうわけでいつも払いが後れますか
How is it that you are always behindhand with your payment?―in arrear with your payment?

content: 3. (=何に後れる、誰に後れる)to be too late (for the train); to fail behind, lag behind (the times); to fall behind (the others in English); to be in arrear of (the class in English)

content.content: 試験に後れて間に合わなかった
I was too late for the examination.
汽車に後れ乗り損なった
I was too late for the train―I missed the train.
汽車に後れないように急ごう
Let us make haste, so as to be in time for the train―to catch the train.
乗り後れた乗客
a belated passenger
彼は学問が人に後れている
He is behind the others in his studies.
彼は全級で一番英語が後れている
He is behind his class in English―in arrear of his class in English.
日本の飛行術は泰西に比して非常に後れている
Japan is far behind the West in the art of flying.
時世に後れる
to fall behind the times―lag behind the times
彼は時世に後れている
He is behind the times―in arrear of the times―out of touch with the times.
時世に後れぬようにせよ
Keep pace with the times!―Keep abreast of the times!―Keep in touch with the times!
僕は時世には後れない積りだ
I hope I move with the times.
この洋服は流行に後れている
This coat is out of fashion.

content: 4. (=列に後れる)to fall behind; to drop behind; to lag behind; to hang behind; to draggle; to straggle

content.content: 途中で倒れた者も後れた者もある
Some gave out on the way, and some dropped behind.
彼はずっと後れている
He is a long way behind.
後れた者が追いついて来るのを待っている
We are waiting for the stragglers to come up with us.
支那は後れている
China is lagging behind (the world in civilization).
後れた国民
a backward nation

content: 5. (=人より後れる)to be later than (some one); to be after (some one)

content.content: 僕は君より後れて着いた
I arrived later than you―after you.

content: 6. (=手間取る)to be delayed

content.content: 途中で後れて遅く着いた
I was delayed on the road, and have arrived late.
途中で後れなかったらもっと早く着いたのだ
But for the delay on the road, I should have arrived sooner.
雪のために後れた
We were delayed by the snow.
返事は後れてはならぬ
The answer admits of no delay.
雨のために工事が後れた
The rain has delayed the works―retarded the works.

content: 7. (=生き残る)to outlive, survive (another)

content.content: 我が子に後れる
to outlive one's child―survive one's son
時計が後れる
A clock or a watch loses―goes too slow.
お宅の時計は進みますか後れますか
Does your clock gain or lose?
一日に十分後れます
It loses ten minutes a day.
この時計は進んでいますか後れていますか
Is this clock fast or slow?
五分後れて居ます
It is five minutes too slow.
午砲より五分後れています
It is five minutes behind the gun.
僕の時計は後れる
My watch goes too slow.

おくれる〔後れる、遅れる〕
〈自動〉

一日後れれば一日だけ損だ

この洋服は流行に後れている
This coat is out of fashion.

content: 4. (=列に後れる)to fall behind; to drop behind; to lag behind; to hang behind; to draggle; to straggle

content.content: 途中で倒れた者も後れた者もある
Some gave out on the way, and some dropped behind.
彼はずっと後れている
He is a long way behind.
後れた者が追いついて来るのを待っている
We are waiting for the stragglers to come up with us.
支那は後れている
China is lagging behind (the world in civilization).
後れた国民
a backward nation

content: 5. (=人より後れる)to be later than (some one); to be after (some one)

content.content: 僕は君より後れて着いた
I arrived later than you―after you.

content: 6. (=手間取る)to be delayed

content.content: 途中で後れて遅く着いた
I was delayed on the road, and have arrived late.
途中で後れなかったらもっと早く着いたのだ
But for the delay on the road, I should have arrived sooner.
雪のために後れた
We were delayed by the snow.
返事は後れてはならぬ
The answer admits of no delay.
雨のために工事が後れた
The rain has delayed the works―retarded the works.

content: 7. (=生き残る)to outlive, survive (another)

content.content: 我が子に後れる
to outlive one's child―survive one's son
時計が後れる
A clock or a watch loses―goes too slow.
お宅の時計は進みますか後れますか
Does your clock gain or lose?
一日に十分後れます
It loses ten minutes a day.
この時計は進んでいますか後れていますか
Is this clock fast or slow?
五分後れて居ます
It is five minutes too slow.
午砲より五分後れています
It is five minutes behind the gun.
僕の時計は後れる
My watch goes too slow.

content:
おけ〔桶〕
〈名〉A tub; a kit:(手桶の類なら)a pail; a bucket

content.content: 一桶の水
a pail of water
桶の箍{たが}
the hoops of a tub
桶に箍をかける
to hoop a tub
桶の箍が弾ける
A hoop springs off a tub.
桶の側{がわ}
the staves of a tub
桶屋
a cooper―a hooper

content:
おけぬ〔置けぬ〕
〈打消動詞〉

content.content: あの人は気が置けぬ
He makes you feel at home―You feel at home with him.
彼はなかなか隅に置けぬ
He is not to be overlooked―not to be sneezed at.
あんなまじめな顔をしていてなかなか隅に置けぬ
He looks as grave as a judge, and yet he is a devil of a fellow.

おけや〔桶屋〕
〈名〉A cooper; a hooper

content:
おける〔於ける〕
〈前置詞相当〉To

content.content: 読書の精神に於けるなお食物の身体に於けるが如し
Reading is to the mind what food is to the body.
英国の西洋に於けるなお日本の東洋に於けるが如し
England is in the West what Japan is in the East.
鷲の鳥に於ける獅子の獣に於けるが如し
The eagle is among birds what the lion is among beasts.

content:
おける〔置ける〕
〈自動〉To keep

content.content: この魚は長く置けるか
Will this fish keep long?
明日まで置けない
It will not keep till tomorrow―keep overnight.

おこう〔汚行〕
〈名〉A shameful action; a disgraceful act; scandalous conduct; infamous conduct

content:
おこえがかり〔お声掛り〕
〈名〉(My lord's) command; recommendation (by a superior)

content.content: 殿のお声がかりだ
It is my lord's command.
大臣のお声がかりで来たのだからしりぞけることができぬ
We can not refuse him, for he comes recommended by the Minister.

content:
おこがましい〔烏滸がましい〕
〈形〉
1. (=出過ぎた)presumptuous; impertinent

content.content: 批評などとはおこがましいが
It would be presumptuous of me to criticize,―I do not presume to criticize,―but...
僕が口を出してはおこがましいが止した方がよくはありませんか
It would be impertinent of me to interfere, but hadn't you better desist?
意見というもおこがましいが、まあ述べて見ましょう
If I might venture an opinion, I shall give it, such as it is.

content: 2. (=おかしい)laughable ; ridiculous

おこす〔起す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=立たせる)to raise; to set up

content.content: 転んだ人を起こす
to set one up―raise one to one's feet―set one on one's legs
転んで起きられないから起こしてやった
I helped him up―helped him to his feet―helped him on his legs.
横になっている石を起こす
to raise a stone to an erect position
曲った家を起こす
to right a leaning house
傾いた船を起す
to right a heeling ship

content: 2. (=目を覚まさせる)to wake, awake, rouse (a sleeper):(安眠を妨害してなら)to awaken; to disturb:(朝なら)to call

content.content: 子どもが寝ているから起こさないように
You must not awaken the child―disturb the child.
寝ている奴らを起こせ
Wake the sleepers!―Rouse the sleepers!
(彼を寝かさないで)起こしておけ
Keep him awake!
明朝は何時にお起こし申しましょうか
What time shall I call you tomorrow morning?
七時に起こして下さい
Call me at seven.
今日は起こされずに起きた
I did not wait to be called this morning.

content: 3. (=開始する)to commence (operations); to open (negotiations); to originate (a scheme); to set (a project) on foot; to start, launch (an enterprise); to initiate, inaugurate (a reform); to raise, float (a loan)

content.content: 計画を起こす
to originate a scheme―set a project on foot
改革を起こす
to initiate a reform―inaugurate a reform
運動を起こす
to start a movement―initiate a movement―inaugurate a movement
事業を起こす
to start an enterprise―launch an enterprise
公債を起こす
to raise a loan―float a loan
工事を起こす
to commence works
土工を起こす
to break ground

content: 4. (=発起する)to originate (a project); to project (a scheme); to propose (a plan); to suggest (a movement); to promote (the flotation of a company); to float (a company)

content.content: 会社を起こす
to promote a company―float a company
あの男はよくあやしい会社を起こす
He is given to floating bogus companies.
宴会を起す
to get up a dinner

content: 5. (=設立する)to establish (a company); to institute, found (a school); to start (a newspaper); to form (a society); to set (a club) a-going

content.content: 学校を起こす
to start a school―establish a school―institute a school―found a school
会を起こす
to form a society―establish a society―organize a society―set a club a-going
会社を起こす
to form a company―establish a company―organize a company―(発起するの意味なら)―promote a company―float a company
新聞を起こす
to start a newspaper

content: 6. (=何の原因となる)to cause (good or evil); to bring about (a result)

content.content: 圧制が革命を起こした
The tyranny caused a revolution.
どうしてこういう結果を起こしたか
How was the result brought about?
火災を起こす
to cause a fire―set a house on fire

content: 7. (=騒動などを起こす)to make, create, raise (a disturbance); to breed (a root); to brew (a rebellion); to stir up (a strife); to give rise to (troubles)

content.content: 騒動を起こす
to make a disturbance―create a disturbance―raise a disturbance―(煽動してなら)―stir up a trouble
争いを起こす
to stir up a strife―stir up a quarrel
波瀾を起こす
to create a disturbance―raise a storm
平地に波瀾を起こす
to force the situation―force a war
物議を起こす
to raise a storm―give rise to a controversy
この問題が悶着を起こした
The question gave rise to troubles.
戦争を起す
to raise a war
この戦争を起こしたのは誰の罪か
Who is responsible for this war?
義軍を起こす
to raise a righteous war
仁義の師を起こす
to take up arms in the cause of justice and humanity
乱を起こす
to brew a rebellion
一揆を起こす
to raise an insurrection
暴動を起こす
to breed a riot
暴風怒濤を起こす
The gale lashes the sea into fury.
(人を相手どって)訴訟を起こす
to institute a suit against any one―bring an action against any one―proceed against any one―go to law (with some one)
病を起こす
to be seized with an illness―be attacked with a disease―have an attack of a disease
下痢を起こす
to be attacked with diarrhoea―have an attack of diarrhoea
暑気にあたって熱を起こした
Exposure to heat brought on a fever.
傷から熱を起こした
The wound brought on a fever―threw me into a fever.
目に炎症を起こしている
The eyes are inflamed.
癪を起こす
to have a fit of spasm
余病を起こさなければ安心です
You are safe unless a complication arises.
考えを起こす
to form an idea―conceive an idea―think of doing something―take it into one's head to do something
英語を組織的に教えてみようという考えを起こした
I conceived the idea of teaching English on system.
彼は投機をやってみようという考えを起こした
He took it into his head to engage in speculation.
太い了簡を起こした
He formed an audacious idea.
悪心を起こす
to yield to temptation―listen to the voice of the tempter
感情を起こす
to have one's feelings excited (or awakened or aroused)
好奇心を起こす
to have one's curiosity excited
本の表紙を見て好奇心を起こした
The cover of the book excited my curiosity.
好奇心を起こして本を開いてみた
I opened the book out of curiosity.
疑念を起こす
to have one's suspicions excited (or aroused)
その人の様子を見て疑念を起こした
His appearance excited my suspicions―aroused my suspicions.
同情を起こす
to have one's sympathy awakened
その人の哀れな様子を見て同情を起こした
His pitiful appearance awakened my sympathy.
望みを起こす
to be seized with a desire
急にその品を手に入れたいという望みを起こした
I was seized with a sudden desire to possess myself of the article.
恐慌を起こす
to be seized with a panic
希望を起こす
to be inspired with hope
彼に励まされて希望を起こした
His encouraging words inspired me with hope.
勇気を起こす
to be inspired with courage
大将の顔を見て部下が勇気を起こす
The leader's countenance inspires his men with courage.
その話を聞いて彼に対する尊敬の念を起こした
The account inspired me with respect for him.
不義を見て反感を起こす
to be shocked at injustice―revolt at injustice
癇癪を起こす
to fly into a passion
短気を起こす
to lose one's temper―get out of temper
女を見て情を起こす
to lust after a woman
火災を起こす
to cause a fire―to be set on fire
家は火災を起こしている
The house is on fire.
ランプがこわれて火災を起こした
A lamp bursting set the house on fire.
行って見ると家は火災を起こしていた
I found the house on fire.
身を起こす
to rise
卑賤より身を起こす
to rise from obscurity―spring from obscurity
彼は一兵卒より身を起こして太将になった
He rose from the ranks to be a general.
身代を起こす、家を起こす
to make a fortune―make one's fortune
変化を起こす
to produce a change―work a change
熱や電気を起こす
to generate heat―generate electricity
火を起こす
to kindle a fire―make a charcoal fire
土を起こす
to turn up the soil
荒地を起こす
to break up waste land

content:
おこぜ〔虎魚〕
〈名〉A small sea-fish

content.content: オコゼが怒ったような顔をしている
He has a face bristling with points.

content:
おごそか〔厳か〕
〈形〉Solemn (ceremony); stately (procession); grave (air); stern (look); severe (countenance); strict (discipline); austere (life); awful (occasion); impressive (manner, etc.)

content.content: 厳かな儀式
a solemn ceremony
厳かな行列
a stately procession
儀式はいと厳かに行われた
The ceremony was performed with due solemnity.

content:
おこたり〔怠り〕
〈名〉Neglect; negligence; remissness; idleness

content.content: 近頃は忙しいので運動を怠りがちだ
Press of business makes me neglect taking exercise.

content:
おこたる〔怠る〕
〈他動〉(=怠慢にする)to neglect (one's duties); to be neglectful of (one's duties); to be negligent of (one's duties); to be negligent in attending to (one's duties); to be remiss in (the discharge of one's duties)

content.content: 職務を怠る
to neglect one's duties―be neglectful of one's duties―be negligent of one's duties―be negligent in attending to one's duties―be remiss in the discharge of one's duties
職務を怠るな
Attend to your duties!―Mind what you are about!
彼は酒色にふけって業務を怠った
He addicted himself to dissipation and debauchery, and neglected his business.
業務を怠るな
Attend to your business!―Mind what you are about!
彼は勉強を怠る
He neglects his studies―He is neglectful of his books.
勉強を怠るな
Attend to your studies!―Mind your books!
手紙の返事を怠っておった
I have neglected answering the letter.

content:
〈自動〉
1. (=なまける)to idle; to be idle; to laze; to be lazy
2. (=病気が少し快くなる)to get a little better; to improve in health

おこない〔行い〕
〈名〉
1. (=身の行い、行状、品行、身持)conduct; behaviour; life; morals

content.content: 君の行いを人が見習うから一挙一動に注意しなければならぬ
You must be careful about whatever you do, because your conduct has influence on the others.
彼は行いが好い
He conducts himself well―He is well-conducted―He is a steady goer.
行いが悪い
He is ill-conducted―irregular in conduct―loose in morals―a loose liver―a loose fish―a sad dog.
身の行いを慎む
to conduct oneself properly―be prudent in one's conduct―be continent in one's life
身の行いを改める
to reform (oneself)―amend (one's conduct)―mend one's ways
口で教えるよりも行いで示す
“Example is better than precept.”

content: 2. (=行動、行為)an act; an action; a deed

content.content: 彼は話はわかっているが行いは愚者の行いだ
He talks like a man of sense, but his actions are those of a fool.
あれは利慾から出る行いだ
It is an action dictated by self-interest.
人の行いを見れば心がわかる
One's actions show one's heart.
彼は口先ばかりで行いが無い
He is a man of words, and not of deeds―He is all talk and no deed.
その志は賞すべきもその行いは笑うべし
The motive is worthy of praise, but the deed deserves censure.
彼の行いは道にかなっている
He has acted with justice.
正しい行い
a right action―a lawful action
不正な行い
a wrong action―an unlawful action―a dishonest action
公平な行い
an act of justice

content: 3. (=勤行)religious service

おこなう〔行う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=為す)to do

content.content: 言うはやすく行うは難し、言うべくして行い難し
It is easier said than done.
彼は口ばかりで行わない
He is all talk and no deed.

content: 2. (=身の行いをする)to conduct oneself; to act

content.content: 言うところ賢にして行うところ愚なり
His words are those of a man of sense, but his actions are those of a fool.
決心通り行う
to act up to one's resolution

content:
〈他動〉
1. (=実行する)to practise (a doctrine); to put (a doctrine) in practice; to execute, carry out (a plan); to carry (a plan) into execution; to effect (a reform); to carry (a reform) into effect

content.content: 教えを行う
to practise a doctrine―put a doctrine in practice
節制は説く者多く行う者少し
Many preach temperance, but few practise it.
徳を行う
to practise virtue
慈善を行う
to practise charity―feed the hungry and clothe the naked
主義を行う
to act upon one's principles
計画を行う
to execute a plan―carry a plan into execution―carry a plan into effect
改革を行う
to carry out a reform―effect a reform―carry a reform into effect
攻撃を行う
to make an attack―deliver an assault―on a fortress
示威運動を行う
to make a demonstration
修繕を行う
to carry out repairs

content: 2. (=施行する)to perform (an operation); to enforce (a law); to put (a law) in force; to put (a system) in operation

content.content: 手術を行う
to perform an operation
奇術を行う
to perform conjuring tricks―juggle
魔術を行う
to deal in magic―practise sorcery
法律を行う
to enforce a law―put a law in force
制度を行う
to put a system in operation
賞罰を行う
to reward merit and punish crime―satisfy justice―fulfil justice
攻を論じて賞を行う
to reward services and distribute honours
政治を行う
to manage public affairs―administer the affairs of state―govern a country
仁政を行う
to rule benignly over a people
虐政を行う
to tyrannize over a people
奇蹟を行う
to work miracles
キリストは奇蹟を行った
Christ wrought miracles.

content: 3. (=執行する)to perform (one's duties); to discharge (one's duties); to execute (a sentence)

content.content: 職務を行う
to perform one's duties―discharge one's duties
職権を行う
to exercise one's functions―exercise one's authority
行政権を行う
to exercise administrative power
死刑を行う
to execute a sentence of death―execute a criminal

content: 4. (=挙行する)to perform (a ceremony); to hold (a ceremony); to celebrate (a wedding); to solemnize (a festival)

content.content: 式を行う
to perform a ceremony―hold a ceremony―conduct a function
式は最も厳粛に行われた
The function was conducted with the greatest solemnity.
卒業式を行う
to hold the graduation ceremony
開業式を行う
to hold the inauguration ceremony
結婚式を行う
to celebrate a wedding―solemnize a marriage
葬式を行う
to hold a funeral―perform a burial service
礼拝を行う
to perform a religious service―hold a divine service
試験を行う
to hold an examination
本月二十五日より入学試験を行う
The entrance-examination will be held from the 25th inst.

content: 5. (=遂行する)to accomplish (one's purpose); to effect (one's design)

content.content: 志すところを行う決心だ
I am determined to accomplish my purpose―effect my purpose.
決心を行う
to act upon one's resolution
決心通り行おう
I will act up to my resolution.

content: 6. (=履行する)to perform (one's promise); to fulfil (one's promise); to keep (one's word); to keep to, abide by (one's agreement)

content.content: 約束を行わなければならぬ
I am bound to perform my promise―fulfil my promise―keep my promise.
彼は立派に約束を行った
He was as good as his word.
契約を行う
to keep to one's agreement―abide by one's agreement

content: 7. (=続行する)to carry on (war or trade); to conduct (an enterprise)

content.content: 戦争を行う
to carry on war―wage war―conduct a war
商業を行う
to carry on commerce―carry on a trade
事業を行う
to conduct an enterprise

content:
おこなわれる〔行われる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=実施になる)(a law) comes into force; (a system) goes into operation, becomes operative; (a regulation) comes into effect, takes effect

content.content: この法律はまだ行われている
This law is still in force.
二年制度はいつから行われているか
How long has the two-year system been in operation?
新制度は盛んに行われている
The new system is in full operation―in full swing.
改正規則は来年の一月から行われる
The revised regulations will take effect―come into effect―in January next.

content: 2. (=実行される)(a doctrine) is practised, put in practice; (a theory) is practicable, feasible; (orders) are obeyed; (a scheme) works; (a change) goes on, is going on, is in progress

content.content: 彼の命令は校内に行われる
His orders are obeyed―His word is law―in the school.
命令天下に行われず
Authority is set at naught.
好い方法には違いないが実際には行われない
It is a good method, to be sure, but it is impossible to practise.
それは理論だけで実際には行われない
It is a mere theory, and practically impossible―impracticable―unfeasible.
そんな策は行われん
The plan will not work.
新陳代謝は絶えず行われている
A change is constantly going on―in progress.

content: 3. (=流行する)to prevail; to obtain; to be prevalent; to be in vogue; to be in fashion; to be in favour; to be in use; to be in the air; (a rumour) is current, rife, in circulation

content.content: この習慣はまだある地方に行われている
The custom still prevails in certain parts of the country.
九州にはまだ男色が行われている
Sodomy is still prevalent in Kyushu.
教育界に行われている状態はこんなものだ
Such is the state of things that obtain in the educational world.
この制度は欧州にも行われている
The system obtains in Europe.
民主主義は世界中に行われている
Democracy is in vogue all the world over.
あの頃はそんな説が行われた
Such doctrines were in vogue in those days.
尚武のふうは行われなくなった
Militarism is not in fashion―out of fashion.
学生間にはどんな遊びが行われているか
What sort of games are now in favour with the students?
この教科書が今一般に行われている
This text-book is now in general use.
彼の説は行われない
His views do not find favour (with the public).
かの地ではキリスト教が盛んに行われている
Christianity is in great vogue there.
上海ではさまざまな流言が行われている
Various rumours are current―rumours are rife―in Shanghai.
そんな風説が盛んに行われている
Such rumours are in active circulation.
そんな意見が行われてきた
Such opinions are in the air.
いまに舞踏が盛んに行われるようになる
Dancing will soon be all the mode―all the rage―all the go.

content:
おこのさた〔烏滸の沙汰〕
〈名〉Presumption; impertinence

content.content: 彼が批評などとおこの沙汰だ
It is presumptuous in him to criticize.
あんな奴が口を出すのはおこの沙汰だ
It is impertinent in him to interfere.

content:
おこもり〔お籠り〕
〈名〉Remaining for days in a shrine or a temple to pray:(=する) to confine oneself for days in a shrine or a temple to pray

content.content: 不動様へ一週間おこもりした
He prayed for a week at the temple of Fudo.

content:
おこらせる〔怒らせる〕
〈他動〉To make (one) angry; to provoke (one) to anger; to anger; to irritate; to incense; to displease; to offend; to give (one) offence; to put (one) out (of humour or temper); to rouse one's ire; to stir one's wrath; to outrage one's feelings; to tread on one's toes, tread on one's corns

content.content: あの人を怒らせると手のつけようが無い
If you make him angry, you can do nothing with him.
君は口が悪いから人を怒らせる
You give offence by your foul tongue―Your tongue gives offence.
君はあまりがみがみ言うから人を怒らせるのだ
Your brutal way of speaking outrages people's feelings.
彼をわざと怒らせてやったのさ
I trod on his corns on purpose.

content:
おこり〔起り〕
〈名〉
1. (=起源)the origin; the source; the beginning; the birth; the root; the genesis

content.content: 戦争の起こりは何であったか
What was the origin of the war?―What did the war originate in?
戦争の起こりは領土の争い
The war originated in―had its origin in―territorial dispute.
けんかの起こりは冗談から
The quarrel began in a joke.
文明の起こり
the birth of civilization
万物の起こり
the genesis of things
事の起こり
the root of the matter
事の起こりは彼自身に在る
He has the root of the matter in him.
あの家の繁栄の起こりは台湾戦争からだ
The prosperity of the family dates from the Formosan War.

content: 2. (=原因)to cause

content.content: 戦争の起こりは何であったか
What was the cause of the war?―What caused the war?
戦争の起こりは種々あった
The war was due to various causes.
失敗の起こりは無能
His failure was due to his incompetence―His incompetence was the cause of his failure―His incompetence was responsible for his failure.

content:
おこり〔瘧〕
〈名〉Ague; the shakes

content.content: おこりを振るう
to have a fit of ague―have the shakes
おこりを落とす
to cure oneself of ague

content:
おごり〔奢り〕
〈名〉
1. (=奢侈)luxury; extravagance

content.content: 奢りにふける
to indulge in luxuries―addict oneself to luxuries
彼は奢りにふけっている
He is addicted to luxuries―luxurious―a sybarite.
奢りを極める
to roll in luxury―be lapped in luxury―repose in the lap of luxury―live in clover―live on the fat of the land―dine off plate and repose on a bed of down
奢りの果ては破滅
Extravagance ends in ruin―Extravagance leads to ruin.

content: 2. (=ご馳走)a treat (to one)

content.content: 今晩の宴会は知事のおごりだ
This evening's banquet is our governor's treat to us.
昨晩の芝居は誰のおごりでしたか
Who paid for our seats in the theatre last evening?

おこりじょうご〔怒り上戸〕
〈名〉A vicious drinker

content:
おこりつける〔怒り付ける〕
〈他動〉To scold; to storm at (one); to swear at (one); to give (one) a rating; to give (one) a scolding

content.content: うんと怒りつけてやった
I gave him a good rating.

content:
おこりっぽい〔怒りっぽい〕
〈名〉Touchy; tetchy; testy; irritable; irascible; passionate; choleric; splenetic; peevish; petulant; querulous; bad-tempered; ill-tempered; quick-tempered; short-tempered; hot-tempered; quick to take offence

content.content: あれは怒りっぽい男だ
He is a touchy fellow―a choleric man.
短気で怒りっぽい
He has a bad temper―a short temper―a quick temper―a hot temper.

content:
おこる〔起る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=事件などが発生する)to happen; to occur; to take place; to pass; to come to pass; to come about; to be brought about; (a war or a fire) breaks out; (troubles or difficulties) arise; (a reaction) sets in

content.content: 事件が起こる
An event happens―An event takes place.
小事件が起こる
An incident occurs―An incident takes place.
一身上に大事件が起こった
A great event has happened to me.
何事が起ころうと覚悟をきめている
Whatever may happen,―Come what may,―I am prepared for it.
鉄道椿事頻々として起こる
Railway accidents are of frequent occurrence.
目の前に起こっていることを知らずにいた(足下から鳥)
I did not know what was passing under my eyes.
たちまち起こってたちまち止む
It passes like smoke.
戦争が起こる
A war breaks out.
乱が起こった
A rebellion has broken out.
火災が起こった
A fire has broken out.
争いが起こった
A dispute has arisen.
学校騒動が起こった
School troubles have arisen.
どんな困難が起ころうとかまわん
I do not care what difficulties may arise.
今に反動が起こる
It will not be long before a reaction sets in.
夜間銃声起こる
The report of a gun was heard―I heard a shot―at night.

content: 2. (=何から起る、何に起因する)to arise (from some cause); to originate (in something―from some cause); to spring (from some source); to result (from some cause); to ensue (from some occurrence); to take its rise (in or from some source); to take its origin (from some source); to have its origin (in some source); to be caused (by something); to be due to (some cause or circumstance)

content.content: 米国の日本人排斥運動は人種的偏見より起こる
The anti-Japanese movement in America arises from racial prejudice.
この戦争は勢力争いから起こった
The war originated in rivalry―had its origin in rivalry.
種々の社会運動が戦争から起こった
Various social movements resulted from the war―ensued from the war.
この習慣は妙な出来事から起った
The custom sprang from―took its rise from―a curious occurrence.
彼の失敗は無能から起こった
His failure was due to his incompetence―His incompetence was the cause of his failure―His incompetence was responsible for his failure.
多くの日本語が仏教から起こっている
Many Japanese expressions are derived from Buddhism.
大事は小事より起こる
Great things have small beginnings.

content: 3. (=計画などが始まる)to be set on foot

content.content: 学校設立の計画が起こっている
A project is on foot for starting a new school.
その当時支那に排日運動が起こっていた
An anti-Japanese movement was then on foot in China.
校長排斥運動が起こっている
A movement is on foot for ejecting the principal.

content: 4. (=どこを起点とする)to start (at some point)

content.content: 東北線は上野に起こり青森に達す
The North-Eastern Line starts at Ueno, and terminates at Aomori.

content: 5. (=熱や電気が起こる)to be generated

content.content: 物体を摩擦すると熱と電気が起こる
Friction generates heat and electricity.

content: 6. (=火が起こる)to kindle; to be kindled

content.content: 火が起こった
The fire has kindled―The charcoal is kindled.
火が起こったら鍋を掛けて
Put the pot over the fire if it is kindled.

content: 7. (=病気が起こる)to have an attack of (rheumatism); to have a fit of (ague, etc.)

content.content: 親父はリウマチが起こっている
Father has an attack of rheumatism.
リウマチが起こって臥せっております
He is laid up with an attack of rheumatism.
リウマチが起こって引きこもっております
He is confined to his bed with an attack of rheumatism―(他動詞構文にすれば)―An attack of rheumatism has laid him by the heels.
母は瘧が起こっている
Mother has a fit of ague.
持病が起こった
My old enemy is active again.
余病が起こらなければ安心だ
You are safe unless a complication arises.
君の病気は飲み過ぎから起こる
Your illness comes of drinking too much.

content:
おこる〔興る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=勃興する)to rise
2. (=栄える)to prosper; to flourish
3. (=生ずる、できる)to come into being; to spring up

content.content: 武士階級なるものはどうして興ったものか
How did the samurai class come into being?―(他動詞構文にすれば)―What brought the samurai class into existence?
戦後多くの会社が興った
Many companies sprang up after the war.

content:
おこる〔怒る〕
〈自動〉
1. To get angry (with some one for doing something―at anything); to be angered, be displeased, be offended, be vexed, be enraged (at anything―with some one for doing something); to get into a rage; to fly into a passion; to lose one's temper; to get out of temper; to be put out (of humour or temper); to take offence; to take umbrage; to take (it) amiss; to take (it) ill; to take (it) in ill part; to take (it) in dudgeon

content.content: 彼は怒っている、恐ろしく怒っている
He is angry―fearfully angry.
君がそう言ったら彼は怒ったろう
Was he not angry with you for saying so?―angry at your remark?
そう言ったら彼が怒った
At that, he got angry―(他動詞構文にすれば)―That made him angry.
あの人は些細なことで怒る
He will take offense at trifles.
そんなつまらないことで怒るな
Do not get angry at such trifles!―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Do not let such trifles make you angry!―Do not let so slight a thing put you out!
こう言うのは老婆心で言うのだから怒っちゃいけない
I say this out of kindness, so you must not take it ill―take it amiss.
親父が怒っているからお詫びしてくれ給え
My father is displeased with me, so please intercede with him in my behalf.
彼は粗末にもてなされたと思うと怒る
He will take it in dudgeon if he fancies himself to be slightly treated.
彼は悪口を言われても怒らない
He can take a joke in good part.
彼は自分の思うようにならないことがあると怒る
When anything goes wrong with him, he will lose his temper―get out of temper―fly into a passion.
怒って僕を打ったことがある
He once struck me in a passion.
彼は拒絶されてたいそう怒った
He felt himself highly insulted by the refusal.
怒らずにおれるものか
How can I help getting angry?―How can I but be angry?(怒らざるを得ぬ―can not help getting angry―can not but be angry―から出た表現)
誰だって怒るさ
Who can help getting angry?―Who can but be angry?
彼は怒らないでもよいことを怒る
He will work himself into a passion.
彼は気でも狂ったように怒っている
He is frantic with anger―beside himself with anger.
烈火の如く怒っている
He is furious―in a fury.
ぷんぷん怒っている
He is fuming―in a fume―in a huff.
ぶりぶり怒っている
He is fretting and fuming.
真赤になって怒っている、真青になって怒っている
He is red with anger―white with anger.
かっと怒る
to fire up―flame up―flare up
彼は怒った顔をしていた
He looked angry―looked black.
君に怒られる覚悟で言おう
I will dare your anger and say...
彼は怒りやすい
He is quick to take offence.
彼は容易に怒らない、なかなか怒らない
He is slow to take offence―slow to anger―He has a good temper.
僕は我慢して怒らずにいた
I kept my temper―controlled myself.
彼はどんな腹の立つことがあっても怒らない
His temper is equal to any trial.

content: 2. (=怒りつける)to scold; to storm at (one); to give (one) a rating; to give (one) a scolding

content.content: うんと怒ってやった
I gave him a good rating.

content:
おごる〔奢る〕
〈自動〉(=奢りに耽る)to be extravagant; to be luxurious; to indulge in luxury

content.content: 成金は奢っている
The upstarts live in luxury―roll in luxury.
彼は金を儲けても奢らない
His newly acquired wealth has not made him extravagant.
金があるとて奢るな
Do not let your wealth make you extravagant!
彼は口が奢っている
He has a pampered taste―a dainty mouth.

content: 〈自他動〉(=ご馳走する)to stand treat; to give (one) a treat; to treat (one to something); to stand (anything)

content.content: 今日は僕がおごろう
I will stand treat―give you a treat―today.
何を奢ろうか
What shall I treat you to?
シャンペンを奢り給え
Treat us to champagne!
シャンペンを一本おごろう
I will stand a bottle of champagne.
今晩芝居をおごろう
I will take you to the play this evening.
昨晩の芝居は誰がおごったのか
Who paid for our seats in the theatre last evening?
僕を三十と見たのか、おごろう
Do you take me for thirty? You are too flattering.

content: 〈他動〉(=張り込む)to invest in, treat oneself to (some luxury)

content.content: (先生になったから先生らしくしようと思って)金縁の眼鏡を奢った
In order to improve my appearance, I invested in―treated myself to―a pair of gold-rimmed spectacles.

content:
おごる〔驕る〕
〈自動〉To be proud; to be elated (with success, etc.)

content.content: 兵は勝利を得て驕りはせぬか
Are not the men elated with victory?
将は驕り兵は倦む
The officers are elated with victory, and the men are tired of fighting.
成功したとて驕るな
Do not let success elate you!
驕る者は亡ぶ、驕る者は久しからず
“Pride goes before a fall.”

content:
おさ〔長〕
〈名〉The chief; the head

content.content: 天使の長
an archangel

おさ〔筬〕
〈名〉The reed (of a loom)

content:
おさえ〔鎮〕
〈名〉
1. (=殿軍)the rear guard

content.content: 三軍の鎮え
the rear guard of an army

content: 2. (=防遏{ぼうあつ})check; defence; guard

content.content: 関八州の鎮えとなす
He was set to guard―set over―the eight provinces of Kanto.

おさえがたき〔抑え難き〕
〈形〉Uncontrollable (temper); irrepressible (anger); irresistible (impulse, etc.)

content:
おさえつける〔抑え付ける〕
〈他動〉To keep down; to hold down; to pin down; to control; to check; to curb

content.content: 土人はやっと抑えつけておく
The natives are kept down with difficulty.
泥棒をねじ伏せて抑えつけた
I overpowered the burglar and held him down―pinned him to the floor.
走りたがる馬を抑えつける
to curb a horse―check a horse
飛び出したがる猟犬を抑えつける
to hold the hounds in leash
兵が飛び出したがるのをやっと抑えつけておいた
I held my men in leash with difficulty.
若い者は抑えつけられるのをいやがる
The young are impatient of control.
彼は細君を抑えつけてわがままをさせぬ
He keeps his wife under his thumb.

content:
おさえづな〔抑え綱〕
〈名〉A guy

content.content: 天幕を抑え綱で止める
to guy a tent

content:
おさえる〔抑える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=抑え付ける)to keep down; to hold down; to pin down; to control; to restrain; to check; to curb

content.content: 土人はやっと抑えて置く
The natives are kept down with difficulty.
泥棒をねじ伏せて抑えた
I overpowered the burglar and held him down―pinned him to the floor.
生徒は先生には抑えきれぬ
The students are beyond the control of the teachers.
馬を抑える
to curb a horse―check a horse
飛び出そうとする猟犬を抑える
to hold the hounds in leash
人の頭を抑える
to place one under restraint―keep one under control―keep one under one's thumb
学生は頭を抑えられるのをいやがる
The students are impatient of control.
そう頭を抑えられては困る
I can not stand such restraint.
彼は細君の頭を抑えてわがままにさせぬ
He keeps his wife under his thumb.

content: 2. (=抑制する)to control, govern, master, restrain, curb (one's passions); to repress, contain, keep down, hold in (one's anger); to suppress, smother, stifle (one's feelings); to resist (an impulse); to check (one's impetuosity); to repress, keep back, choke down, gulp down (one's tears)

content.content: 情慾を抑える
to control one's passions―govern one's passions―master one's passions―restrain one's passions―curb one's passions
彼は情慾が抑えきれない
He has no control over his passions―He can not keep his passions under control.
情慾は抑え難い
The passions are hard of control.
感情を抑える
to suppress one's feelings―smother one's feelings―stifle one's feelings―control one's feelings
怒りを抑えることができない
I can not repress my anger―contain my anger―control my anger―control my temper―hold in my temper―keep my temper under―keep my anger down.
涙を抑える
to repress one's tears―keep back one's tears―choke down one's tears―gulp down one's tears
笑いを抑え得なかった
I could not stifle a laugh―repress a smile―keep my gravity―keep my countenance.
禁じ難き情を抑える
to resist an impulse
はやる心を抑える
to check one's impetuosity―keep one's impetuosity in check

content: 3. (=防遏する)to check

content.content: 侵入軍を抑える
to check the invaders
敵を抑える
to keep the enemy in check―hold the enemy in check

content: 4. (=捕える)to catch; to take; to arrest; to apprehend

content.content: 犯人は現場で抑えられた
The culprit was arrested on the spot.
現行犯を抑える
to catch one in the act

content: 5. (=抑留する)to keep back; to withhold

content.content: 給料を抑える
to withhold one's salary―stop one's pay―(他からなら)―seize upon one's salary

content: 6. (=差抑える)to seize; to attach

content.content: 財産を抑える
to attach one's property
密商品を抑える
to seize smuggled goods

content: 7. (=蔽う)to cover

content.content: 目を抑える
to cover one's eyes
耳を抑える
to hold one's hands over one's ears

content:
おさおさ
〈副〉Hardly; scarcely

content.content: 用意おさおさ怠り無し
Hardly anything is left unprepared―They have made full preparations.
商売人にもおさおさ劣らぬ手際である
The performance is scarcely inferior to a professional's.

content:
おざがさめる〔お座が冷める〕
〈熟語〉The spell is broken

content.content: 役者が失錯をするとお座が冷める
A blunder on the part of the actor will break the spell.

content:
おさき〔お先き〕
〈名〉
1. (=先立つこと)precedence

content.content: どうぞお先に
After you!
お年頭からお先に
Age before youth!―(こっけいに言えば)―Age before honesty!―Age before respectability!
お先失礼
Excuse my going first!―Excuse me for preceding you!
それではひと足お先に参ります
Then I will go on a step before you.

content: 2. (=未来)the future

content.content: 彼はお先真暗だ
He can not see an inch beyond his nose.

content: 3. (=先棒)a cat's paw

content.content: 人をお先に使う
to make a cat's paw of a man
日本がある国のお先に使われたという者がある
Some people say that Japan was made a cat's paw of by a certain Power.

content: 4. (=主人)one's host

content.content: お先タバコをする
to sponge on one's host for tobacco

content:
おさげ〔お下げ〕
〈名〉Hair hanging down the back

content.content: 髪をお下げに結っている
She wears her hair hanging down her back.

content:
おざしき〔お座敷〕
〈名〉
1. →『

content.content: ざしき〔座敷〕

content:
』
2. (=宴会)a banquet; a drinking-party
3. (=芸人を聘すること)(an artiste's) engagement for the evening

content.content: お座敷がかかる
A singer is offered an engagement―called to a party.
お座敷を受ける
to accept an engagement
お座敷を断る
to decline an engagement
姐さんはお座敷です
Madame is engaged for the evening.
姐さん、お座敷ですよ
There is an engagement for you, madame.
お座敷へ出る
to go to a party―attend a party―(平常なら)―to be open for engagement
姐さんは近頃お座敷へ出ません
Madame is not open for engagement these days.
姐さんはお座敷がうまい
Madame is a good entertainer.
お座敷着
party-dress

content:
おさと〔お里〕
〈名〉One's home; one's origin

content.content: お里が知れる
to betray one's origin―savour of the pan.
女流作家はむずかしい言葉を使うのでお里が知れる
The long words savour of the pan.
そんなことをするとお里が知れてしまうぞ(化けの皮が現れる)
If you do such a thing, you will betray the cloven hoof.

content:
おさない〔幼い〕
〈形〉
1. (=幼少)infant; young; youthful; juvenile; early; of tender years

content.content: 幼い時に
when one was a child―in one's infancy―early in life
彼は幼い時に両親に死に別れた
He lost his parents in his infancy.
ごく幼い時に貰われた
He was adopted in his tenderest years―in his earliest days.
幼い時から
from childhood upward―early
幼い時から天才が現れた
His genius asserted itself early in life―at an early age.
幼い時から語学の才が有った
He early showed an aptitude for languages.
司馬温公は幼い時から聡明であった
Shiba Onko was wise from his childhood upward.
彼はごく幼い時から英語を学んだ
He learned English from his tenderest years.

content: 2. (=幼稚)infant; childish; green; crude; raw; immature; inexperienced

content.content: 芸が幼い
His art is crude―His art is immature.
日本の飛行術はまだ幼い
Japanese aviation is still in its infancy.

content:
おさながお〔幼顔〕
〈名〉One's infant features

content.content: 幼顔が残っている
He still retains some traces of his infant features.
幼顔が残っておらぬ
His infant features are gone.

content:
おさなご〔幼児〕
〈名〉An infant; a child

content.content: 老いては幼児に返る
“Old age is second childhood.”

おさなごい〔幼恋〕
〈名〉Childish love; child-love; calf-love

content:
おさなごころ〔幼心〕
〈名〉A childish mind

content.content: 幼心に聴き分けて
Child as he was, he listened to reason.

content:
おさななじみ〔幼馴染〕
〈名〉A friend of one's infancy

content.content: あの人とは幼なじみ(竹馬の友)だ
We have known each other since we were boys together.

content:
おざなり〔お座なり〕
〈名〉What everybody does

content.content: お座なりをやる
to do what everybody does
お座なりを言う
to say what everybody does―agree with everybody
いい加減のお座なりを言う男だ
He makes a point of agreeing with everybody.

content:
おさまり〔収まり〕
〈名〉
1. (=落着)end; termination; conclusion; settlement

content.content: 収まりがつく
to come to an end―come to a termination―come to a conclusion―come to a settlement―be settled
事件は収まりがついた
The matter has come to a settlement―The matter is settled.
この騒動は容易に収まりがつきそうもない
The trouble is not likely to come to an end very soon.
もう収まりがついた
It is at an end―It is over.
収まりをつける
to bring the matter to an end―bring the matter to a termination―bring the matter to a settlement―settle the matter

content: 2. (=処置、処分)disposal

content.content: この身の納まりがつかない
I do not know how to dispose of myself―I do not know what to do with myself.
身の納まりがついた
I have disposed of myself―I have settled down.

content:
おさまりかえる〔納まり返る〕
〈自動〉To be unconcerned; to be unmoved; to be nonchalant; to be cool; to be indifferent; to be calm and serene; to be as cool as a cucumber; to show the utmost sang-froid

content.content: 彼はどんな危険に逢っても納まり返っている
He is perfectly calm and serene in the presence of any danger.
彼らは人の溺死するのを納まり返って見ている
They can look on quite unmoved―with perfect unconcern―with the utmost sang-froid―at a drowning man.
彼は息子の訃音に接しても納まり返っていた
He received the news of his son's death with perfect unconcern―with perfect composure―with perfect indifference―with perfect nonchalance.
納まり返った顔をして眺めている
He looks on with an unmoved countenance―without moving a muscle of his face.
納まり返ったふうをして突立っている
He stands with an unconcerned air―with a nonchalant air.
彼はいくら借金があっても納まり返っている
With all his debts, he is perfectly calm and serene.

content:
おさまる〔治まる、納まる、収まる、修まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=泰平なり)to enjoy peace; to rejoice in peace; to be peaceful; to be tranquil

content.content: 国が治まった
The country is restored to peace.
国が治まっている(天下泰平)
The country enjoys peace―The country rejoices in peace―Peace reigns over the land.
民が治まる
The people return to their duty.
治まる御代
a peaceful reign
治まった家、治まらぬ家
a well-regulated family―an ill-regulated household

content: 2. (=鎮まる、鎮定する)to be repressed; to be suppressed; to be subdued; to be quelled; to subside

content.content: 内乱が治まった
The rebellion is suppressed―subdued.
この乱はいつ治まるだろうか
When will this war come to an end?
乱が治まった
The war is at an end―over.
騒動がちと治まってからのことにしよう
We shall postpone the matter till the disturbance has subsided a little.
火事が治まった
The fire is got under.
暴雨風が治まった
The storm has subsided―blown over.

content: 3. (=済む、片づく、落着する)to cease; to come to an end ［a termination, a conclusion］; to be brought to an end ［a termination, a conclusion］; to be settled; to come to a settlement

content.content: 事件はもう収まった
The matter has come to a settlement―The matter is settled.
首尾好く治まった
The matter has been brought to a happy termination.
速やかに収まればよい
I wish the matter would be brought to a speedy conclusion.
事がもう収まった
The matter has come to an end―been brought to an end―The matter is at an end―over.
このけんかは血を見なけりゃ治まらぬ
The quarrel can not be settled without bloodshed.
無事に治まる
to come right―come to nothing
結局無事に治まるだろう
All will come right―come round―in the end.
無事に治まった
All is right again.
事件が無事に治まった
The affair has come to nothing―Nothing has come of the affair.
事が円く治まった
The matter has been brought to an amicable settlement.
けんかが円く治まった
The quarrel has been smoothed over.
二人の間は円く治まった
They have become reconciled―made up with each other.
痛みが治まる
The pain ceases.
この薬を飲むと痛みが治まります
This medicine will quiet your pain―relieve you of your pain.
癪が治まる
to recover from a fit of spasm
痔の治まるような顔をしている
He looks as if he were recovering from the pain of piles.

content: 4. (=納付される)to be paid

content.content: 税がまだ納まらない
The taxes are not yet paid―still in arrears.

content: 5. (=元に帰る、復旧する)to be restored (to its former state); to be reinstated in one's former position

content.content: (一時地位を失った人が)元に納まった
He is in his place again―reinstated in his former position.
金の鯱{しゃちほこ}は元へ納まった
The golden dolphins are restored to their places.
剣が鞘に納まっている
The sword sleeps in the scabbard.
離縁された妻が元の鞘に納まる
A divorced wife is reinstated―taken back to her husband's bosom.

content: 6. (=処分が付く)to be disposed of

content.content: この身が納まらぬ
I do not know how to dispose of myself―I do not know what to do with myself.
身の納まりどころができた
I can now dispose of myself―I know now what to do with myself.
身が納まった
I have disposed of myself―I have settled down.

content: 7. (=澄ましている)to be grave; to be demure

content.content: お転婆娘は今はお母さんになって納まっている
The romping girl is now a grave matron.
あの暴れ者が今は校長さんで納まっている
The wild fellow is now a demure principal.

content: 8. (=行いを正しくする)to conduct oneself well; to govern oneself

content.content: 彼は行いが修まっている
He is well conducted.
行いが修まらない
He is ill conducted.
一身修らざれば一国も治め難し
He who can not govern himself, can not govern a country.

content:
おさめ〔納め〕
〈名〉The last (of anything)

content.content: 何でもし納めをする
to do anything for the last time
見納めをする
to see anything for the last time―see the last of anything
これが故郷の見納めだ
I now see my home for the last time―This is my last visit to my native place―This is my farewell visit to my native place.
あれが彼の見納めだった
That was the last I saw of him.
酒の飲み納めをした
I have drunk my last cup.
これがご奉公の仕納めだ
This is my last service to my country.

content:
おさめる〔治める、納める、収める、修め、蔵める、理める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=統治する)to rule over, to reign over, govern (a country, etc.)

content.content: 国を治める
to rule over a country―govern a country
一身修まらざれば一国は治め難し
One who can not govern himself, can not govern a country.
武力をもって治めた
He ruled by the sword.
民を治める
to rule over the people―govern the people―hold the people in subjection

content: 2. (=整理する、処理する)to manage; to regulate; to order; to administer

content.content: 一国を治める
to administer the affairs of state
一家を治める
to manage a household―order a household―regulate a household
男は外を治め女は内を治む
“Man for the field, woman for the hearth.”
髪を理める
to dress one's hair

content: 3. (=鎮める、鎮定する)to put down; to repress; to suppress; to subdue; to quell

content.content: 内乱を治める
to suppress a rebellion―subdue a rebellion
暴動を治める
to suppress a riot―put down a riot
紛擾を治める
to quell a disturbance

content: 4. (=済ます、片づける)to bring (a matter) to an end ［a termination, a conclusion, a settlement］; to settle

content.content: 事を治める
to settle a matter
事を首尾好く治める
to bring the matter to a happy termination
事を円く治める
to bring the matter to an amicable settlement
けんかを円く治める
to smoothe over a quarrel
二人の仲を円く治める
I have reconciled the two friends.

content: 5. (=納付する)to pay

content.content: 税を納める
to pay the taxes
彼は千円の地租を納める
He pays a land-tax of 1,000 yen.
月謝を納める
to pay the monthly fee

content: 6. (=受納する)to accept

content.content: 軽少ながらお納め下さい
Please accept a trifling present.
ほんの薄志ですがお納め下さいませんか
Will you accept a slight token of my gratitude?

content: 7. (=奉納する)to dedicate, consecrate, present (anything to a deity)

content.content: 神社に額を納める
to dedicate a votive tablet to a shrine

content: 8. (=入れる)to supply, serve (a family with some article)

content.content: お屋敷へ日用品を納めます
We supply the Hall (with commodities).
手前どもでは宮内省へ魚類を納めております
We serve the Imperial Household with fish.
こんな品は納まらない
Such articles will not do.

content: 9. (=収蔵する)to put away; to store; to garner; to keep

content.content: 物品を倉に蔵める
to store goods
米を倉に蔵める
to garner rice up or away
弓を箱に納めて置く
The bows are kept in cases.
金を懐に納めなさい
Put the money in your pocket!
遺骨を納める
to consign the remains to the grave
そのことを胸に蔵めて人には言わぬ
I keep the matter to myself.

content: 10. (=旧に復す)to restore, return, put back (anything to or in its place)

content.content: 金の鯱{しゃちほこ}を元へ納めた
The golden dolphins were restored to their places.
刀を鞘に納める
to return the sword to its scabbard―put back the sword in its sheath―sheathe the sword―put up the blade
元の鞘に納める
to reinstate a divorced wife―take her back to one's bosom

content: 11. (=終る)to finish

content.content: 書き納める
to finish writing
見納める
to see anything for the last time―see the last of anything
干戈を納める
to sheathe the sword

content: 12. (=収得する)to obtain; to gain; to realize; to reap; to harvest

content.content: 利益を収める
to make a profit―clear a profit―realize a profit
一万円の純益を収めた
He has cleared 10,000 yen.
効果を収める
to reap the fruits―harvest the fruits―(of something)
彼は勉強の効果を収めている
He is reaping the fruits of his industry.
日本は戦勝の効果を収めた
Japan has reaped the fruits of her victory.
人は善悪の効果を収める
Man must harvest the fruits of good or evil deeds.
好結果を収める
to obtain a good result
勝利を収める
to gain a victory

content: 13. (=集める)to gather; to collect

content.content: 敗残の兵を収める
to rally scattered troops

content: 14. (=学ぶ、研究する)to cultivate; to pursue; to practise; to study:(究める意味なら)to master; to complete

content.content: 学問を修める、学術を修める
to pursue knowledge―(仕上げるの意味なら)―complete one's education
彼は大学で法律を修めた
He has studied law at the University.
文学を修める
to study literature―cultivate literature
芸術を修める
to cultivate art―practise art
道を修める
to cultivate virtue―practise virtue
武芸を修める
to practise the use of arms
文武両道を修める
to cultivate the arts of war and peace
業を修める、一芸を修める
to make oneself master of one's business―(女なら)―make oneself mistress of one's business
彼(女)は一芸を修めている
He is master of his business―She is mistress of her business.
英語を修める
to study English―master English
三年かかればひと通りの英語は修められる
One might master plain English in the three years.

content: 15. (=正しくする)to order

content.content: 身を修める
to order one's life―lead a virtuous life―lead a noble life―attain a noble life―attain moral excellence―cultivate moral excellence

content.content: 神社に額を納める
to dedicate a votive tablet to a shrine

content: 8. (=入れる)to supply, serve (a family with some article)

content.content: お屋敷へ日用品を納めます
We supply the Hall (with commodities).
手前どもでは宮内省へ魚類を納めております
We serve the Imperial Household with fish.
こんな品は納まらない
Such articles will not do.

content: 9. (=収蔵する)to put away; to store; to garner; to keep

content.content: 物品を倉に蔵める
to store goods
米を倉に蔵める
to garner rice up or away
弓を箱に納めて置く
The bows are kept in cases.
金を懐に納めなさい
Put the money in your pocket!
遺骨を納める
to consign the remains to the grave
そのことを胸に蔵めて人には言わぬ
I keep the matter to myself.

content: 10. (=旧に復す)to restore, return, put back (anything to or in its place)

content.content: 金の鯱{しゃちほこ}を元へ納めた
The golden dolphins were restored to their places.
刀を鞘に納める
to return the sword to its scabbard―put back the sword in its sheath―sheathe the sword―put up the blade
元の鞘に納める
to reinstate a divorced wife―take her back to one's bosom

content: 11. (=終る)to finish

content.content: 書き納める
to finish writing
見納める
to see anything for the last time―see the last of anything
干戈を納める
to sheathe the sword

content: 12. (=収得する)to obtain; to gain; to realize; to reap; to harvest

content.content: 利益を収める
to make a profit―clear a profit―realize a profit
一万円の純益を収めた
He has cleared 10,000 yen.
効果を収める
to reap the fruits―harvest the fruits―(of something)
彼は勉強の効果を収めている
He is reaping the fruits of his industry.
日本は戦勝の効果を収めた
Japan has reaped the fruits of her victory.
人は善悪の効果を収める
Man must harvest the fruits of good or evil deeds.
好結果を収める
to obtain a good result
勝利を収める
to gain a victory

content: 13. (=集める)to gather; to collect

content.content: 敗残の兵を収める
to rally scattered troops

content: 14. (=学ぶ、研究する)to cultivate; to pursue; to practise; to study:(究める意味なら)to master; to complete

content.content: 学問を修める、学術を修める
to pursue knowledge―(仕上げるの意味なら)―complete one's education
彼は大学で法律を修めた
He has studied law at the University.
文学を修める
to study literature―cultivate literature
芸術を修める
to cultivate art―practise art
道を修める
to cultivate virtue―practise virtue
武芸を修める
to practise the use of arms
文武両道を修める
to cultivate the arts of war and peace
業を修める、一芸を修める
to make oneself master of one's business―(女なら)―make oneself mistress of one's business
彼(女)は一芸を修めている
He is master of his business―She is mistress of her business.
英語を修める
to study English―master English
三年かかればひと通りの英語は修められる
One might master plain English in the three years.

content: 15. (=正しくする)to order

content.content: 身を修める
to order one's life―lead a virtuous life―lead a noble life―attain a noble life―attain moral excellence―cultivate moral excellence

content:
おさらい〔お浚い〕
〈名〉
1. (=温習)review

content.content: 過去のおさらいをする
to review one's past

content:
2. (=唄のおさらい)(a singing master's) examination day
3. (=芝居のおさらい)a rehearsal

おさらば
〈間投詞〉Farewell!; Adieu!; Good-bye!

content.content: おさらばでござる
I must bid you farewell―I must say good-bye.
おさらばをきめる
to take French leave―abscond
甘い汁を吸ってしまえばすぐおさらばをきめる
As soon as he has sucked you dry, he will say good-bye to you.

おさんどん〔お爨どん〕
〈名〉A kitchen-maid; a kitchen drudge; a scullery-maid:(下宿屋のお爨どん)a slavey

content:
おし〔唖〕
〈名〉A deaf and dumb person; a deaf-mute:(=の) dumb

content.content: 唖の旅行
a dumb tour
唖の旅行で言葉が通じなくて困った
As I did not know the language of the country, I had much ado to make myself understood.

content:
おし〔押し〕
〈名〉Push; weight; authority; boldness; self-confidence; effrontery; impudence; audacity:(殊に英国にては) assurance:(米国にては)cheek

content.content: 押しが強い
to be pushing―bold―confident―impudent―audacious―cool―cheeky
あれで英語を教えるとは押しが強い
It is bold of him to teach English.
英国人は押しが強い
Englishmen have assurance.
米国人は押しが強い
Americans have cheek.
押しが弱い
to be faint-hearted―timid
押しが弱いために地位を得損なった
He failed to secure the position for want of assurance.
恋は押し(一押し二金三男)
“Faint heart never won fair lady.”
あの人の言うことは押しが利く
His words carry weight.
大家の言は押しが利く
A great scholar speaks with authority.

content:
おじ〔叔父、伯父、小父〕
〈名〉An uncle

content.content: (よその)小父さん
Uncle
伯(叔)父さんぶる
to come the uncle over one

content:
おじ〔叔父、伯父、小父〕
〈名〉An uncle

content.content: (よその)小父さん
Uncle
伯(叔)父さんぶる
to come the uncle over one

content:
おじ〔叔父、伯父、小父〕
〈名〉An uncle

content.content: (よその)小父さん
Uncle
伯(叔)父さんぶる
to come the uncle over one

content:
おしあい〔押し合い〕
〈名〉
1. A jostle; a hustle; a crush; a squeeze:(=する) to jostle one another; to hustle one another; to crowd one another

content.content: いつも入口で押し合いが始まる
There is always a squeeze at the door.
人々押し合いへし合いをして待つ
People wait jostling one another.

content: 2. (=値段の押し合い)bargaining about the terms; haggling over the price:(=する) to bargain about the terms; to haggle over the price

content.content: 東京人は値段の押し合いをしない
Tokyo people do not haggle over the price.

おしあう〔押し合う〕
〈自動〉
1. To jostle one another; to hustle one another; to crowd one another
2. (=値段を押合う)to bargain about the terms; to haggle over the price

content:
おしあける〔押し明ける〕
〈名〉To push open; to force open

content.content: 戸を押し明けようとした
I tried to force the door open.

おしあげる〔押し上げる〕
〈名〉To push up; to thrust up; to force up

content:
おしあてる〔押し当てる〕
〈他動〉To push; hold (one thing against another)

content.content: 壁に押当てられた
I was held against the wall―He held me against the wall.

content:
おしあるく〔押し歩く〕
〈自動〉To stalk along

content.content: 大道狭しと押し歩く
They stalk the streets―lord it over the town.

content:
おしい〔惜しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=惜しむべき、遺憾な、残念な)regrettable; to be regretted; (it is) a pity (that it is so):(主観的に訳せば)to regret (anything); to be sorry (for anything)

content.content: 今日天気の悪いのは惜しいことだ
It is regrettable that―It is to be regretted that―It is a pity that―the weather is bad today.
大事な時計を無くなして惜しいことをした
I am sorry I have lost my watch―I regret my loss.
君が中途で廃学するのはいかにも惜しいことだ
It is a great pity that―It is a thousand pities that―What a pity that―you should give up your studies in mid-career(!)
お父様のおられないのは返す返すも惜しいことだ
Your father's absence is never enough to be regretted.
幕になった時は惜しかった、惜しいところで幕になった
We regretted the curtain falling―The curtain fell but too soon―all too soon―only too soon.
演説が終わった時は実に惜しかった
We regretted the speech coming to an end―The speech ended but too soon―all too soon―only too soon.
惜しい哉文章が悪い
It is a pity that the style is bad―The style is but too bad.
その説は惜しい哉事実だ
The statement is but too true.
彼の欠点は惜しい哉事実だ
I know his fault but too well.
行かないで惜しいことをした(行きたかった)
I am sorry I was not there―I wish I had been there―I should like to have been there.
彼に逢わないで惜しいことをした(逢いたかった)
I am sorry I missed meeting him―I wish I had met him―I should like to have met him.
その光景を君が見ないのは惜しかった(君に見せたかった)
It is a pity that you did not see the sight―You should have seen the sight.
その演説を君が聞かないのは惜しかった(君に聞かせたかった)
It is a pity that you did not hear the speech―You should have heard the speech.
君がここにいないのは惜しかった
It is a pity that you were not here―You should have been here.
(医者まさりの)君を医者にしないのは惜しかった(君を医者にしたかった)
It is a pity that you are not a physician―You should have been a physician.
君が去るのは惜しい
I am sorry you are going―I regret your departure.
彼が去っても惜しくない
I do not regret his departure.
惜しき袂を別つ
to tear oneself from one's companion

content: 2. (=惜むべき、大事な、貴重な)precious; dear (to one):(主観的に訳せば)to cling to (anything); to be unwilling to part with (anything)

content.content: 命が惜しい
Life is dear to me―I hold my life dear―I cling to my life.
誰も命は惜しい
Life is dear to everybody.
国家に捧げた命は惜しくはない
I do not cling to a life which I have offered to my country.
君のためなら命も惜しくない
I would die for you.
命が惜しくばそこ一歩でも動くな
Do not, for your life, stir from the spot!―Stir at the peril of your life!
河豚は食いたし命は惜しい
“Honey is sweet, but the bee stings.”
時間が惜しい
Time is precious.
試験が済むまでは一時間でも惜しい
A single hour is precious to me before the examination is over.
この品は手放すのは惜しい
I do not like to part with the article.
この品は惜しいけれども君のことなら上げよう
I do not like to part with the article―I can ill spare the article―but I will do so for your sake.
彼が死んで惜しいことをした、惜しい人を殺した
I am sorry he is dead―We could not spare him―We could have spared a better man.
彼が死んだのは国家のために惜しい
He is a loss to his country.
彼が去るのは学校のために惜しい
He is a loss to the school.
彼は僅かばかりの金を惜しそうにしてくれる
He grudges me the pittance he gives.
惜しい金
a hoard

content: 3. (=あたら惜しい、もったいない)wasteful

content.content: 捨てるのは惜しい
It is a waste to throw it away.
あんな奴に金をやるのは惜しい
It is a sheer waste of money to give it him―The money is as good as thrown away.
米で酒を造るのは惜しい
It is a waste of the good things of this life―It is sinful waste―to make rice into sake.
そんな品ならいくら出しても惜しくない
I would give anything for such an article.

content: 4. (=もったいない、善過ぎる)(to be) too good for (one); to be worthy of a better cause

content.content: 彼には惜しいような細君だ
She is too good for him―She deserves a better husband.
この芥臭い俗界には惜しいような潔白な人だ
He is too pure for this dusty world.
彼はあんな社会には惜しいような上品な人だ
He is too refined for such vulgar society.
あの熱心は惜しいものだ
His zeal is worthy of a better cause.
この口へ茶を入れるのは惜しい
My thirst is worthy of a better cause.
彼の学識はこんな学校には惜しいものだ
His attainments are worthy of a better place.
あの人を英語の先生にしておくのは惜しいものだ
He deserves a better place than that of an English teacher.
あんなことをさしておくには惜しい男だ
He is too good for his present position―He is worthy of better things―He has “a soul above buttons.”

content:
おじいさん〔お爺さん〕
〈名〉
1. (=祖父)a grandfather; grandpapa; grandpa
2. (=老爺)an old man

content.content: もういいお爺さんだ
He is quite old now.

content:
おしいただく〔押し戴く〕
〈他動〉To raise (anything) to one's head (in token of respect or gratitude)

content.content: 殿のお墨付を押し戴いて之を開いた
He raised his lord's autograph to his head before opening it.

おしいり〔押入り〕
〈名〉(事)robbery:(人)a robber

content:
おしいる〔押し入る〕
〈自動〉To force one's way in; to enter by force; to make a forcible entry (into a house)

content.content: 昨夜あの家へ強盗が押し入った
Last night a robber entered that house by force―There was a forcible entry into that house.

おしいれ〔押入れ〕
〈名〉A press; a closet

content:
おしいれる〔押し入れる〕
〈他動〉To push in; to force in; to thrust in

content.content: 人を室内へ押し入れる
to force a man into a room

content:
おしうつる〔推し移る〕
〈自動〉To pass; to change

content.content: 月日は推し移る
Time passes.
世は推し移る
The times change.
世と共に推し移る
to move with the times

content:
おしうり〔押売り〕
〈名〉Forcing a sale:(=する) to force a sale; to force (an article on one)

content.content: この品を押売りされた
This article was forced upon me―I had this article forced upon me.
意見ばかりは押売りができない
You can not force your views on others―There is no forcing of views upon people.

content:
おしえ〔教え〕
〈名〉
1. (=教訓)one's teachings; instruction; a lessen; a precept; an injunction

content.content: 孔孟の教え
the teachings of the Chinese sages
不幸に逢ったのが好い教えになった
The misfortune was a good lesson to me.
先生には中学校で教えを受けた
I received instruction from him―He taught me―at the middle school.
彼は当代第一流の学者の教えを受けている
He has sat at the feet of the first scholars of the age.
教えを仰ぐ
to ask for instruction―receive instruction
師の教えを守れ
Keep your teacher's precepts.
彼は固く親の教えを守っている
He obeys his father's injunctions to the letter.

content: 2. (=教義)a religious teaching; a doctrine; a tenet; a creed; a faith; a religion

content.content: 教えに則る
to live up to one's faith―follow one's teachings
釈迦の教え
the doctrines of Sakyamuni―Buddhism
ありがたい教え
the blessed gospel
キリストの教え
Christianity
孔子の教え
Confucianism

content:
おしえかた〔教え方〕
〈名〉The method of teaching

content.content: あの先生は教え方が上手だ
He is a good teacher―He has tact in teaching.

content:
おしえぐさ〔教え草〕
〈名〉A lessen; a moral

content.content: 小説を教え草にする
to moralize a fable
人の名などを引いて教え草にする
to use a name to point a moral

おしえこむ〔教え込む〕
〈他動〉To inculcate (a duty on one); to instil (a principle into one's mind); to implant (an idea in one's mind); to train (a boy to some trade)

content:
おしえる〔教える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=教授する)to teach (English―one English―English to a class); to instruct (one in languages); to give lessons in (tea-ceremony); to initiate (one into the mysteries of a trade)

content.content: 英語を教える
to teach English
あの先生に英語を教えて貰った
He has taught me English―instructed me in English.
彼は五年級の英語を教えている
He teaches English to the Fifth Year Class.
手紙の書き方を教えて下さい
Teach me how to write a letter.
あの婦人は生花を教えている
She gives lessons in flower-arrangement.
彼は商売の秘訣を教えてくれた
He initiated me into the mysteries of the trade―put me up to the tricks of the trade.
文法などを繰返し繰返し教える
to grind one in grammar
この本を教えている
I read this book with my students.
教えるは学びの半ば
“To teach is to learn.”

content: 2. (=教示する)to let (one) know; to tell (one of something); to inform (one of a fact); to acquaint (one with a fact); to show (one the way); to point out (the beauties to one); to direct (one to a place); to refer (one to a house); to give (one) advice (how to act)

content.content: 道を教える
to show one the way―(口でなら)―tell one the way
場所を教える、家を教える
to direct one to a place―refer one to a house
人に道を教えて貰った
A man showed me the way―directed me to the place.
教えられた家がじきにわかった
I soon found the house I was referred to.
なお委しいことは幹事に聞くように教えてやった
I referred him to my manager for further particulars.
誰も教えてくれないものだから君の着いたことを知らずにいた
No one told me of your arrival―informed me of your arrival.
やり方を教えて上げよう
I will show you how to do it.
本物が見当たったら教えてくれ給え
If you come across a genuine article, please let me know.
シェークスピアなどの美点は教えられて初めてわかる
You do not see the beauties of Shakespeare till they are pointed out to you.

content:
おじおじ〔怖々〕
〈副〉Timidly; nervously:(=する) to be timid; to be nervous; to falter; to cower

content.content: 彼は人前へ出るとおじおじして口もきけない
He is so timed in company that he can not speak.
田舎者で何を言われてもおじおじしている
She is a rustic, and only cowers for fear when spoken to.
おじおじして返事もできない
She faltered and could not answer―She was too nervous to answer.
試験管の前へ出るとおじおじして知っていることまでも忘れてしまう
One grows so nervous before one's examiners that one often stands in one's own light.

content:
おじか〔牡鹿〕
〈名〉A stag; a buck:(五歳以上の牡鹿)a hart

content.content: 牡鹿と牝鹿
stag and hind―buck and doe

おしかえす〔押し返す〕
〈他動〉To force (anything) back

おしかけきゃく〔押掛け客〕
〈名〉An unbidden guest

content:
おしかけにょうぼう〔押掛け女房〕
〈名〉A wife who forces herself upon a man

content.content: あれは押しかけ女房だ
She forced herself upon him.

content:
おしかける〔押掛ける〕
〈自動〉To force oneself upon (another); to force one's company upon (another); to go unbidden to (a house)

content.content: 僕と付合うのが恥かしいなら押しかけはせぬ
If you are ashamed to be seen with me, I will not force my company upon you.
生徒が校長の宅へどやどやと押しかけた
The students went in a body to the principal's residence.
彼らは時を嫌わず押しかけて来る
They come at all sorts of hours.

content:
おしがみ〔押紙〕
〈名〉Blotting-paper; a blotter

content.content: 押紙で押す
to blot a page

おしがり〔押し借り〕
〈名〉Robbery:(=する) to rob (a man of his money, etc.)

content:
おしがる〔惜しがる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: おしむ〔惜しむ〕

content:
おじぎ〔お辞儀〕
〈名〉
1. (=黙礼)a bow; an obeisance:(=する) to bow (to one); to make a bow (to one); to make an obeisance (to a superior); to make one's honours; to make one's manners

content.content: ていねいにお辞儀する
to bow low―make a low bow
恭しくお辞儀する
to make a respectful obeisance (to a superior)
互いにお辞儀する
to bow to each other―exchange bows
(子どもに向かって)お辞儀は(?)
Where is your manners?

content: 2. (=遠慮)(=する) to decline (a favour)

content.content: 決してお辞儀は致しません
I am only too glad to accept it.
お辞儀無しに頂戴します
I will take it as freely as it is given.

おじぎそう〔含羞草〕
〈名〉The sensitive plant

content:
おしきって〔押切って〕
〈副〉Boldly; daringly; venturesomely

content.content: 押切ってやる
to dare to do―venture to do―anything
押切って反対を試みた
I ventured to oppose the measure.
押切って言おう
I will venture to say―take upon me to say―speak out.
誰も押切ってその話を切り出す者は無かった
No one had the courage to break the ice.

おしきり〔押切り〕
〈名〉A straw-cutter

content:
おじけ〔怖気〕
〈名〉Fear; fright; awe; panic; timidity; nervousness; funk

content.content: 怖気がつく
to be seized with fear―overcome with fright―frightened―struck with awe―awed―seized with a panic―to become timid―become nervous―get into a funk
彼は試験官の前へ出ると怖気がついてものが言えなかった
He was so much awed by his examiners that his tongue failed him.
演壇に登ると怖気がついて演説のできない人がある
Some people are so nervous on the platform that they can not make a speech.
買手は怖気がついている
The buyers are in a panic―seized with a panic.
彼は失敗して怖気がついている
Failure has made him timid.
兵は敵の優勢なのを見て怖気がついた
The men were frightened by the superior numbers of the enemy.

content:
おしげもなく〔惜気も無く〕
〈副〉Without regret; without stint; without reluctance; with an unsparing hand; ungrudgingly; freely; generously; liberally; lavishly

content.content: 彼は惜気も無く金をふりまく
He lavishes money with an unsparing hand.
惜気も無く資本を投ずる
He invests capital without stint.
惜気も無く黒髪を根からプッツリ切った
She cut her raven locks, without regret, at the root.
惜気も無く施す
He gives freely.
惜気も無く持ち物を人にくれる
He is free with his possessions―generous with his possessions.

content:
おじける〔怖ける〕
〈自動〉To fear; to be seized with fear; to be frightened; to be overcome with fright; to be awed; to be struck with awe; to be seized with a panic; to be in a panic; to grow timid; to become nervous; to get into a funk; to be in a funk; to be cowed; to cower

content.content: 彼は裁判官の前へ出ると怖けてものが言えなかった
He was so much awed by authority that his tongue failed him.
初めて演壇に登った時は怖けて演説ができなかった
The first time I found myself on the platform, I was so nervous that I could not speak.
改革の噂で役人どもは怖けている
The rumour of a reform has thrown the officials into a panic.
彼は幾度もやり損なって怖けている
A series of failures has made him timid.
兵は優勢の敵を見て怖けた
The men were frightened by the superior numbers of the enemy.

おしこみ〔押込み〕
〈名〉
1. (=押入れ)a press
2. (=強盗)a robber

content:
おしこむ〔押込む〕
〈他動〉To push in; to thrust in; to press in; to force in; to stuff in; to crowd (people into a room); to cram (people into a room); to squeeze (people into a room); to jam (things into a space)

content.content: 大勢の人を狭い部屋へギュウギュウ押込む
to crowd―cram―squeeze―many people into a small room
多くの物を狭い処へギュウギュウ押込む
to squeeze―jam―many things into a narrow space
押込めばもっと入る
Some more may be squeezed in―jammed in.
ポケットへ新聞紙を押込んだ
I stuffed a newspaper into my pocket.

content:
おしこめる〔押込める〕
〈他動〉To confine; to shut (one) up; to look (one) up

content.content: 我らは一室へ押込められた
We were locked up in a room.

おしころす〔圧し殺す〕
〈他動〉To squeeze (a man) to death

content:
おしそう〔惜しそう〕
〈副〉Grudgingly; reluctantly; as if unwilling to part with (anything)

content.content: 彼は品を手放すのが惜しそうだ
He seems unwilling to part with the article.
彼は僅かばかりの金を惜しそうにしてくれる
He gives me the pittance with a reluctant air―He grudges me the pittance he gives.

おしたおす〔押し倒す〕
〈他動〉To push down

content:
おしだし〔押出し〕
〈名〉Appearance; exterior; presence

content.content: 押出しの好い人だ
He is a man of prepossessing exterior―a man of fine presence―a presentable man―a personable man.

content:
おしだす〔押し出す〕
〈他動〉To push out; to force out; to squeeze out; to crowd out

content.content: あの相撲は力ずくで相手を土俵から押し出すばかりだ
He only forces his antagonist out of the ring by sheer strength.

content:
おしたてる〔押し立てる〕
〈他動〉To raise (a flag)

content.content: 旗を押し立てる
to raise the standard―unfurl the banner―fling out the banner
旗を押し立てて入城した
They made a triumphal entry with the colours flying.

content:
おしつけがましい〔押付けがましい〕
〈形〉Quasi-compulsory

content.content: 押つけがましいようだがどうかそう願えまいか
I do not mean to force you, but couldn't you do it?

content:
おしつける〔押し付ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (上からなら)to press down; to press upon (something):(横になら)to push, press, hold, pin (one against something)

content.content: 壁に押しつけられた
He held me against the wall―I was pinned against the wall.

content: 2. (=強制する)to force, compel, constrain (one to do something)

content.content: この仕事を押しつけられて引受けた
I was compelled to undertake the work.
押しつけた縁は続かぬ
“Forced love does not last.”

content: 3. (=売り付ける、押し売りする)to force, impose, foist, pass, palm off, father (anything upon one)

content.content: 日本は戦争を押しつけられたのだ
The war was forced upon Japan―Japan had the war forced upon her.
偽物を押しつけられた
A false article was imposed upon me―foisted upon me―passed upon me―palmed off upon me.
主人が番頭に娘を押しつけようとした
The master tried to force his daughter upon his manager.
彼は自分の子どもを書生に押しつけた
He fathered his child upon his house-boy.

content:
おしつけわざ〔押し付け業〕
〈名〉Force; compulsion

content.content: 恋ばかりは押しつけ業にはいかぬ
Love can not be won by force.

content:
おしつぶす〔圧し潰す〕
〈他動〉To crush

content.content: 倒れた家の下敷になって圧しつぶされて死んだ
He was crushed to death beneath the fallen house.

content:
おしつまる〔押し詰まる〕
〈自動〉To approach the end of the year

content.content: いよいよおしつまりました
The year draws to a close.
一週間におしつまりました
We are only a week from the year-end.
おしつまってさぞお忙しいでしょう
You must be busy at this time of the year.

content:
おしつめる〔押し詰める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=押して詰める)to press in; to pack (anything) tight

content.content: 蜜柑を箱へ押し詰める
to pack oranges in a box

content: 2. (=圧迫する)to press (one) hard

content.content: 敵に押しつめられた
We were pressed hard by the enemy.
相撲が相手をじりじりと土俵際へ押しつめた
He pushed his adversary slowly and steadily to the edge of the ring.

content:
おして〔押して〕
〈副〉
1. (=無理に)forcibly; importunately

content.content: 押して頼む
to request one with importunity―importune one
押して頼めば何でもなさる
You can importune him into doing anything―He is very obliging―very accommodating.

content: 2. (=それにもかかわらず)nevertheless; notwithstanding

content.content: 病気だったけれども押して出席した
I was ill, nevertheless I attended the meeting―I was ill, but I attended the meeting notwithstanding.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉(=にもかかわらず)notwithstanding; in spite of

content.content: 病気を押して出席した
I attended the meeting notwithstanding my illness―in spite of my illness―My illness did not prevent my attending the meeting.

content:
おしてしる〔推して知る〕
〈他動〉To infer (something from facts)

content.content: 余りは推して知るべし
The rest may be inferred.

content:
おしでる〔押し出る〕
〈他動〉To push one's way out

content.content: 世に押し出る
to push to the front

content:
おしとおす〔押し通す〕
〈自動〉To persevere in a course; to persist in a course

content.content: どこまでもこの方針で押し通すつもりだ
I mean to persevere in my course.
我意を押し通す
to persist in one's opinion
己が信ずるところを押し通す
to persist in one's belief
彼はどこまでも知らぬ存ぜぬで押し通した
He persisted in denying his knowledge.
その心掛けで押し通すが好い
You ought to persevere in that attitude of mind.
彼はとうとう強情を押し通した
He held out―stood out―to the end.
大胆に押し通す
to brave it out
ずうずうしく押し通す
to brazen it out

おしとおる〔押し通る〕
〈他動〉To force one's way through (the world); to push one's way through, thrust through (a crowd)

おしとめる〔押し止める〕
〈他動〉To prevent (one from doing something); to restrain (one's activity, etc.)

content:
おしどり〔鴛鴦〕
〈名〉The mandarin duck

content.content: 番{つがい}離れぬおしどり(に相当するは)
