the turtle-dove

content:
おしながす〔押し流す〕
〈他動〉To wash away; to sweep away; to carry away; to bear away

content.content: 橋が洪水で押し流された
The bridge was swept away by the flood.
舟が押し流されて沖へ出た
The boat was carried away to the open sea―driven out to sea.
泳ぎ手が流れに押し流されて河の真中へ出た
The swimmer was borne away by the current into the middle of the river.
津浪で全村押し流された
The tidal wave swept away―washed away―the whole village.

content:
おしなべて〔押し並べて〕
〈副〉Generally; generally speaking; broadly speaking; as a rule; as a general thing; on the whole; in the main; on an average; taken altogether

content.content: 成績は押しなべて良い方だ
The results are, on the whole, excellent―The results are, in the main, excellent.
語学は押しなべて男よりも女の方が好い
Generally speaking,―Broadly speaking,―girls make better linguists than boys.
日本人は押しなべて西洋人よりも早熟だ
As a rule,―As a general thing,―Japanese are more precocious than foreigners.
日本のキリスト教信者は押しなべて熱心だ
As a body, the Japanese Christians are earnest believers.
日本人は押しなべて無宗教だ
The Japanese have generally no religion.
彼の収入は押しなべて月千円くらいのものだ
He makes, on an average, about 1,000 yen a month.
彼の生涯は押なべて不出来であった
Taken altogether, his life was a failure.

content:
おしならして〔押し均して〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: おしなべて〔押し並べて〕

おしならす〔押し均す〕
〈他動〉To average (figures); to generalize (facts)

content:
おしのける〔押し退ける〕
〈他動〉To push away or aside; to thrust away or aside; to shove aside; to oust

content.content: 人を押し退ける
to shove people aside―thrust people aside―push people aside
人を肘で押し退ける
to elbow people aside
人込みを押し退けて通る
to elbow one's way through a crowd
ロシアは日本を旅順から押し退けてその後へ入って澄ましていた
Russia ousted Japan from Port Arthur, and quietly stepped into her shoes.

content:
おしのび〔お忍び〕
〈副〉In disguise; incognito(incog.―と略す)

content.content: お忍びの皇族
a prince incog.
殿はお忍びで市中を歩かれる
My lord walks about the city in disguise.
折々お忍びで遊びに行かれる
He occasionally pays a surreptitious visit to the gay quarters.

content:
おしば〔押葉〕
〈名〉Dried plants

content.content: 押葉集
a herbarium

content:
おしはかる〔推し量る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=推測する)to guess; to conjecture; to surmise; to gather (from one's words, etc.)

content.content: 彼の言うことを推し量って容易にわかった
I readily guessed his meaning.
彼の言うことをどう推し量ってみてもわからなかった
I vainly guessed at his meaning.
彼の言ふところから推し量ってみるとやってみたい気が充分あるのだ
I gathered from his words that he was inclined to try.

content: 2. (=諒察する)to consider (one's feelings); to enter into (one's feelings); to put oneself in the place of (others)

content.content: 人の心を推し量る
to enter into one's feelings―put oneself in the place of another
我が身に比べて人の心を推し量る
to judge of others' feelings by one's own

おしひらく〔押し開く〕
〈他動〉To push (the door) open; to force (the door) open

content:
おしぼたん〔押しボタン〕
〈名〉A push-button

content.content: 押しボタンを押す
to press the button

content:
おしまい〔お仕舞〕
〈名〉
1. (=終り)an end

content.content: おしまいになる
(事なら)to come to an end―(物なら)―be all gone―run out
試験はじきにおしまいになる
The examination will soon come to an end―be over.
試験がおしまいになった
The examination is at an end―over.
休暇がじきおしまいになる
The holidays will soon come to an end―The vacation draws to a close.
金がおしまいになった
The money is all gone―There is no more money―We have no money left.
金はこれでおしまいだ
This is all the money left.
品はもうおしまいになりました
We have run out of the article―We are out of the article―The article has run out―The article is out of stock.
品物はこれでおしまいだ
These are all the goods left.
雪はもうこれで今年はおしまいだろう
We shall have no more snow this year.
話が下へ下がったらおしまいだ
When the talk comes down to the dregs, it is at an end―over.
悪口を言い出したら議論もたいがいおしまいだ
When it comes to calling names, argument is pretty nearly at an end.
こうなっちゃおしまいだ(万事休す)
All is over―All is up.
人間年をとっちゃおしまいだ
When we grow old, it is all over with us.
人間もああなっちゃおしまいだ
It is all over with him―It is all up with him―He is beyond hope―past all hope―a gone case.
もうこれでおしまいにしよう
Let us leave off here!
仕事をおしまいにしよう
Let us leave off work!

content: 2. (=身仕舞)toilet

content.content: おしまいをする
to make one's toilet
彼女はおしまいをしている
She is at her toilet.

content:
おしまず〔惜まず〕
〈副〉With an unsparing hard; without stint; ungrudgingly; freely; generously; liberally, lavishly

content.content: 彼は惜しまず金をふりまく
He lavishes money with an unsparing hand.
惜しまず資本を投ずる
He invests capital without stint.
彼は骨を惜しまず働く
He does not spare himself―He is unsparing of himself.
労を惜しまず教える
He spares no pains in teaching.
彼は惜しまず施す
He gives freely.
彼は惜しまず人に持ち物をくれる
He is free with his possessions―generous with his possessions―liberal of his gifts.
惜しまず人を賞める
He is lavish of his praise.
費用を惜しまず子どもを教育した
He educated his children regardless of expense.
金を惜しまず建てた家だ
The house was built regardless of expense.
命を惜しまず奮戦した
They fought with their lives in their hands.

content:
おしむ〔惜しむ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=惜しがる)to spare (pains); to be sparing of (oneself); to be saving of (money); to be frugal of (one's money); to be chary of (praise); to be jealous of (one's honour); to be tender of (one's honour); to grudge (one praise); to reserve (oneself, etc.)

content.content: 金を惜しむ
to be frugal of one's money―be saving of money
彼は金を惜しまぬ
He is free with his money―generous with his money―liberal of his money.
彼は金を惜しまずにふりまく
He lavishes money with an unsparing hand.
彼は金を惜しまずに施す
He gives freely.
金を惜しまずに建てた家だ
The house was built regardless of expense.
費用を惜しむ
to grudge expenses
彼は費用を惜しまずに子どもを教育する
He educates his children regardless of expense.
一文惜しみの百知らず
“penny-wise and pound-foolish.”
労を惜しむ
to spare pains
彼は労を惜しまぬ
He spares no pains.
彼は労を惜しまず教える
He spares no pains in teaching.
骨を惜しむ
to spare oneself
彼は骨を惜しまぬ
He is not sparing of himself.
彼は持ち物を惜しまず人にくれる
He is free with his possessions―generous with his possessions―liberal of his gifts.
彼は惜しまず人を賞める
He is lavish of his praises.
彼は人を賞めるのを惜しむ
He is chary of praise―He will grudge you due praise.
彼女は恩恵を惜しまぬ(容易に男になびく)
She is prodigal of her favours.
名誉を惜しむ
to be jealous of one's honour―be tender of one's honour
一紙半銭を惜しむ
He grudges the veriest trifle.
この仕事を君のために惜しんで置いた
I have reserved this task for you.
大事を為すために我が身を惜しんで置く
I reserve myself for some great deed.
惜しんで置く金
a hoard

content: 2. (=愛す、貴む)to love (life); to hold (anything) dear; to value (time)

content.content: 命を惜しむ
I love life―hold life dear―cling to my life.
命を惜しまぬ者は無い
Life is dear to everybody.
武士は命を惜しまぬ
The samurai holds his life at nothing―The samurai is willing to sacrifice his life.
彼らは命を惜しまず奮戦した
They fought with their lives in their bands.
武士は命よりも名を惜しむ
The samurai values honour above life.
命よりも金を惜しむ人がある
Some people love money above life.
時を惜しむ
to value time
寸陰惜しむべし
Improve every moment!
惜しむべき重宝灰燼に帰す
The precious treasure is reduced to ashes.
君と一夜の情けのために妾は百年の身を惜しまず
I would sacrifice my life for one night of your love.

content: 3. (=残念がる、遺憾に思う)to regret (one's departure); to lament (one's death); to deplore (a fault); to be sorry for (one's departure)

content.content: 名残りを惜しむ
to regret one's departure―I am sorry you are going
互いに名残を惜しんで別れた
We parted with mutual regret―with many expressions of goodwill and esteem―We parted the best of friends―on the best of terms.
彼の死は惜しむべし
His death is to be regretted―regrettable―to be lamented―lamentable.
彼の死は惜しみてもなお余りあり
His death is never enough to be regretted―not to be too much deplored.
彼の死は国家の為に惜しむべし
He is a loss to his country―His country could ill spare him.
彼の辞職は学校の為に惜しむべし
He is a great loss to the school―The school can ill spare such a teacher.
彼を惜しまぬ者は無い
Everybody laments his death―regrets his departure.
彼は惜しまれて死んだ
He died lamented by everybody.
あの先生が去る時は皆に惜しまれた
His departure was regretted by the whole school.
惜しむらくは子どもが女だ
It is to be regretted that―It is a pity that―the child is a girl.

content: 4. (=嫌がる)to be unwilling, loath, reluctant (to do something)

content.content: 二人は別れを惜しんだ
They were unwilling to part―loath to part―reluctant to part―sorry to part.

content:
おしめ〔襁褓〕
〈名〉Swaddling-bands; swaddling-clothes; long-clothes

content.content: 赤児をおしめに包む
to swaddle a baby

おじめ〔緒締〕
〈名〉The string-fastener (of a pouch)

content:
おしもおされもせぬ〔押しも押されもせぬ〕
〈形〉Acknowledged; of established reputation

content.content: 彼は押しも押されもせぬ立派な顔役だ
He is the acknowledged leader of his set.
今では押しも押されもせぬ立派な芸人だ
He is now an artiste of established reputation.

content:
おしもどす〔押し戻す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=押し返す)to put back; to press back; to force back

content.content: 群集を押し戻す
to force back the crowd

content: 2. (=はねつける)to reject; to spurn

content.content: 賄賂を押し戻した
I spurned his bribe.

content:
おしもんどう〔押問答〕
〈名〉Repeated questions and answers; bandying words:(=する) to bandy words

content.content: いつまで押問答をしても駄目だ
It is no use bandying words.
押問答の末こうきまった
After much bandying of words, we came to this settlement.
押問答の末が殴り合い
From words, they came to blows.

おじや〔煮飯〕
〈名〉Rice gruel (boiled with miso or soy)

content:
おしゃく〔お酌〕
〈名〉
1. Serving wine:(=する) to serve (one with) wine

content.content: お酌(!)
Let me serve!―Let me fill your cup!

content: 2. (=半玉)a dancing girl

おしやぶる〔押し破る〕
〈他動〉To break through (a fence, etc.)

content.content: 戸を押し破る
to burst in the door

content:
おしゃべり〔お喋り〕
〈名〉(事)talk; chatter; prattle; rattle; tattle; babble; gabble; jabber; twaddle:(人)a chatterbox; a chatterer; a prattler; a tattler:(=な) chattering; prattling; rattling; talkative; loquacious; voluble; garrulous:(=する) to talk; to chat; to chatter; to prattle; to tattle; to rattle; to babble; to gabble; to jabber; to twaddle; to wag one's tongue, wag one's jaws, wag one's chin

content.content: おしゃべりをして暇をつぶした
I have wasted time in chatting.
子どもが可愛らしくおしゃべりをする
The child prattles prettily.
老人はおしゃべりなものだ
Old people will be garrulous.
唇の薄い者はおしゃべりだ
Thin-lipped people are talkative.
あの子はおしゃべりだから大事な秘密は聞かされぬ
She will blab.

おしやる〔押し遣る〕
〈他動〉To push away; to thrust away

content:
おしゃれ〔お洒落〕
〈名〉(=男のおしゃれ)dandyism; foppery:(女のおしゃれ)finery; coquetry:(おしゃれする男)a dandy; a fop; a dude:(おしゃれする女)a coquette:(=な) dandyish, foppish (man); coquettish (girl); (a woman) fond of finery:(=する) to dress smartly; to smarten oneself; to trick oneself out; to spruce oneself up

content.content: あの子はおしゃれだ
She is a coquette―a coquettish girl.
細君はおしゃれで金さえ有れば着物を買う
His wife is fond of finery, and spends all his money on clothes.
彼は(着物にかまわないどころか)大のおしゃれだ
He is a positive dandy.
お婆さんのおしゃれ
She persists in blooming into the midst of winter.

content:
おじゃん
〈名〉Smash:(=になる) to be smashed; to be shattered; to be spoiled; to go to smash; to go to the ground; to be dashed to the ground; to be dashed to earth; to fall through

content.content: せっかくの計画がおじゃんになった
The whole scheme has gone to smash―gone to the ground―fallen through―The whole scheme is smashed―dashed to earth.
戦争のためにせっかくの計画がおじゃんになった
The war has smashed the whole concern.
当て事がおじゃんになった
My hopes have gone to the ground―My hopes are shattered―dashed to earth―dashed to the ground.
雨でお祭りがおじゃんになった
The rain has spoiled the festival.

content:
おしょう〔和尚〕
〈名〉A Buddhist priest

content.content: 衣ばかりで和尚はできぬ
“It is not the coat that makes the gentleman.”

content:
おじょうさん〔お嬢さん〕
〈名〉A young lady:(人の娘を指して言えば)your (or his) daughter:(本人に対しては)miss; mademoiselle

content.content: 学校出立てのお嬢さんです
She is a young lady fresh from school.
お嬢さんをお連れになりましたか
Have you brought your daughter with you?
お嬢さん、ご覧遊ばせ
Look there, mademoiselle!
お嬢さん育ちだ
She is unsophisticated.

content:
おじょうず〔お上手〕
〈名〉Flattery; cajolery; blarney; flummery; honeyed words; soft soap; soft sawder; rose-water

content.content: あの人はお上手を言う
He will flatter you―cajole you―use honeyed words.
お上手者だ
He is fair-spoken―smooth-tongued―honey-mouthed.

content:
おしょうばん〔お相伴〕
〈名〉Participation:(=する) to participate in (a feast); to partake of (a repast)

content.content: ご馳走のお相伴に与る
to partake of a repast
銀行がつぶれて僕もお相伴を食った
The bank has failed, and involved me in the loss.

おじょうひん〔お上品〕
〈形〉Squeamish; fastidious

おしょく〔お職〕
〈名〉The head prostitute (of a brothel)

content:
おじょく〔汚辱〕
〈名〉Dishonour; disgrace; ignominy; obloquy; contumely

content.content: 汚辱を忍ぶ
to endure obloquy―put up with contumelies―eat dirt―eat crow―eat humble-pie

content:
おしよせる〔押し寄せる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=押して片方へ寄せる)to push (anything) to one side

content.content: 道具を片隅へ押し寄せておけ
Push the furniture into a corner.

content: 2. (=大勢で押しかける)to advance on, march on, press on (a castle); to bear down upon (the enemy); to make for (the door); to besiege (the office)

content.content: 城に押し寄せる
to advance on a castle―march on a castle―press on a castle
敵は夜の間に押し寄せた
The enemy stole a march upon us.
城兵は押し寄せ来る敵を防いだ
The garrison defended the castle against the advancing enemy―the oncoming enemy―the surging enemy.
敵艦隊を見かけて押し寄せた
We bore down upon the enemy fleet.
大浪が押し寄せて来る
Huge waves surge upon us.
火事と聞いて皆出口の方へ押し寄せた
At the cry of “Fire!” everybody made for the door.
預金者が銀行へ押し寄せた
The depositors besieged the bank.

content:
おじる〔怖る〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: おじける〔怖ける〕
落武者は芒の穂にも怖じる
A fugitive hears the enemy in every wind that rustles.
盲人蛇に怖じず
Ignorance is bold―“Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.”

content:
おしろい〔白粉〕
〈名〉Toilet-powder; face-powder

content.content: 顔へ白粉を付ける
to powder one's face―paint one's face
白粉をべたべた塗る
to paint one's face thick with powder
女は白粉をこてこて塗っている
She is thickly powdered―thickly painted.
白粉を付けた女
a painted lady
白粉臭い女
a woman about town―a woman of the town
白粉袋、白粉刷毛
a puff―a powder-puff
白粉箱
a puff-box
水白粉
face-paint
無鉛白粉
non-lead face-powder

おしろいばな〔紫茉莉〕
〈名〉The marvel-of-Peru

content:
おしわける〔押し分ける〕
〈他動〉To push one's way through (a crowd)

content.content: 人込みを押し分けて通った
I pushed my way―forced my way―elbowed my way―through the crowd.

content:
おしわたる〔押し渡る〕
〈自他動〉To push one's way, force one's way (over or through)

content.content: 彼は海外へ押し渡った
He made his way to foreign lands.
世を押し渡る
to force one's way through the world

content:
おす〔押す〕
〈他動〉
1. To push (a person or a thing); to press (a button); to shove

content.content: 一つ押す
to give a push
車を押す
to push a cart
横に車を押す
to push a cart sideways―(意味は)―attempt the impossible
舟を竿で押す
to push a boat―pole a boat
ボタンを押す
to press a button
ご用の節は呼鈴を押して下さい
When you want me, please press the button.
判を押す
to affix a seal to a document―seal a document―stamp a document
拇印を押す
to make a thumbprint on a document―seal a document with a thumbprint
念を押す
to tell one anything twice
念には念を押せ
Make assurance doubly sure.
どこを押せばあんな音が出るやら
He expresses a sentiment foreign to his heart―How he talks!―Hear him talk!
彼は押しも押されもせぬ立派な顔役だ
He is the acknowledged leader of his set.
今では押しも押されもせぬ立派な芸人だ
He is now an artiste of established reputation.

content: 6. (=押し合う)to jostle, hustle, crowd (one another)

content.content: 押すな
Don't jostle me!―Don't crowd me!
僕が押すんじゃない、うしろから押して来たんだ
I am not jostling; they jostle me from behind.
人が押すな押すなと入って来る
People crowd in.
会場の前は押すな押すなの騒ぎだ
There is a jostling crowd in front of the hall.

content: 7. (=無理をする)to strain (something)

content.content: 病気を押す
to attend to business in spite of one's illness
病気を押して出席した
I attended the meeting in spite of my illness.
押して頼む
to request one with importunity―importune one
押して頼めば何でもなさる
You may importune him into doing anything―He is very obliging―very accommodating.

content:
おす〔推す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=推測する、推察する、推量する、推定する)to infer, deduce, judge, conclude, gather (from some data)

content.content: これらの事情から推して考えると何事かあったらしい
Judging from these circumstances, something seems to have happened.
彼の言語学動から推して彼を発狂ときめたのも無理はない
It is quite natural that, from his speech and behaviour, they should have concluded him to be mad.
彼の言葉から推してこの人は英語が得意だと思った
I gathered from his words that he prided himself on his English.
余は推して知るべし
The rest may be inferred.

content: 2. (=推挙する、推薦する)to recommend (one to some post); to propose (one for some office)

content.content: 彼を押して会長にした
We proposed him for our president―We elected him president.
彼は知事に推されて校長になった
He became principal on the recommendation of the governor―The governor recommended him to the post of principal.
世人彼を押して日本第一の学者となす
He is universally acknowledged as the greatest scholar in Japan.

content:
おずおず〔怖々〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: おじおじ〔怖々〕

content:
オーストラリア
〈固名〉→『

content.content: ごうしゅう〔濠州、豪州〕

content:
おすなおすな〔押すな押すな〕
〈形、副〉Jostling; jostlingly

content.content: 人が押すな押すなと入って来る
People crowd in.
会場の前は押すな押すなの混雑を極めている
There is a jostling crowd in front of the hall.

おすわり〔お坐り〕
〈命令法〉Sit down:(=する) to sit down

content:
おせじ〔お世辞〕
〈名〉A compliment; flattery; courtesy; politeness; soft sawder

content.content: お世辞を言う
to pay one a compliment―be complimentary―flatter one―say nice things
僕はお世辞は言わん
I am not in the way of playing compliments.
お世辞をふりまく
to be lavish of compliments
君はなかなかお世辞を言うね
You are very complimentary―very flattering.
君はお世辞にそう言うのだろう
You say so only in compliment―out of politeness―out of regard for my feelings.
お世辞にもそう言って下さるのは嬉しい
I am glad to hear you say so even in compliment.
君はいつの間にそんなお世辞を言うようになったかね
When did you learn to say such nice things?
彼のことをお世辞に大将と言うのだ
He is called “general” by courtesy.
お世辞にもそうは言えぬ
One can not say so even in compliment―Flattery itself would not say so.
あの人を学者とはお世辞にも言えぬ
Flattery itself would not call him a scholar―He is anything but a scholar.
彼はお世辞を言われて悦んでいる
He feels himself highly flattered.
そう言うのは決してお世辞ではない
It is no compliment to say so.
あの人を温厚の君子と言うのは決してお世辞ではない
It is no compliment to say―It is but bare justice to say―that he is a true gentleman.
お世辞の無いところ僕は君の話をあまり感心しない
To be frank with you, I do not care much for your plan.
彼はお世辞の好い人だ
He is an affable man.
お世辞の無い人だ
He is a blunt man.
彼はお世辞がうまい
He is adroit―He has address―He is tactful―He has tact―He has a smooth tongue.
お世辞一遍の人だ
He has nothing but his smooth tongue to recommend him.
あの人はくっつけたようなお世辞を言う
He lays it on thick―lays it on with a trowel.
空々しいお世辞
hollow compliments―empty compliments
空々しいお世辞を言う
He is full of empty compliments.
彼はお世辞たっぷりだ
He is lavish of compliments.
お世辞たっぷりの口上
a complimentary speech
お世辞たらだらだ
He pays compliments ad nauseam―He has unctuous manners―oleaginous manners―oily manners.
お世辞たらだらの口上
a well-oiled speech

おせじわらい〔お世辞笑い〕
〈名〉A simper; a smirk:(=する) to simper; to smirk

content:
おせっかい
〈名〉Meddling:(=な) meddlesome; officious:(=する) to meddle in others' affairs; to poke one's nose into others' affairs, thrust one's nose into others' affairs; to put in one's oar

content.content: おせっかいはご免です
No meddling in my affairs, please!―I'll thank you to leave my affairs alone.
おせっかいするものじゃない
You should not meddle in others' affairs―poke your nose into others' affairs.
あれはおせっかいな人だ
He is a meddler―a busybody―an officious person.

content:
おせわやき〔お世話焼き〕
〈名〉An officious person; a meddler; a busybody; a hen with one chicken

content.content: お世話焼きはまっぴら
“Save me from my friends!”

content:
おそい〔遅い〕
〈形〉
1. (=時の遅い)late

content.content: もう遅い
It is late.
遅くなるから帰ろう
Let us go home, at it is getting late.
急行にはもう遅い
We are too late for the express.
お嫁に行くのはもう遅い
She is too old to marry.
彼は来ようが遅い
He is a long time coming.
帰りが遅い
He is a long time gone.
彼の帰りが遅いので心配だ
I feel uneasy at his long absence.
どうして帰りが遅いかしら
I wonder what can be keeping him.
来て見れば早や遅かりし
I arrived too late.
ひと足遅かった
Too late!
逃げ出すのは危険が起こってからで遅くない
It is time enough to run when there is actual danger.
今や遅しと機会を待った
I eagerly watched for a chance.

content: 2. (=速力が遅い)slow

content.content: 足が遅い
to be slow-footed―slow of foot
僕は足が遅いから君に付いて行けない
I walk so slow that I can not keep up with you.
この汽車は遅い
This train is slow―This train goes slow.
彼は進歩が遅い
He makes slow progress.

content: 3. (=鈍い)dull

content.content: 彼はわかりが遅い
He is dull of comprehension.

content:
おそいきたる〔襲い来る〕
〈自動〉To visit; to come upon (one)

content.content: 暴風雨は猛威を極めて襲い来た
A storm burst upon us in all its fury.
台風は八九月頃襲い来る
Typhoons visit us―Japan is visited by typhoons―in August and September.

content:
おそう〔襲う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=襲撃する)to invade (a country); to attack, make an attack on (the enemy); to assail, assault, deliver an assault on (a fort); to make an onset on, make an onslaught on (the enemy); to fall on, set upon (a party); to descend on, make a descent on (the coast); to raid into, make a raid on (the enemy's territory); to visit (a country)

content.content: 蒙古軍が我が国を襲った
The Mongols invaded Japan.
敵艦隊が我が沿岸を襲った
The hostile fleet made a descent on our coast.
敵を襲う
to attack the enemy―make an attack on the enemy―deliver an assault on the enemy
警察官がばくち宿を襲った
The police made a raid upon a gambling-den.
一行は馬賊に襲われた
The party was set upon by bandits.
蚊軍に襲われた
We were attacked―tormented―by a swarm of mosquitoes.
日本は時々台風に襲われる
Japan is frequently visited by typhoons.
暴風雨猛威を極めて襲い来る
A storm burst upon us in all its fury.

content: 2. (=後を継ぐ)to succeed (to an office―a person in his office)

content.content: 彼は父の芸名を襲って六代目菊五郎となった
He succeeded to his father's nom de guerre as Kikugoro the Sixth.
彼は小村氏の後を襲って外務大臣の椅子に坐った
He succeeded Mr. Komura (in his office) as foreign minister.

content:
おそかれはやかれ〔遅かれ早かれ〕
〈副〉Sooner or later

content.content: 彼は遅かれ早かれ成功する
He will succeed sooner or later―some time or other―His success is only a question of time.

content:
おそく〔遅く〕
〈副〉Late

content.content: 彼は朝早く出かけて晩遅く帰る
He goes out early in the morning and comes home late in the evening.
夜遅く着いた
I arrived late at night―at a late hour.
昨夜遅く帰りました
I returned late last night.
彼は朝遅く起きる
He gets up late―He is a late riser.
朝遅くまで寝ている
He sleeps late into the morning.
夜遅くまで起きている
He sits up till late―sits up far into the night.
もう遅くなる
It is getting late.
学校に遅くなる
I shall be late for school.
急がないと汽車に遅くなるよ
If you do not make haste, you will be too late for the train.
あまり遅くならないようにお帰り
Don't be long!
彼はこんなに遅く(この深更にどこへ)行くのかしら
Where can he be going at this time of night?
遅くともせぬには勝る
Better late than never.

content:
おそくとも〔遅くとも〕
〈副〉At the latest; at the farthest

content.content: 遅くとも九月始めまでには帰る
I shall be back by the beginning of September at the farthest.

content:
おそくも〔遅くも〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: おそくとも〔遅くとも〕

content:
おぞけ〔怖気〕
〈名〉Fear; terror; horror

content.content: おぞけを振るう
to tremble for fear

content:
おそざき〔遅咲き〕
〈形〉Late-blooming (flower); late-flowering (plant); late-blossoming (tree)

content.content: 遅咲きの花
a late flower
遅咲きの桜
late cherry-blossoms

おそなえ〔お供え〕
〈名〉A rice-cake offering (to the gods)

おそなり〔遅生り〕
〈名〉Late fruit

content:
おそなわる〔遅なわる〕
〈自動〉To be late with (anything)

content.content: 遅なわりました
I am sorry I am late with your order.

content:
おそまき〔遅蒔き〕
〈形〉Late-sown:(より)late

content.content: 早や遅蒔きの唐辛
It is now too late―a day after the fair.
今頃英語を始めるとはちと遅蒔きだ
He has begun English rather late in the day.

content:
おそらく〔恐らく〕
〈副〉
1. (=虞れあり)I fear; I am afraid

content.content: 恐らく彼は失敗だろう
I am afraid he will fail.

content: 2. (=あるいは)perhaps; maybe

content.content: 恐らくこんな美しいものはあるまい
Perhaps nothing can be more beautiful.
恐らくそうだろう
Maybe it is so―It may be so.

content:
おそる〔恐る〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: おそれる〔恐れる〕

content:
おそるおそる〔恐る恐る〕
〈副〉
1. (=こわごわ)timidly; nervously; cautiously; gingerly

content.content: 恐る恐るその箱を明けてみた
I gingerly opened the box.
もっとくれと言って恐る恐る手を出した
He timidly held out his hand for more.
恐る恐る人の答案を覗いて見た
He cautiously peeped at his neighbour's paper.
口頭試験で恐る恐る答えた
I gave nervous answers at the oral examination.
彼らは恐る恐る大海へ乗り出した
They ventured upon the sea.
恐る恐る意見を述べた
I ventured an opinion.

content: 2. (=謹み畏みて)respectfully; in awe and reverence

content.content: 恐る恐る意見を述べた
I respectfully gave an opinion.
恐る恐る近寄った
I approached in awe and reverence.

おそるべき〔恐る可き〕
〈形〉Fearful (odds); dreadful (disease); terrible (disaster); formidable (foe, etc.)

content:
おそれ〔恐れ〕
〈名〉Fear; dread; terror; horror; awe

content.content: 恐れをなす
to fear―dread―stand in awe of―a person or thing
学生はこの入学試験に恐れをなしている
The students dread the entrance-examination of this school.
恐れを為して入学しない
They are afraid to enter the school.
皆あの人に恐れをなしている
Everybody stands in awe of that man.

content:
おそれ〔虞〕
〈名〉
1. Fears, apprehensions, signs(は打消、成句のほかは複数); danger; chance

content.content: 失敗の虞れは無いか
Are there any fears of your failing?
失敗の虞れがある
There are fears lest I should fail―There are some fears of my failing―I have some fears of failing―I run a chance of failing.
失敗の虞れは無い
There is no fear of my failing―I have no fear of failing.
失敗の虞れあればなお勉強すべし
You must work harder, lest you should fail―for fear you may fail―for fear of failing.
失敗の虞れあれば警戒す
Beware lest you should fail!
降雨の虞れあり
There are fears lest it should rain―There are some fears of its raining―There is danger lest it should rain―There is danger of its raining.
降雨の虞れあれば各自傘を携帯すべし
Let everybody take his umbrella will him, lest it should rain―for fear it may rain―for fear of its raining.
暴風雨の虞れあり
There are signs of an approaching storm―It threatens to blow.
暴風雨の虞れあり警戒す
The public is warned of an approaching storm.
流行病蔓延の虞れあり
There are signs of the epidemic spreading―The epidemic threatens to spread.
流行病蔓延の虞れあれば警戒す
The public is warned lest the epidemic should spread.
余病併発の虞あり
There are fears of complications arising.
こんな本は風教を害する虞れがある
Such books are apt to injure public morals.
船は破壊の虞れあり
The ship is in danger of destruction―The ship is threatened with destruction―There is danger lest the ship should be wrecked.
亡国の虞れあり
The country is in danger of being ruined―The country is threatened with ruin―There is danger lest the country should go to ruin.
虞れを懐く
to entertain fears―entertain apprehensions
僕は失敗の虞れを懐いている
I entertain apprehensions of failure―I am afraid lest I should fail.

content:
おそれいる〔恐れ入る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=恐縮する)to be filled with awe; to be overwhelmed (with gratitude or shame)

content.content: 宮中にもしそんなことがあっては本大臣はただ恐れ入るのみです
If such a thing should happen in the Imperial Palace, I should be simply filled with awe―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such an occurrence at court would strike me with awe.
ご主人お手ずからのお酌では恐れ入ります
I am overwhelmed by your condescension―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your condescension overwhelms me.
先生に手伝って戴いては恐れ入ります
I should be overwhelmed by your assistance―(他動詞構文にすれば)―You would overwhelm me by your assistance―Your assistance would overwhelm me.
ご案内下さるか、これは恐れ入ります
Will you show me the way? I am overwhelmed with gratitude―greatly obliged to you.
あんなに恐れ入ったことは無い
I was never more overwhelmed with shame―never so put to the blush.

content: 2. (=恥じ入る、痛み入る)to be humiliated; to be abashed; to be put to shame; to be put to the blush; to feel small

content.content: 外国人に日本語の誤りを注意されて実に恐れ入った
I was humiliated when I was set right in my Japanese by a foreigner―A foreigner set me right in my Japanese and made me feel small.
そうお賞め下さると恐れ入ります
Your praises put me to shame―Spare my blushes!
そうお礼を仰有られてはかえって恐れ入ります
You put me to the blush by thanking me.
指南などとは恐れ入ります
You put me to the blush by asking me to give you a lesson―Give you a lesson! Why, you put me to shame.
恐れ入って引き下がった
I withdrew abashed.

content: 3. (=ありがたく思う)to be grateful (to one for something); to be thankful (to one for something); to be obliged to (one)

content.content: 誠に恐れ入り候へども御返金の儀は来月迄御猶予被下度願上候
I should be greatly obliged to you―consider myself under great obligations to you―if you would wait for my payment till next month.
お願いをお聴き下さるか、それは恐れ入ります
If you will grant my request, I shall be greatly obliged to you―esteem it a great favour.
ご同情は誠に恐れ入ります
I am grateful for your sympathy―thankful for your sympathy.
どうも恐れ入ります
I am very much obliged to you.

content: 4. (=お気の毒に思う)to regret; to be sorry; to be sorry to give (one) trouble

content.content: お勉強のお邪魔をして恐れ入ります
I am very sorry to disturb you in your studies.
誠に恐れ入りますがこの手紙を英文に訳して下さいませんか
I am sorry to give you trouble, but will you translate this letter into English?―May I trouble you to translate this letter into English?
恐り入りますがその窓を明けて下さいませんか
May I trouble you to open that window?
恐れ入りますがその本を取って下さい
I'll trouble you for that book―I'll thank you for that book.
お忙しいところお邪魔をして恐れ入ります
I am sorry to intrude on your precious time.
彼は恐れ入って謝った
He apologized with regret.
それではあまり恐れ入りますから
That would be giving you too much trouble.

content: 5. (=服罪する)to plead guilty; to confess one's guilt; to admit the justice of the accusation; to throw oneself on the mercy of the court; to stand corrected; to give in

content.content: (覚えが有るかと問われて)恐れ入りました
I throw myself on your mercy.
被告は恐れ入りましたと申します
The prisoner has confessed his guilt―He pleads guilty.
恐れ入りました、仰有る通りです
Yes. I stand corrected―you are right.
どうだ恐れ入ったろう
Are you not obliged to admit the justice of my accusation?
彼は証拠を突きつけられてとうとう恐れ入ってしまった
When he was confronted with proofs, he had at last to give in.
重々恐れ入ります
I beg a thousand pardons.

content: 6. (=驚く、おかしい)to be surprised; to be astonished; to be amazed; to be tickled

content.content: 君の慧眼には恐れ入った
I am astonished at your penetration.
君の金の借り方のうまいのには恐れ入るよ
I am surprised at your skill in borrowing money.
あれで大学教授だというから恐れ入るね
Just think of his being a university professor!―He a university professor! The idea!
あれで英語が得意なんだから恐れ入る
Just think of his priding himself on his English―I am tickled at his priding himself on his English.

content: 7. (=閉口する、かなわない)to be dumfounded; to be confounded; to be nonplussed; to be beaten; to be floored; to be bored; to be too much for (one)

content.content: この問題には恐れ入った
This problem has floored me―This problem beats me―It beats me all to nothing―(は英、米は)―It beats me all hollow.
品は良いとしても価の高いのには恐れ入る
The quality may be superior, but the price is too much for me.
あの質問には恐れ入った
The question was too much for me―It was a poser―a silencer―a staggerer.
あの人の長演説には恐れ入る
His long-winded speeches bore me―I am bored to death by his long speeches.

content:
おそれおおい〔畏れ多い〕
〈形〉Awful; august; gracious

content.content: 畏れ多くもこのお方は宮様に渡らせらるるぞ
The august personage you behold is an Imperial prince.
陛下には畏れ多くもこう仰せられた
His Majesty was graciously pleased to say so.
申すも畏れ多きことながら皇后陛下には御手ずから孤児を抱き上げ給うた
Awful to relate, Her Majesty was pleased to take one of the orphans up in her arms.
畏れ多くて頭が上がらなかった
I was too much awed to raise my head.
畏れ多いことではあるが畏きあたりにもお勧め申したいと思う
It is awful to say, but I should like to recommend it to those in high places.

おそれおののく〔恐れ戦く〕
〈自動〉To tremble for fear; to be in fear and trembling

content:
おそれながら〔恐れ乍ら〕
〈副〉Most humbly

content.content: 恐れながら申し上げます
May it please your honour,...
俺が恐れながらと出る処へ出りゃ貴様は首が無いぞ
If I turn informer against you,―It I turn the state's evidence,―you will lose your head.

content:
おそれる〔恐れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=怖がる)to fear; be fearful of; be afraid of (a man); to dread (earthquakes); to be frightened at, be scared at (one's appearance); to be terrified at (a disease); to have a horror of (the pest); to stand in awe of (one's superiors)

content.content: 皆あの人を恐れている
Everybody fears that man―Everybody is fearful of that man―Everybody is afraid of that man.
彼は権力があるから恐れられる
He is feared because he is powerful―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His power makes him feared.
彼は残酷なことをして人に恐れられようとする
He makes himself feared by his cruelty.
雷を恐れる人がある
Some people are afraid of thunder.
人はペストを恐れる
People dread the pest.
僕もペストを恐れる
I have a horror of the pest.
地震を恐れぬ人は無い
Everybody dreads earthquakes.
彼は親父を恐れている
He stands in awe of his father.
日本人は死を恐れず
The Japanese does not fear to die―fear death.
君は身に覚えが無いなら何も恐れることは無い
You have nothing to fear―nothing to be afraid of―if you are innocent.
彼は恐るる色無し
He shows no sign of fear.
恐るる色無く対決した
He confronted his accuser without any sign of fear―with a bold front.
落ちての後に高み恐るる
“A burnt child dreads the fire.”
恐れて震える
to tremble for fear
恐れて縮まる
to shrink for fear
彼らは法律を恐れぬ
They defy the laws―bid defiance to the laws―set the laws at defiance.
彼は味方としては頼むべく敵としては恐るべし
He is a powerful ally and a formidable foe.
そんなことをしては後難恐るべしだ
Such a step may be attended with serious consequences.
後世恐るべし
He is destined for something great―He has in him the making of a great man―(女なら)―She has in her the making of a beautiful woman.

content: 2. (=気遣う)to fear, be afraid of (failure); to apprehend, be apprehensive of (defeat, etc.)

content.content: 彼は失敗を恐れている
He fears lest he should fail―He is afraid lest he should fail―He is afraid of failure―He is apprehensive of failure.
失敗を恐れて試みない
He does not try (for fear) lest he should fail―for fear he may fail―for fear of failure.
日本の学生は英語を話すのに間違ったことを言うことを恐れている
Japanese students are afraid of making mistakes in speaking English.
間違いを恐れて英語を話さない
They do not speak English for fear of making mistakes―They are afraid to speak English.
彼は発見されるのを恐れていた
He was afraid lest he should be discovered―He was apprehensive of discovery.
発見されるのを恐れて息を殺していた
He held his breath (for fear) lest he should be discovered―for fear he night be discovered―for fear of discovery.
あるいは恐る暴風雨の襲来有らんことを
I fear―I am afraid―lest there should be a storm.

content:
おそろい〔お揃い〕
〈副〉
1. All:(二人なら)both:(また)together

content.content: これはお揃いで
You are all here―both here.
お揃いでどちらへ
Where are you all―you both―going?
旦那も奥さんもお揃いでお出かけになりました
(Both) master and mistress have gone out together.
お揃いの着物
uniform dress
皆お揃いの着物を着ている
They are all uniformly dressed.
この着物は姉とお揃いにこしらえました
I have made this dress uniform with my sister's.

content:
おそろしい〔恐ろしい〕
〈形〉
1. (=怖い)fearful (thunder); frightful (face); dreadful (earthquake); terrible (voice); horrible (disease); awful (fate, etc.)

content.content: 昨日は恐ろしい雷だった
We had a fearful thunder―It thundered fearfully―yesterday.
昨夜は恐ろしい地震だった
There was a dreadful earthquake last night.
あの人は恐ろしい顔をしている
He has a frightful face.
彼は恐ろしい声でどなった
He bawled in a terrible voice.
コレラは恐ろしい病だ
Cholera is a horrible disease.
彼は恐ろしい運命を免れた
He has escaped an awful fate.
恐ろしい一夜を過ごした
We have passed a terrible night.
これは恐ろしい毒だ
This is a dreadful poison.
恐ろしい光景であった
It is a dreadful sight.
その光景は恐ろしくて二目と見られない
The sight is too dreadful to be seen twice.
恐ろしくて縮まった
I shrank for fear.
彼は恐ろしい権幕でかかって来た
He fell on me with a threatening air.
ばかほど恐ろしいものは無い
Nothing is more to be dreaded than a fool―A fool does not know what he is doing.
悟ってみれば死ぬのも恐ろしくなくなる
Philosophy disarms death of its terrors.
金をくれとは了簡が恐ろしい
He had the impudence to ask for money.
思召しのほどが恐ろしい
He has some end in view―an axe to grind.
そんなことをすると後の祟りが恐ろしい
Such a step may be attended with serious consequences.

content: 2. (=非常な)awful (miser); prodigious (energy); tremendous (crowd); stupendous (force); monstrous (multitude, etc.)

content.content: 彼は恐ろしいけちん坊だ
He is an awful miser.
恐ろしい人手であった
There was a tremendous crowd―a monstrous multitude.
彼は恐ろしい精力家だそうだ
He has prodigious energy, I hear.
水雷が恐ろしい勢で爆発した
The mine exploded with stupendous force.
恐ろしい暑さだ
The heat is awful.
彼は恐ろしい近眼だ
He is dreadfully near-sighted.
金の威光は恐ろしいものだ
Such is the power of wealth.
親子の情愛というものは恐ろしいものだ
Such is the power of parental love.
一心は恐ろしいものでどんな困難にでも打勝つ
Such is the power of concentration that it will overcome the great difficulty.
忍耐というものは恐ろしいもので彼はこれだけの困難に打勝った
He overcame all these difficulties by dint of perseverance.
勉強は恐ろしいもので彼は暫くの間に立派な英学者になった
He made himself a good English scholar in a little while by dint of industry.
習慣は恐ろしいものでどんな困難なことでもやさしくなる
The hardest things are made easy by force of habit.
天罰は恐ろしいものでその男は間も無くコレラにかかって死んだ
He died of cholera soon after―such is Heaven's judgment.

content:
おそろしがる〔恐ろしがる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: おそれる〔恐れる〕

content:
おそろしく〔恐ろしく〕
〈副〉Fearfully; dreadfully; terribly; awfully

content.content: 彼は恐ろしく腹を立てている
He is fearfully angry.
彼は恐ろしく近眼だ
He is dreadfully near-sighted.
今日は恐ろしく暑い
It is awfully hot today.
昨日は恐ろしく寒かった
It was awfully cold yesterday.
あの人は恐ろしくケチだ
He is awfully stingy.
彼は恐ろしく失望した
He was terribly disappointed.
君は恐ろしく青い顔をしている
You look ghastly pale.

content:
おそろしさ〔恐ろしさ〕
〈名〉Terror; horror

content.content: その時の彼の顔の恐ろしさはまだ忘れられぬ
The terror with which his look inspired me, still haunts my memory.
あまりの恐ろしさに逃げ出した
I fled in my terror.

content:
おそわる〔教わる〕
〈被動〉To be taught; to take lessons (in jujutsu, etc.)

content.content: 誰に英語を教わったか
Who taught you English?
この本を誰に教わったか
With whom did you read this book?
教わった通りに書いた
I wrote as I was told to.

おそわれ〔魘われ〕
〈名〉A nightmare; an incubus:(=る) to have a fit of nightmare; to be hag-ridden

content:
おそわれる〔襲われる〕
〈被動〉To be attacked

content.content: 病魔に襲われる
to be attacked with a disease―seized with an illness
恐怖心に襲われる
to be seized with a panic
悪夢に襲われる
to have a fit of nightmare―to be hag-ridden

content:
おそん〔汚損〕
〈名〉Soil; stain:(=する) to be soiled; to be stained

content.content: 物品に汚損がある
Some of the goods are stained.

content:
おたいこ〔お太鼓〕
〈名〉A buffoon; a sycophant; a toad-eater; a toady; a flunkey

content.content: あの男はなかなかお太鼓をやる
He will set the table in a roar.
お太鼓を叩く
to toady

content:
おだいじん〔お大尽〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: だいじん〔大尽〕

content:
おだいもく〔お題目〕
〈名〉The Nichiren formula

content.content: お題目を唱える
to repeat the Nichiren prayer

content:
おたがい〔お互〕
〈名〉Each other

content.content: まさかの時にはお互いに力になろうじゃないか
Let us stand by each other in time of need.
お互い様だから礼を言うには及ばない
One good turn deserves another.

おたから〔お宝〕
〈名〉
1. (=銭)money
2. (=宝船)a picture of the treasure-ship (a charm for auspicious dreams in the New Year)

おだき〔雄瀧〕
〈名〉The greater waterfall of the two

content:
おたく〔お宅〕
〈名〉Your house

content.content: 旦那はお宅ですか
Is your master at home?―Governor in?
けっこうなお宅です
You have quite a home here.
お宅の坊ちゃんはおいくつですか
How old is your son?
お宅のお庭は綺麗ですこと
How pretty your garden is!

content:
おだく〔汚濁〕
〈名〉Corruption

content.content: 汚濁の世
a corrupt age

おだけ〔雄竹〕
〈名〉A kind of bamboo

content:
おたずねもの〔お尋ね者〕
〈名〉A fugitive from justice; one who is wanted by the police

content.content: あれは首に懸賞付きのお尋ね者だ
He is a fugitive with a price on his head―A price is set on his head.
警察のお尋ね者だ
He is wanted by the police.
強盗犯のお尋ね者だ
He is wanted for robbery.

content:
おだて〔煽て〕
〈名〉Instigation; incitement; flattery:(=る) to instigate, incite (one to evil action or to do evil); to flatter (one into doing anything)

content.content: あれはおだてると何でもする男だ
You may flatter him into doing anything.
おだてに乗る
to yield to flattery
彼はなかなかおだてに乗らぬ
He is proof against flattery.
あれは誰かにおだてられてしたのだろう
He must have done it at somebody's instigation.

content:
おたふく〔お多福〕
〈名〉
1. (=お亀)a fat and well-liking woman
2. (=醜婦)a homely woman

content.content: 私のようなお多福の相手になって下さる方はありません
Nobody will have anything to do with such a fright as I am.

content:
おだぶつ〔お陀仏〕
〈名〉A dead man

content.content: お陀仏になる
to die

content:
おたぶんにもれぬ〔お多分に漏れぬ〕
〈熟語〉→『

content.content: ごたぶんにもれぬ〔御多分に漏れぬ〕

おだまき〔苧環〕
〈名〉
1. A spool; a reel; a bobbin
2. (=植物のオダマキ)The columbine

おたまじゃくし〔お玉杓子〕
〈名〉The tadpole

おたまや〔お霊屋〕
〈名〉A mausoleum

content:
おためごかし〔お為ごかし〕
〈名〉Cheating (one) under colour of kindness

content.content: その男は僕をお為ごかしにしようとした
He tried to cheat me under the mask of friendship.

おためすじ〔お為筋〕
〈名〉A patron

content:
おだやか〔穏か〕
〈形〉
1. Calm (sea or weather); quiet (life); tranquil (existence); serene (mind or countenance); mild (climate); gentle (breeze); soft, subdued (light or voice); peaceful (reign); peaceable (behaviour); pacific (disposition); moderate (views); amicable (settlement); proper (word, etc.)

content.content: 穏かな人
a gentle man
穏かな海
a calm sea
穏かな天気
calm weather―serene weather
天気が穏かになる
The weather moderates.
穏かな気候
a mild climate
穏かな風
a gentle breeze
穏かな顔
a calm face―a serene countenance
穏かな心
a calm mind―a serene mind
穏かな生活
a quiet life―a tranquil existence
穏かな性質
a gentle disposition―a mild disposition―a pacific disposition
穏かな世の中
peaceful times
穏かな御世
a peaceful reign
穏かな振る舞い
peaceable behaviour
穏かな意見
moderate views
穏かな処置
moderate measures
穏かな光線
soft light―subdued light
穏かな声でものを言う
to speak in a soft voice―in a mild voice―in a subdued tone
事が穏かにすんだ
The matter has been amicably settled―We have come to an amicable settlement.
穏かに言っても話がわかるじゃないか
You might speak more calmly―speak more quietly.
もっと穏かにはからうことはできまいか
Couldn't you manage the matter more peaceably?
もっと穏かな言葉は無いか
Can't you find a word more proper for the occasion?
そう言えば穏かだ
The expression is proper for the occasion.
彼が暴れると悪いから穏かに帰してやれ
Send him home quietly, lest he should kick up a shindy.
穏かならぬ風説がある
There are disquieting rumours―alarming rumours.
穏かならぬ空模様
a threatening sky
物情穏かならず
Things look threatening.
形勢穏かならず
The prospects are dark―The prospects are gloomy―Things look dark―Things look black.
穏かならぬ振る舞いをする
to behave in a disorderly manner―indulge in unpeaceable behaviour
労働者は穏かならぬ態度をとった
The proletariat assumed a threatening attitude―assumed a defiant attitude.
請願書の文意穏かならず
The petition is couched in unfitting terms―couched in insolent terms.
その言葉は穏かでない
The word is improper for the occasion―The expression is unparliamentary.
いよいよもって穏かでない
Here is an alarming state of things.

content:
おだわらひょうぎ〔小田原評議〕
〈名〉Empty palaver

content.content: 彼らは集まって小田原評議ばかりしている
They meet together and spend their time in empty palaver.
相談会は小田原評議に終った
The conference led to no result―led to no end.

content:
おだんぎ〔お談義〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: だんぎ〔談義〕

content:
おち〔落ち〕
〈名〉
1. (=漏れ)an omission→『

content.content: おちなく〔落ち無く〕

content:
』
2. (=話の落ち)the point (of the joke)

content.content: 話の落ちがわからない
I don't see the point of the joke.
君には落ちがわからないだろう
You don't catch the point, do you?―You miss the point, don't you?

content: 3. (=結局)the final result; the end; the outcome; the upshot

content.content: 果は夜逃げくらいが落ちだろう
The affair will perhaps end in a moonlight flitting.
通ひ詰めた結果は心中くらいが落ちだろう
His frequenting her company will perhaps result in a double suicide―The upshot of the matter will be a double suicide.

content:
おちあい〔落合い〕
〈名〉A confluence

content.content: その町は雨河の落合いに在る
The town stands at the confluence of the two rivers.

content:
おちあう〔落ち合う〕
〈自動〉To flow together; to come together; to meet; to unite

content.content: その町は両河の落ち合うところに在る
The town stands where the two rivers flow together―at the confluence of the two rivers.
二つの道路がここで落ち合う
The two roads unite at this point.
五六の旧友が偶然落ち合った
Some old friends happened to meet.

content:
おちいる〔陥る〕
〈自動〉
1. To fall into, get into, run into, fly into (some state or condition)

content.content: 誤謬に陥る
to fall into error
世人はとかくこの誤謬に陥りやすい
People are apt to fall into this error.
人は誤謬に陥る憂いあり
Man is liable to error.
困難に陥る
to get into trouble―get into difficulties
彼は困難に陥っている
He is in trouble―in difficulties―in deep water―in hot water.
財政困難に陥っている
He is in pecuniary difficulties―in financial embarrassment.
危険に陥る
to run into danger
病人は危険に陥っている(病気危篤)
The invalid is in danger―dangerously ill.
(敵の)術中に陥る
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: (悪人の)計略に陥る
to fall a victim to one's schemes
貧窮に陥る
to be reduced to poverty
一家は貧窮に陥っている
The family is reduced to poverty―in reduced circumstances.
窮境に陥る
to be reduced to extremity―driven to extremity―driven to one's wits' end―to get into Queer Street
彼は窮境に陥っている
He is in extremity―at his wits' end―in Queer Street.
人事不省に陥る
to fall unconscious―fall insensible―fall senseless―fall into a swoon―swoon―faint―lose one's consciousness
彼は人事不省に陥っている
He is unconscious―insensible―senseless―in a swoon―in a dead faint.
誘惑に陥る
to yield to temptation
我が軍は苦戦に陥った
We were hard pressed.
城は重囲の中に陥った
The castle was closely besieged―The fortress was closely invested.
我が軍は敵の重囲の中に陥った
We were closely encompassed by the enemy.
死地に陥る
to be reduced to the last extremity
死地に陥って後に生く
to find life in death

content: 2. (=陥落する)to fall; to be reduced

content.content: さしも堅固な城も遂に陥った
The strong castle was finally reduced.

content: 3. (=陥入する)to fall in; to sink; to subside

おちうせる〔落ち失せる〕
〈自動〉To escape; to fly

おちうど〔落人〕
〈名〉A fugitive; a refugee

content:
おちおち〔落ち落ち〕
〈副〉Calmly; peacefully

content.content: 夜もおちおち眠られぬ
I can not sleep in peace o' nights.

content:
おちかさなる〔落ち重なる〕
〈自動〉To fall one upon another

content.content: 騎兵は地隙へ落ち重なった上を砲兵が渡って進んだ
The cavalry fell one upon another into the chasm, which they filled, and the artillery passed over them.

content:
おちかづき〔お近付き〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちかづき〔近付き〕

content:
おちかぶさる〔落ち被ぶさる〕
〈自動〉To fall about one's ears

content.content: 漆喰天井は頭の上へ落ちかぶさる憂いがある
A plaster ceiling is liable to fall about your ears.

おちぐち〔落口〕
〈名〉The spout (of a gutter); the outfall (of a river)

content:
おちこち〔遠近〕
〈副〉Far and near; far and wide; here and there

content.content: 人遠近より来たる
People came from far and near.
その名声遠近に轟く
His reputation spread far and wide.
その遺跡遠近に散見す
We see the remains scattered here and there.

content:
おちこぼれ〔落ち零れ〕
〈名〉Scatterings

content.content: 落ちこぼれを拾う
to pick up the scatterings
鶏は米の落ちこぼれを拾って食っている
The hens feed on the scatterings of rice.

content:
おちこむ〔落ち込む〕
〈自動〉To fall in:(地盤なら)to sink; to subside:(壁や屋根なら)to cave in

content.content: 頬が落ち込む
The cheeks fall in.
彼は頬が落ち込んでいる
He is hollow-cheeked―He has lantern jaws.
地盤がだんだん落ち込む
The ground is falling―sinking―subsiding.
地盤が落ち込んでいる
The ground is sunken―depressed―hollow.
壁が落ち込んで来た
The walls have caved in.

content:
おちついた〔落着いた〕
〈形〉Composed, collected (look); self-possessed (air); calm, serene, dispassionate, imperturbable (behaviour); sedate, staid, steady, settled (character); sober (attitude, etc.)

content.content: 落ち着いた人だ
He is a self-possessed man.
落ち着いた奴だ
He is a cool hand.
落ち着いたふうをしている
He has a self-possessed air―a composed look―a serene countenance.
落ち着いた性質だ
He is of a sedate disposition―of a staid disposition.

content:
おちつき〔落着き〕
〈名〉Self-possession; composure; calmness; serenity; repose

content.content: あの人は様子に落ち着きがある
He has a self-possessed air―a composed air.
落ち着きの無い人だ
He is restless―fidgety.
落ち着きの無いふうをしている
He has a restless air―an uneasy air―a hurried manner―a flurried manner.
落ち着きの無い性質だ
He is of a flighty disposition―of a volatile disposition―of a feverish disposition.
Greece の彫刻はその美は言うまでも無く仏像のような落ち着きがある
Grecian sculpture has the repose of a Buddhist image, to say nothing of its beauty.
油絵は落ち着きが無い
Oil-paintings lack repose.

content:
おちつきさき〔落着き先き〕
〈名〉One's future abode

content.content: 落ち着き先がきまってまず安心
My mind is at rest, now that my future home is fixed upon.

content:
おちつきはらう〔落着き払う〕
〈自動〉To be calm and serene; to be as cool as a cucumber

content.content: 彼は落ち着き払った顔をして答弁していた
He was answering the charges with a serene countenance.
彼はどんな危険に逢っても落ち着き払っている
He is perfectly calm and serene―He shows the utmost sang-froid―in the presence of any danger.
彼はこの混乱の真中に立って落ち着き払っていた
In the midst of all this confusion, he remained as cool as a cucumber.

content:
おちつく〔落着く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=心が落着く)to become self-possessed; to become calm; to calm oneself; to become composed; to compose oneself; to recover one's composure; to become collected; to collect oneself; to gather one's scattered wits; to become cool; to cool down; to settle down

content.content: 彼は落ち着いている
He is calm―cool―cool and steady―cool and collected―composed―self-possessed―He has a cool head―a level head.
落ち着いた人だ
He is a self-possessed man.
落ち着いた奴だ
He is a cool hand.
落ち着かない人だ
He is a restless man―a fidgety man.
少し落ち着いてあたりを見まわした
Composing myself a little, I looked around me.
落ち着いて考えてみた
Collecting myself,―Gathering my scattered wits,―I tried to think.
彼は落ち着いた性質だ
He is of a sedate disposition―of a staid disposition.
落ち着かない性質だ
He is of a flighty disposition―of a volatile disposition―of a feverish disposition.
落ち着いたふうをしている
He has a self-possessed air―a composed air.
落ち着かないふうをしている
He has a restless air―an uneasy, air―a hurried manner―a flurried manner.
彼は落ち着いて演説をする
He speaks calmly―with calmness―with a calm air―with a composed air―with a self-possessed air.
落ち着いて事をする
to do anything with calmness―with a quiet purpose
落ち着いてものを言え
Speak more calmly!
どうも気が落ち着かない
Somehow I feel restless―I feel fidgety―I am in a fidget―I have the fidgets.
落ち着いて勉強することができない
I can not settle down to my studies.

content: 2. (=住居を定める)to settle down; to settle one's abode; to take up one's abode; to take up one's residence; to take up one's lodgings; to take up one's quarters; to make one's home

content.content: 東京に落ち着いたのは五年前です
I settled down in Tokyo five years ago―I have been settled in Tokyo these five years.
ひとまずこの下宿屋に落ち着くことにしよう
I shall take up my quarters in this lodging-house for the present.
落ち着いたら早速知らしてくれ給え
Please let me know as soon as you are settled.
君は細君でも貰って落ち着く気は無いか
Have you no mind to get married and settle down?―settle down to a married life?
日本に落ち着く西洋人はいくらもある
Many foreigners make their homes among the Japanese.

content: 3. (=鎮まる)to subside; to abate; to become calm; to calm down; to become quiet; to quiet down; to become tranquil

content.content: 騒動がやっと落ち着いた
The disturbance has subsided at last.
痛みが少し落ち着いた
The pain has abated a little.
選挙がすんで市中はやっと落ち着いたところだ
The election is over, and the town has just calmed down―quieted down―recovered its quiet―been restored to its wonted tranquillity.

content: 4. (=坐りが好い)to be stable; to be steady

content.content: 馬上に尻が落ち着く
to acquire a steady seat on horseback
僕はどうも馬上に腰が落ち着かない
I can not sit a horse well.
あの男は尻が落ち着かない
He can not stay long in one place.

content: 5. (=調和する)to harmonize with (anything); to be in keeping with (anything)

content.content: 油絵は日本間に落ち着かない
An oil-painting does not harmonize with―fit into―a Japanese room.
異分子は落ち着かないものだ
A foreign element will not agree with its surroundings.

content:
おちつける〔落着ける〕
〈他動〉To calm (one's mind); to compose (one's thoughts); to collect (one's wits); to quiet (one's fears, etc.)

content.content: 心を落ち着ける
to calm one's mind―compose oneself―collect oneself―gather one's wits―gather up one's scattered wits
心を落ち着けてあたりを見まわした
Composing myself, I looked around me.
気を落ち着けて考えてみ給え
Collect yourself, and think!
心を落ち着けて勉強した
I settled down to my studies.
身体を落ち着けて眠ろうとした
I settled myself for a sleep.
彼は身を落ち着けて商売をした
He settled down to business.
彼は結婚して身を落ち着けた
He married and settled down―He settled down to a married life.

content:
おちど〔落度〕
〈名〉
1. (=過失)a fault

content.content: 人の落ち度を拾う
to find faults in one's conduct―pick holes in one's coat―cavil at faults―carp at faults―catch one tripping
自分の落ち度は見えないものだ
One will be blind to one's own faults.
長官になると人が落ち度を捜したがる
People are apt to cavil at the conduct of a man who holds the chief place.
こうなったのは僕の落ち度じゃない
This has happened through no fault of mine.

content: 2. (=罪)blame

content.content: これは君の落ち度だ
This is your fault―You are to blame for this.
これは僕の落ち度でない
This is not my fault―I am not to blame for this.
この事が失敗すると君の落ち度にされるぞ
They will blame you for the failure―lay the failure at your door―lay the failure to your charge.
細君の方には落ち度は無い
The wife is free from blame―blameless.
彼は落ち度の無い細君に難くせをつけて追い出した
He found fault with his blameless wife, and put her away.

content:
おちなく〔落ち無く〕
〈副〉Without omission; exhaustively

content.content: 落ち無く通知しました
I have notified everybody without omission.
落ち無く物語った
I related the whole affair without omitting a single circumstance―without omitting a single particular.
落ち無く説明した
He explained the whole matter without omitting a single detail.
落ち無く英語を研究した
He has made an exhaustive study of English.

content:
おちのびる〔落ち延びる〕
〈自動〉To fly to a safe distance; to effect one's escape; to make good one's escape

content.content: 今頃は落ち延びたろう
He must have effected his escape by this.
ここまで落ち延びれば追手の来る気遣いは無い
Here we are safe from pursuit.

おちびと〔落人〕
〈名〉A fugitive; a refugee

おちふだ〔落札〕
〈名〉A prize ticket

content:
おちぶれる〔落魄れる〕
〈自動〉To be ruined; to be reduced to poverty; to fall in one's circumstances; to come down in the world; to sink in the world

content.content: 昔は天下の旗本であったが今は落ちぶれた
He was once a banneret of the Shogun, but he has come down in the world.
彼は今こそ落ちぶれているが昔は何某と言われた身だ
He is now in reduced circumstances, but he has seen better days.
いくら落ちぶれてもまだ乞食をするほどには落ちぶれない
I am not yet fallen so low as to beg.
落ちぶれた人
a ruined man―a man of broken fortunes
落ちぶれて
When, reduced to poverty,
袖に涙のかかる時
You eat your bread with tears,
人の心の
Then you shall know the hearts of men
奥ぞ知らるる
Despite your hopes and fears.

content:
おちほ〔落穂〕
〈名〉The ears of corn left by the reapers:(拾った落穂)gleanings

content.content: 落穂を拾う
to glean

content:
おちぼ〔落穂〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おちほ〔落穂〕

content:
おちむしゃ〔落武者〕
〈名〉
1. A fugitive

content.content: 落ち武者は芒の穂にも怖じる
The fugitive hears the enemy in every wind that rustles.
この村は昔平家の落ち武者が逃げ込んだ処だ
This village was once a colony of Heike fugitives.

content: 2. (=入学試験の落ち武者)an unsuccessful candidate (in an entrance examination)

おちめ〔落目〕
〈名〉Decline of fortune; declining fortune

content.content: 彼の運は落ち目だ
His fortune is on the decline―His star is on the wane.

content:
おちゃ〔お茶〕
〈名〉Tea

content.content: お茶を濁す
to hoodwink the company―throw dust in one's eyes―make a show of doing anything beyond one's reach―manage to go through anything somehow or other
(本当に英語を知っている者は無い)英語を教えると言ってお茶を濁しておくのだ
They make a show of teaching English.
(僕には本当のことはとてもできないから)お茶を濁しておくだけさ
I only manage to go through it.
お茶をひく
(said of a professional singer or prostitute when) she is without an engagement for the evening

おちゃっぴい〔お茶っぴい〕
〈名〉A saucy girl; a pert miss

content:
おちゃのこ〔お茶の子〕
〈名〉An easy task

content.content: 彼はビール一ダースくらいお茶の子だ
He will make short work of a dozen bottles of beer.
試験などはお茶の子だ
I make nothing of my examinations.
あの男を負かすくらいはお茶の子だ
I can beat him any day.

おちゃぼうず〔お茶坊主〕
〈名〉A palace-attendant (of the feudal times)

おちゃや〔お茶屋〕
〈名〉
1. (=茶席)a tea-room; a room for ceremonial tea
2. (=料理屋)a tea-house; a restaurant

content:
おちゆく〔落ち行く〕
〈自動〉To fly (to a place)

content.content: 落ち行く先はわからぬ
I do not know where to fly to.

content:
おちょうしもの〔お調子者〕
〈名〉One easily elated

content.content: あれはお調子者だ
He is easily elated.

content:
おちょうちんもち〔お提灯持ち〕
〈名〉A candle-holder

content.content: お提灯持ちをする
to hold a candle to the devil―(米国にては)―boost
あんな奴のお提灯持ちをするな
Do not hold a candle to such a fellow!

content:
おちょぼぐち〔おちょぼ口〕
〈名〉Pouting lips

content.content: おちょぼ口をする
to pout

content:
おちる〔落ちる〕
〈自動〉
1. To fall; to drop; to come down; to go down

content.content: 崖から落ちる
to fall over a precipice
土手から落ちる
to fall down a bank
子どもが梯子段から落ちた
The child fell down the stairs.
高い処から落ちる
to fell from a height
彼は高い処から落ちて死んだ
He fell from a height and died―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The fall killed him.
馬から落ちる
to be thrown off a horse
彼は馬から落ちてけがをした
He was thrown off a horse and injured―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A fall from a horse injured him―A horse threw and injured him.
船から海へ落ちる
to fall overboard
椅子から落ちる
to fall off a chair
卓上から落ちる
to fall off the table
木から落ちる
to fall out of a tree―tumble out of a tree
猿も木から落ちる
“A good marksman may miss.”
木から落ちた猿
a “fish out of water”
リンゴが木から落ちる
Apples fall off the tree.
落ちた林檎は持たぬ
Fallen apples do not keep.
彼は三階から真さかさまに落ちた
He fell head foremost from the third story.
雨滴が軒から落ちる
Raindrops fall from the eaves.
秋は木の葉が落ちる
The leaves fall―Trees shed their leaves―in autumn.
手から落ちる
to fall out of one's hand―fall from one's hand
手に落ちる
to fall our into one's hands
二百三高地は我が手に落ちた
The 203-Metre Heights fell into hands.
彼は試験で五番落ちた
He has gone down five places in the examination.
もしもし何か落ちましたよ
Say, sir, you have dropped something.
ポタンと落ちる
to fall plump―plump down
ポタリと落ちる
to fall flop―flop down
ドシンと落ちる
to fall with a thud
雨がポツポツ落ちてきた
The rain has begun to fall in drops.
桃がポタポタ落ちそうに熟している
The peaches are ready to drop―dropping ripe.
明いた口に牡丹餅は落ちて来ぬ
“Larks do not fall ready-roasted into your mouth.”

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 風で栗が落ちた
The wind has thrown the chestnuts to the ground.
雷が落ちる
Lightning strikes―A thunderbolt falls.
あの家に雷が落ちた
That house was struck by lightning.
お祭りで橋が落ちた
The bridge gave way under a festival crowd.
洪水で橋が落ちた
The flood carried away the bridge―swept away the bridge―The bridge was carried away by the flood―swept away by the flood.
二階が落ちる
The floor gives way.
桟敷が落ちてけが人ができた
The stand gave way, and injured some people.
日は西山に落つ
The sun sinks below the horizon.
日まさに落ちなんとす
The sun is setting.
うまくて頬が落ちそうだ
It is delicious―goluptious.
落ちての後に高みを恐る
“A burnt child dreads the fire.”
本が下に落ちている
The book is on the floor―The book lies on the ground.
うまい事が足下に落ちている
Chances lie at our feet.
その財布が道に落ちておった
I found this purse on the road.
道に落ちたるを拾わず
You should not pick up what you find on the road.
風呂が落ちる
The bath-tub is emptied (of its water).
この辺にだいぶ金が落ちた
Much money has been spent to enrich the people here.

content:
3. 
〈第二特例〉

content.content: 人気が落ちる
to lose one's popularity―fall in popularity―fall into disfavour
客が落ちる
Customers fall off.
あの店は近頃客が落ちた
The shop has lost its custom.
あの医者は患者が落ちた
The doctor has lost his patients.
あの人は評判が落ちた
He has fallen in the public estimation.
地に落ちる
to fall to the ground―fall to earth
ドイツの威信地に落つ
Germany's prestige is gone.
名声地に落ちた
His reputation is gone―His reputation is blasted.
信用地に落ちた
His credit is gone―His credit is cracked.
人後に落ちる
to fall behind the others
人後に落ちぬ
to be behind no one―second to none
熱心では人後に落ちぬつもりだ
I hope I am behind no one in zeal.
腑に落ちる
to go down with one
彼の説明は腑に落ちない
His explanation does not go down with me.
腑に落ちない話だ
I can not swallow the story―The story is hard to swallow―The story sticks in my gizzard.
人の値打が落ちる
A man falls in the public estimation.
文章が悪いので本の価値が落ちる
The badness of the style takes from the value of the work.
そんなことをしては紳士の品格が落ちる
It would be beneath the dignity of a gentleman to do such a thing.
この箪笥が競売で僕に落ちた
This cabinet was knocked down to me at the auction.
(入札で)札が落ちる
One's tender is accepted.
話が理に落ちる
The talk becomes serious.
問うに落ちず語るに落ちる
It is easier to draw than to force men.
落つれば同じ谷川の水
They all come to the same thing.

content: 4. (=取れる)to come off; to come out

content.content: 箔が落ちる
The gilt comes off.
箔が落ちた
The gilt is off.
着物の泥がまだ落ちない
The mud has not quite come off my clothes.
しみが落ちない
The stain will not come out.

content: 5. (=落第する)to fail; to get plucked

content.content: 今度の試験で誰々落ちたか
Who have failed―got plucked―in the examination?

content: 6. (=漏れる)to be omitted; to be left out

content.content: 名簿に君の名が落ちている
Your name is omitted in the list.
二三字落ちている
A few words are left out.

content: 7. (=逃げる)to escape; to fly

content.content: 義経は東へ落ちた
Yoshitsune fled to the East.
都を落ちる
to fly from the capital

content: 8. (=河が海に入る)to fall into, flow into, empty into, pour itself into (the sea)

content.content: 隅田河は東京湾に落ちる
The Sumida empties into the Bay of Tokyo.

content: 9. (=色が褪める)to fade

content.content: 紫は落ちやすい
Purple is apt to fade.

content: 10. (=陥落する)to fall; to be reduced

content.content: さしもの堅固な城もとうとう落ちた
The strong castle fell at last.

content: 11. (=劣る)to be inferior (to the other in quality); to fall short of (the standard)

content.content: これはあれより落ちる
This is inferior to that.
これは品がずっと落ちます
This is far inferior in quality.
品質が落ちる
The quality falls short of the mark.
品物は見本より落ちる
The goods do not come up to the sample.
今年の米作は平年より落ちる
This year's rice-harvest falls short of the average.

content: 12. (=死ぬ)to die

content.content: 夏は鰻が落ちる
Eels die away in summer.

content:
おつ〔乙〕
〈名〉
1. (=第二)the second; B

content.content: 一年級乙組
the First Year, B Class

content: 2. (=後者)the latter

content.content: 甲と乙
the former and the latter―the one and the other―one and another
甲の薬は乙の毒
“One man's meat is another man's poison.”

content:
3. (=音楽の低音)bass
〈形〉(=な) quaint (expression); piquant(face); smartish (woman); rather good (thing); racy (story); spicy (tale):(=に) quaintly; strangely

content.content: ちょっと乙な年増だ
She is a smartish young woman.
乙な顔をしている
She has a piquant face.
浜鍋はちょっと乙だ
Clam-chowder is a piquant dish.
乙なことを言う人だ
He says quaint things.
先生は乙な話をする
He tells racy stories―spicy stories.
あの子は乙な身なりをしている
She is rather smartly dressed.
あの男は乙に澄している
He looks as grave as a judge.
こいつぁ乙だ
This is rather good.
乙な仲になる
to fall in love with each other
二人は乙な仲だ
They are lovers.
乙にからんできたね
You put it in a strange way.

おっかあ
〈名〉Mother; mamma; ma:(よその老女に向かって言えば)my good woman

content:
おっかかる〔寄掛かる〕
〈他動〉To lean against (the wall); to lean on (the table)

content.content: 彼は壁におっかかって日なたぼっこをしている
He is basking in the sun with his back against the wall.
柱におっかかって思案に暮れていた
He was leaning against a post, lost in meditation.
食卓におっかかるものじゃない
You should not lean on the table―rest your elbows on the table.
その戸におっかかるな
Lean off that door!

content:
おっかける〔追っ掛ける〕
〈他動〉To pursue; to chase; to run after, start after (one)

content.content: 動き出した電車を追っかけて飛び乗った
I ran after a moving car, and jumped into it.
追っかけて手紙を出す
to send off one letter after the other
災難が追っかけ追っかけ続いて起こる
One calamity treads close on the heels of another―One calamity follows close on another.

おっかさん〔お母さん〕
〈名〉Mother; mamma; ma

content:
おっかない
〈形〉Fearful; frightful; dreadful

content.content: おっかない顔をしている
He has a grisly face―a grim countenance.
おっかない話だ
It is a weird story―an uncanny tale.

content:
おっかなびっくりで
〈副〉In fear and trembling

content.content: おっかなびっくりでその人の前へ出た
I came into his presence in fear and trembling.

content:
おっかぶせる
〈他動〉To smother (one with anything)

content.content: おっかぶせるように親切を尽す
to smother one with kindnesses
人に責任をおっかぶせる
to shuffle off the responsibility on another's shoulders―shift the responsibility on another's shoulders

content:
おつき〔お付き〕
〈名〉A person in waiting; a person in attendance; an attendant:(=の) in attendance (on a great personage)

content.content: 殿にお付きの侍
a samurai in attendance on my lord

content:
おつきあい〔お付合い〕
〈名〉Company:(=する) to bear (one) company; to keep (one) company

content.content: お付き合いに僕も行こう
I'll go with you to keep you company.
お付き合いに僕も買おう
I'll buy one, too, for company's sake.
お付き合いに僕も泣いた
I cried for company.

content:
おつきあわせ〔お付合わせ〕
〈名〉Forced company

content.content: お付き合わせはご免よ
Don't force your company upon me―“Misery loves company.”

おつぎのま〔お次の間〕
〈名〉An anteroom

content:
おっくう〔億劫〕
〈形〉Troublesome; bothersome; irksome; tiresome

content.content: 一々払うのはおっくうだから月末にいっしょに取りに来い
It is troublesome to pay every time, so bring a bill at the end of the month.
書き直すのはおっくうだからこのまま出そう
I will hand it in as it is, as it is too much trouble to write it over again.
書き直すのは実におっくうだ
It is such a bother to rewrite it.
一々戸を明けてやるのがおっくうだから鍵を貸してやった
I lent him the key to spare myself the trouble of opening the door every time.
彼は仕事をおっくうがる
He finds his work troublesome.
物事をおっくうがる(骨を惜しむ)
to spare oneself
物事をおっくうがるものでない
You should not be sparing of yourself.
三度の食事もおっくうだ
Three meals a day bore me.
字書を引くのをおっくうがる人がある
Some people find it troublesome to refer to a dictionary―Consulting a dictionary bores some people.

content:
おつくり〔お作り〕
〈名〉Toilet; make-up:(=する) to make one's toilet; to make up one's face

content.content: 女がお作りしている
She is at her toilet.
お作りしているから綺麗だ
Her make-up makes her look pretty.
お作りしないでも綺麗だ
She has a natural beauty.

content:
おつげ〔お告げ〕
〈名〉A revelation

content.content: 夢にお告げを受ける
to have a revelation in a dream
彼はお告げによって知った教えだと言っている
He says the doctrine was revealed to him.

content:
おっこう〔億劫〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: おっくう〔億劫〕

content:
おっしゃる〔仰有る〕
〈他動〉(Honorific for) to say (something); to talk; to speak (to one); to tell (one to do something)

content.content: 欲しい物があったら遠慮無くそう仰有い
It you want anything, please say so without reserve.
私に仰有るのですか
Are you speaking to me?
どうしろと仰有ったのか
What did he tell you to do?
どうしろと仰有るの
What do you wish me to do?―What would you have me do?
私が怪しいと仰有るのか
Do you mean to say that you suspect me?
いやだと仰有るのか
Do you refuse to do so?
仰有いよ
You may talk!―How you talk!

content:
おっつかつ
〈形〉Nearly equal

content.content: 力はおっつかつだ
They are nearly equal in strength.
勝負はおっつかつだ
It is a close contest.
選挙競争はおっつかつだ
The election is closely contested.

content:
おっつく〔追っ付く〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: おいつく〔追い付く〕

content:
』
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 英語では彼に追っつく者は無い
No one can come near him in English.
足下には追っつく者が無い
No one can hold a candle to him.
後悔しても追っつかない
Regrets will not mend matters.
あせったって追っつかない
Impatience will not mend matters.

content:
おっつけ〔追付け〕
〈副〉Soon; before long

content.content: おっつけお正月だ
The New Year will be here very soon.
おっつけ治るだろう
It will not be long before he gets well.

content:
おっつける〔押っ付ける〕
〈他動〉(上からなら)to press down, press upon (something):(横になら)to push, press, hold, pin (one against something)

content.content: 壁に押っつけられた
He held me against the wall―I was pinned against the wall.

content:
おって〔追って〕
〈副〉In due course of time; in due course; in due time; in time; all in good time; later on; by and by

content.content: 追って沙汰をする
You shall hear from me in due course.
追って沙汰をするまでそのままそこに居れ
Stay where you are till further notice.
追って沙汰をするまで品物を売らずに置け
Hold the goods subject to my further instructions.
追ってお返事を致します
You shall have my answer in due time.
追って成績をお知らせします
You shall know the result all in good time.
追って昇級のご沙汰があるだろう
You will be promoted in time.
追って説明する
I shall explain later on.

content:
おって〔追手〕
〈名〉A pursuer

content.content: 凶漢は短刀を振りまわして追っ手を近づけない
The raff brandished a knife, and kept his pursuers at bay.
追っ手をまく
to fling off one's pursuer―throw one's pursuer off the scent
追っ手を避ける
to elude pursuit
ここまで落ち延びれば追っ手の来る気遣いは無い
Here we are safe from pursuit.

おってがき〔追而書き〕
〈名〉A postscript

content:
おっと
〈間投詞〉Oh!

content.content: おっとその手は喰わぬ
Oh, I know that game!
おっと危ない
Look out!
おっとこぼれる
There, the cup is full!
おっと待った
Hold! hold!
おっと来た
Now then!

content:
おっと〔夫〕
〈名〉A husband

content.content: 女が夫を持つ
A woman gets married.
あの女は夫がある
She has a husband―She is married.
西洋人を夫に持っている
She has a foreigner for a husband―She is married to foreigner.
夫のある身です
I am married woman.
天下晴れての夫があります
I am a wedded wife―a lawful wife―an honest woman.
あの人が未来の夫ですか
Is he your intended?―your fianc??
妻が夫に服す
The wife bends to the husband's will.
彼女はよく夫に仕えている
She is devoted to her husband.
夫の顔に泥を塗る
to deceive one's husband―disgrace one's husband―cover one's husband with shame
顔に泥を塗られた夫
a cuckold

おっとせい〔膃肭獣<オットセイ>〕
〈名〉The fur-seal

おっとせい〔膃肭獣<オットセイ>〕
〈名〉The fur-seal

おっとりした
〈形〉Ingenuous (youth); innocent (girl, etc.)

content:
おっとる〔おっ取る〕
〈他動〉To seize; to snatch up

content.content: やにわに銃をおっ取った
I seized my gun―snatched up my gun.
手に手に得物をおっ取って打って掛かって来た
Each seized whatever came ready to his hand and fell on me.
おっ取り刀で駈けて来た
He ran up, sword in hand.

content:
おっぱい
〈名〉(Nursery term for) milk, a suck

content.content: おっぱいを飲む
to have a suck
おっぱいを飲ませる
to give a child a suck

content:
おっぱらう〔追払う〕
〈他動〉To drive away

content.content: おっぱらってしまえ
Away with him!
野獣をおっぱらうために焚火をした
We made a blazing fire to scare away the wild beasts.
娘が帰って来たら活動でも見せておっぱらってやる
If she comes home, take her to the movie and send her about her business.
活動くらいでおっぱらわれちゃ割に合わない
It doesn't pay to be sent away with a treat to the movie.

content:
おつや〔お通夜〕
〈名〉A wake; a lyke-wake; vigils

content.content: お通夜をする
to hold a wake―keep vigils
この地方では人が死ぬと全村集まってお通夜をする
When a man dies in this part of the country, the whole village will hold a wake over his body.

content:
おつやのらん〔乙夜の覧〕
〈名〉Imperial inspection

content.content: 乙夜の覧に供す
to submit anything to Imperial inspection
該著作は乙夜の覧を賜えり
The work has been honoured with Imperial inspection.

content:
おでき〔お出来〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: できもの〔腫物〕

content:
おでこ
〈名〉A projecting forehead; beetle brows

content.content: あの子はおでこだ
She is beetle-browed.

おてだま〔お手玉〕
〈名〉Japanese jackstones

おてて〔お手々〕
〈名〉(Nursery name for) a hand

content:
おてのうち〔お手の内〕
〈名〉Skill; performance

content.content: あっぱれなお手の内
You performance does you credit―You have acquitted yourself to your credit.
お手の内拝見
Will you have a game?
お手の内拝見と出た
I challenged him to a game.

おてのすじ〔お手の筋〕
〈熟語〉You have guessed right; You have hit the right nail on the head; You have hit it

content:
おてのもの〔お手の物〕
〈名〉
1. (=得手)one's forte; something in one's line

content.content: 先生は沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}はお手の物だ
Shakespeare is his forte―He has Shakespeare at his fingers' ends.
文法ならお手の物だ
Grammar is in his line.

content: 2. (=しめたもの)(to be) one's

content.content: 成功はお手のものだ
I am sure of success―I am certain of success―Success is ours―We have the ball at our feet.

おでばな〔お出花〕
〈名〉Fresh-drawn tea

content:
おてもときん〔御手許金〕
〈名〉The Privy Purse

content.content: 御手許金の御下賜がある
There is a grant out of the Privy Purse.

content:
おてやわらかに〔お手柔かに〕
〈副〉Gently

content.content: お手柔かに願います
Don't be hard upon me!

content:
おてん〔汚点〕
〈名〉A blot; a stain; a spot; a speck; a fleck

content.content: 彼は一点の汚点も無い人だ
He is a man of spotless character.
彼の名には拭うべからざる汚点がある
There is an indelible blot on his name.

おでん〔お田〕
〈名〉A sort of hotch-potch (sold at a street-stall)

おてんきし〔お天気師〕
〈名〉A swindler; a confidence man

content:
おてんとうさま〔お天道様〕
〈名〉
1. (=太陽)the sun

content.content: お天道様まわり
to go round with the sun―go round through the buttonhole
あんな人を害そうとするのはお天道様に石をぶっつけるようなものだ
You might as well throw a stone at the sun as try to injure such a man.

content: 2. (=天道)Providence; God

content.content: お天道様が見てござる
God sees into our hearts.

content:
おてんば〔お転婆〕
〈名〉A romping; girl; a romp; a tomboy; a hoyden:(=な) romping; bouncing

content.content: お転婆をする
to romp
西洋の娘はお転婆だ
Foreign girls are fond of romping.

content:
おと〔音〕
〈名〉
1. A sound:(騒がしい音) a noise:(大きな音)a din; a roar; a crash

content.content: 音がする
I hear a sound.
何か音がする
I hear something.
音はすれども姿は見えぬ
I hear a sound, but I see nothing.
音を立てる、音をさせる
to make a noise
音を立てて歩く
to walk with a noise―make a noise in walking
音を立てずに歩く
to walk without a noise―tread softly
西洋人は音をさせて物を食うことを嫌う
Foreigners dislike to make a noise in eating.
家は凄じい音を立てて倒れた
The house fell with a crash―with a terrific crash.
雨の音がする
I hear the rain.
雨の音が聞こえないか
Don't you hear the rain?
門を叩く音がする
There is a knock at the door.
足音がする
I hear footsteps.
彼が梯子段を上がる音がした
I heard his footsteps on the stairs.
大砲の音
the cannon's roar―the roaring of guns―(遠方でなら)―the booming of guns.
鉄砲の音
the report of a gun
鉄砲の音がした
I heard a shot.
雷の音
the thunder's roar―the roll of thunder―a peal of thunder―a clap of thunder―a thunderclap
遠雷の音
distant boom of thunder―the rumbling of distant thunder
波の音が聞こえる
I hear the roar of the sea―the booming of the breakers.
彼は波の音の聞こえる処に住む
He lives within hearing of the sea.
瀧の音
the sound of cataracts
河の音
the sound of waters
音のせぬ河は深い
“Still waters run deep.”
小河の音
the babbling of a brook
丁丁発止の音
the clash of arms―the clang of arms
下駄の音
the clatter of clogs
靴の鳴る音
the creaking of shoes
時計のカチカチ鳴る音
the ticking of a clock or a watch
時計の打つ音
the striking of a clock
機関砲を撃つと豆を煎るような音がする
The firing of a machine-gun sounds like the popping of corn.
音がせずに戸が明いた
The door opened without a noise―noiselessly.

content: 2. (=名声)fame

content.content: 音に聞こえた
famed―far-famed―renowned―celebrated
彼の学問は音に聞いている
I have heard much of his learning.

おとうさま〔お父様〕
〈名〉Father; papa; pa; dad; daddy

おとうと〔弟〕
〈名〉A younger brother

content:
おとおと〔弟〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おとうと〔弟〕

content:
おどおどする
〈自動〉To falter; to cower; to waver; to be nervous; to be in fear (and trembling)

content.content: おどおどして夜の明けるのを待った
We waited for daylight in fear and trembling.
田舎者で何を言われてもただおどおどしているばかりだ
She is a rustic, and only cowers for fear when spoken to.
彼女はおどおどして返事もできなかった
She faltered and could not answer―She was too nervous to answer.

content:
おとがい〔頤〕
〈名〉The chin

content.content: 二重頤
a double chin
頤を解く
to fall to laughing
人の頤を解く
to set people laughing
頤を叩く
to wag one's tongue

content:
おどかし〔嚇し〕
〈名〉A threat; a menace

content.content: なーにおどかしを言っているのだ
It is only a threat―He is only threatening.
彼のおどかしくらいなに怖いものか
I smile at his threats.
子どもおどかし
a bugbear

content:
おどかす〔嚇かす〕
〈他動〉To frighten, intimidate, terrify, scare, concuss, cow, bully, huff (one into doing something); to threaten (to kill―one with death); to menace (one with death); to impose on (one's imagination, etc.)

content.content: 彼は僕を殺すぞと言っておどかした
He threatened to kill me―threatened me with death―menaced me with death.
彼は相手が弱い女だと見るとおどかそうとする
When he has to deal with a helpless woman, he will try to intimidate her.
おどかしちゃいやよ
You frighten me!
彼らはおどかされて服従した
They were intimidated into submission―frightened into submission―cowed into submission.
おどかされて黙ってしまった
They were intimidated into silence―frightened into silence.
彼はおどかされて白状した
He was intimidated into confession―frightened into confession.
彼らをおどかして追い払った
I frightened them away―scared them away.
ちょっとおどかされた
I was scared just a little bit.
彼は僕らをおどかすためにあんなことを言うのだ
He says such things to frighten us―to terrify us.
あんなことくらいにおどかされてたまるものか
I am not going to be frightened at such bugbears.
彼は人をおどかして金をゆする
He extorts money by threats―blackmails people.
権幕でおどかす
to browbeat one
形{なり}でおどかす
to dazzle people by dress―impose on people by appearance
拳骨を振りまわして人をおどかす
to shake one's fist at a man―shake one's fist in his face
痰呵を切って人をおどかす
to hector people

content:
おとぎ〔お伽〕
〈名〉
1. (=お相手)keeping (one) company:(=する) to keep (one) company

content.content: 夜のお伽する
to do bedservice
お伽噺
a nursery tale―a fairy tale
お伽芝居
a pantomime

content: 2. (=看護)nursing the sick:(=する) to nurse (the sick); to tend (the sick); to attend on (a patient); to watch with, sit up with (an invalid)

おとぎばなし〔お伽噺〕
〈名〉A nursery tale; a fairy tale

おどけ〔お道化〕
〈名〉Joke; jest; fun; pleasantry; witticism; drollery; waggery; buffoonery; comicality; facetiousness; humour:(=る) to joke; to jest; to make a joke; to crack a joke; to be funny; to be witty; to be merry; to be pleasant (about anything):(=た) funny; droll; waggish; comical; facetious; humourous

おどけもの〔お道化者〕
〈名〉A joker; a humourist; a wag; a funny man; a buffoon

content:
おとこ〔男〕
〈名〉
1. (女に対しては)man:(人としては)a man; a male:(男性の意味なら)the male sex; the sterner sex:(また)a boy(と訳すことあり):(=の) man's; male; masculine

content.content: 男と女
man and woman
男は女より強い
Man is stronger than woman.
男は智、女は情
Man has a head to think; woman has a heart to feel.
男は外を治め、女は内を治む
“Man for the field, woman for the hearth.”
東男に京女
Tokyo for men, and Kyoto for women.
子どもは男か女か
Is the child a boy or a girl?
男になる
to attain man's estate―come of age
女が男になった
A woman is past bearing.
一人前の男にしてやる
I will make a man of you.
男じゃないか泣くな
Be a man, and don't cry!
男らしくし給え
Play the man!
俺も男だ
I am a man―not a woman.
これでも一匹の男だ
I fill a man's shoes.
それでも男か
Do you call yourself a man?
男ならいやとは言えまい
No man who is a man could refuse to do it.
男と見込んで
as man to man
男と見込んで頼む
I appeal to you as man to man.
男の付き合いはぜひこうありたいものだ
I like this sort of thing between man and man.
男は気で立つ
It is the spirit that makes the man.
男の中の男と言われている
He is called a man among men―the manliest of the men.
好い男だ
He is a handsome man―a good-looking man.
男盛りだ
He is in the prime of manhood.
日本人はいくつが男盛りか
When is a Japanese in his prime?
男心と秋の空
Man is as fickle as autumn weather―(西洋では)―“Woman is as fickle as April weather.”
あの女は男を知らない(男の肌に触れたことが無い)
She never knew man.
男を知らない女
a maiden―a virgin
あの女は男嫌いだ
She is a man-hater.
男好きだ
She is an amorous woman.
男好きのする顔だ
She has a face that attracts men.
男の四十は分別盛り
Forty is a man's years of discretion.
分別盛りの男だ
He is in his years of discretion.
大の男
a great big fellow
大の男が三人がかり
Three big men are at it.

content: 2. (=男の意気)a masculine spirit; manhood; honour; character; reputation

content.content: 男を立てる
to satisfy one's honour
男が立った
My honour is satisfied.
そんなことをしては男が立たぬ、男が廃る
If I do such a thing, I shall dishonour myself―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such conduct will dishonour me.
男を磨く
to build up a character
男を売る
to build up a reputation
男を見せる
to show one's manhood
男を上げた
He has risen in the public estimation.
このたびのことで男を上げた
The late affair has raised him in the public estimation―raised him in my estimation―raised him in my opinion.
男を下げた
He has fallen ［sunk］ in the public estimation.
今度のことで男を下げた
His conduct has lowered ［sunk］ him in the public estimation.

content: 3. (=情夫)a lover; a paramour

content.content: あの女は男を持っている
She has a lover.
男をこしらえる
to take up with a man―form a connection with a man
男を振り捨てる
to fling a lover over
男を乗り換える
to jilt a lover for another―take up with another man
実の有る男だ
He is a faithful lover.
不実な男だ
He is a faithless lover―a false lover.

content: 4. (=下男)a male servant; a man-servant; a servant; a man

content.content: うちの男にさして置いて上げましょう
I will make my man do it for you.

〈名〉A man's sash

おとこおや〔男親〕
〈名〉A father

content:
おとこぎ〔男気〕

content.content: 昔の江戸っ子は男気があった
The old-time Edokko used to have some chivalry in his nature.
男気のある人ならそんなことをされて黙っておらぬ

お前の男気はあっぱれだ

おとこぎらい〔男嫌い〕

content:

content.content: 男臭い女だ

content:
おとこげ〔男気〕
〈名〉One of the male persuasion

content.content: 男気の無い家だ
