おとこげいしゃ〔男芸者〕
〈名〉A toad-eater; a toady

content:
おとこごころ〔男心〕
〈名〉Man's heart

content.content: 男心と秋の空
Man is as fickle as autumn weather―(西洋では)―“Woman is as fickle as April weather.”

おとこころし〔男殺し〕
〈名〉A man-killer; a fascinating woman

おとこざか〔男坂〕
〈名〉The steeper slope (of the two)

content:
おとこざかり〔男盛り〕
〈名〉The prime of manhood

content.content: 彼は男盛りだ
He is in the prime of manhood.
日本人はいくつが男盛りか
When is a Japanese in his prime?

おとこじまん〔男自慢〕
〈形〉(He is) vain of his good looks

おとこしゅう〔男衆〕
〈名〉A man-servant; a servant; a man

content:
おとこしょたい〔男世帯〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おとこじょたい〔男世帯〕

おとこじょたい〔男世帯〕
〈名〉A womanless household; a bachelor's home

content:
おとこずき〔男好〕
〈形〉
1. (=男を好む)amorous (woman)
2. (=男の好きな)liked by men

content.content: 男好きのする顔だ
She has a face that attracts men.

content:
おとこだて〔男達〕
〈名〉A chivalrous spirit (among the commoners); the commoner's champion

content.content: 彼は土地の男だてをもって任じている
He calls himself the champion of the town.
彼は男だて肌がある
He has a dash of chivalry in his nature.
男だてふうがある
He has a dash of chivalry about him.
弱きを助け強きを挫くは男だての本領
It is the spirit of chivalry to fight for the oppressed against the oppressor.

おとこたらし〔男たらし〕
〈名〉A coquette; a queen of hearts

おとこなきになく〔男泣きに泣く〕
〈自動〉To be unmanned; to be overcome

おとこのこ〔男の子〕
〈名〉A boy

content:
おとこぶり〔男振り〕
〈名〉
1. (=容貌)(a man's) looks; personal advantages

content.content: 男ぶりが好い
He is good-looking―He has good looks―personal advantages.
男ぶりが上がった
He has improved in his looks.

content: 2. (=評判)public estimation

content.content: 彼は男ぶりを上げた
He has risen in the public estimation.
男ぶりを下げた
He has fallen ［sunk］ in the public estimation.

content:
おとこまさり〔男勝り〕
〈形〉Strong-minded

content.content: あの女は男勝りだ
She is a strong-minded woman―a virago―a termagant―more of a man than many a man.

おとこめかけ〔男妾〕
〈名〉A paramour

content:
おとこもち〔男持ち〕
〈形〉Gentlemen's

content.content: 男持ちの傘
a gentlemen's umbrella

content:
おとこやもめ〔男鰥〕
〈名〉A widower

content.content: 男やもめに蛆がわく
A widower can not take care of himself.

content:
おとこらしい〔男らしい〕
〈形〉Manly; manful

content.content: 男らしい振る舞いをせよ
Be a man!―Play the man!
男らしく本分を尽そう
Let us acquit ourselves like men!
人に迷惑をかけてまでも身の明かりを立てたのは男らしくない
It is not manly of him to clear himself at another's expense.
彼は(義務責任を回避せずして)潔く男らしき生涯を送った
He lived a manful life.

content:
おとさた〔音沙汰〕
〈名〉News; tidings; a letter

content.content: 音沙汰がある
(消息を聞くの意味なら)―to hear of one―(便りを聞くの意味なら)―hear from one
彼は三年前に家出してその後なんの音沙汰も無い
He left home three years ago, and has not been heard of since.
さらに音沙汰無し
Nothing has been heard of him.
梨のつぶての音沙汰無し
I have not heard from him―He has not been heard from.

content:
おとし〔落し〕
〈名〉
1. (=罠)a trap

content.content: 落としにかかる
to be caught in a trap
狐を落としにかける
to trap a fox

content: 2. (=火鉢の落とし)the ash-pan (of a wooden brazier)

おどし〔嚇し〕
〈名〉
1. A threat; a menace; an intimidation

content.content: 彼の歎願はおどし交じりだ
His request is accompanied with threats.
彼のおどしくらいなに怖いものか
I smile at his threats.
この子はおどしが利かぬ
The child laughs at threats.
おどし文句
threatening language―a threat
こけおどし
a dazzling display

content: 2. (=案山子{かかし})a scarecrow

おどし〔縅〕
〈名〉The braid (of an armour)

content.content: 緋縅の鎧
a scarlet-braided armour

content:
おとしあな〔落し穴〕
〈名〉A pit; a pitfall

content.content: 落とし穴に落ちる
to fall into a pit
落とし穴に陥る
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap

content:
おとしいれる〔陥れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=攻め取る)to reduce, capture, take (a castle)

content.content: 要塞を陥れる
to reduce a fortress

content: 2. (=欺いて引込む)to ensnare, entrap (a man)

content.content: 人を術中に陥れる
to ensnare a man―entrap a man
彼は始終僕を術中に陥れようとしている
He is always setting traps for me―laying snares for me.
彼は人を陥れるような質問をする
He asks captious questions.

content: 3. (=誘惑する)to tempt, allure, entice (a man)

content.content: あれは人を陥れる策だ
It is a ruse to entice people.
人を罪悪に陥れる
to tempt a man to sin
人を誘惑に陥れる
to lead one into temptations

content:
おとしうえ〔お年上〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おとしがしら〔お年頭〕

content:
おとしがしら〔お年頭〕
〈名〉A senior

content.content: あなたの方がお年頭だ
You are my senior.
どうぞお年頭からお先に
Age before youth!―(こっけいに言えば)―Age before honesty!―Age before respectability!

おとしだね〔落し胤〕
〈名〉An illegitimate child, a love-child (of a person of rank)

おとしたまご〔落し玉子〕
〈名〉Poached eggs

おどしつける〔嚇し付ける〕
〈他動〉To browbeat; to bully; to hector

おとしど〔落し戸〕
〈名〉A trap-door:(舞台の落し戸は)a slot

content:
おとしぬし〔落し主〕
〈名〉The loser (of an article); the owner (of lost property)

content.content: 落とし物を落とし主へ返す
to restore lost property to its owner

content:
おとしばなし〔落し話〕
〈名〉A story with a comic ending; a story with a point; a pointed story

content.content: 落とし話のオチ
the point of the story

おとしぶみ〔落し文〕
〈名〉A letter purposely dropped on the road

content:
おとしもの〔落し物〕
〈名〉A lost article; lost property

content.content: 落とし物をした
I have lost something―dropped something.
落とし物を持主へ返す
to restore lost property to its owner

content:
おどしもんく〔嚇し文句〕
〈名〉Threatening language; a threat

content.content: おどし文句を並べる
to try to intimidate one with threats
紋切形のおどし文句を並べる
to array the stereotyped forms of threat
彼のおどし文句は恐るるに足らぬ
I smile at his threats.

content:
おとす〔落す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=上から落す)to drop; to let fall

content.content: 敷石の上に時計を落とした
I dropped my watch on the pavement.
鳥を落とす(撃ち落とす)
to drop a bird―fetch a bird―bring down a bird
飛ぶ鳥を落とす勢いだ
He nods and shakes the spheres.
声を落とす
to drop one's voice
馬車から落とされた
I was spilt from a carriage.

content: 2. (=失う)to lose; to drop

content.content: 財布を落とした
I have lost my purse―dropped my purse.
来る途中で落としたに違い無い
I must have dropped it on my way here.
命を落とす
to lose one's life
馬が馬蹄を落とした
The horse has lost a shoe―cast a shoe.
裸で落とした例し無し
“He who carries nothing, loses nothing.”

content: 3. (=脱漏する)to omit (a word); to leave out (a name); to miss, miss out (a word); to pass over (a detail)

content.content: 落とした名前がある
I have omitted some names―left out some names.
今の作文に書き落としたものがあります
I have left out something in my composition.
先生の言われたことを聞き落としました
I missed what you said.
詳しいことをつい言い落として言わなかった
I have passed over some details.

content: 4. (=去る)to remove; to take away; to take off; to take out

content.content: 眉を落とす
to shave off one's eyebrows
彼は口髯を落とした
He has shaved off his moustache.
垢を落とす
to wash away the dirt
しみを落とす
to remove the stain―take out the stain

content: 5. (=位を落とす)to abase; to debase; to degrade; to reduce; to lower

content.content: 将校の位を落とす
to degrade an officer―reduce an officer (to the ranks)
貨幣の位を落とす
to debase coin
品物の品位を落とす
to lower the standard of quality
品物の品位を落とさぬように
The standard of quality must be maintained.
そんなことをしては紳士の品格を落とす
It would be beneath the dignity of a gentleman―beneath a gentleman―to do such a thing.
信用を落とす
to lose one's credit―fall in the public estimation
名を落とす
to lose one's reputation
家名を落とす
to reflect on one's family
家名を落としてはならぬ
You must keep up the credit of your family.
家名を落としたことが無い
The house was never known but to its credit.
威信を落とす
to lose one's prestige
威信はいったん落とすと挽回し難い
Prestige, once lost, is irretrievable.
あんな先生がいると学校の評判を落とす
Such teachers would injure the reputation of the school.

content: 6. (=貶す)to depreciate (a man); to detract from (one's merits); to take from (the value)

content.content: 人の価値を貶そうというような精神はもうとう無い
Nothing can be farther from my intentions than to detract from others' merits.
文章が悪いために本の価値を貶す
The badness of style takes from the value of the book.

content: 7. (=気を落とす)to lose heart; to be disheartened; to be depressed; to be dejected; to be cast down

content.content: 力を落とす
to lose heart―be disheartened
この困難を見て力を落とした
I have lost heart―My heart fails me―My heart dies within me―My heart sinks within me―at the sight of the difficulties.
これしきのことで力を落としてはいかん
You must not lose heart over such a trifle.
ひどく力を落とす
to break one's heart
彼は一人息子を亡くなしてひどく力を落としている
He is broken-hearted―dreadfully cut up―disconsolate―over the death of his only son.
元気を落とす
to droop―despond―be despondent―be dejected―be depressed―be dispirited
彼は元気を落としている
He is depressed in spirits―in low spirits.
城を落とす、要塞を落とす
to reduce a fortress―capture a fortress―take a castle
人を罪に落とす
to bring a man to justice
瘧{おこり}を落とす
to cure oneself of ague
狐を落とす
to exorcise one of evil spirits
風呂を落とす
to empty the bath-tub
場所に金を落とす
to spend money to enrich the people of the place

content:
おどす〔嚇す〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: おどかす〔嚇かす〕
おどしてもすかしてもどうしても白状しない
Neither threats nor entreaties could make her confess.
おどしたりすかしたりしてとうとう白状さした
What by threats, what by entreaties, I finally made her confess.

content:
おとずれ〔音信〕
〈名〉A message; news; tidings

content.content: おとずれをする
to send one a message
悦びのおとずれ
glad tidings―the gospel

おとずれ〔訪れ〕
〈名〉A visit; a call:(=る) to visit (one); to pay (one) a visit; to call on (one); to beat up one's quarters

content:
おとつい〔一昨日〕
〈名、副〉→『

content.content: おととい〔一昨日〕

content:
おととい〔一昨日〕
〈名、副〉The day before yesterday

content.content: おとといの朝
the morning before last
おとといの晩
the evening before last
おととい来い
Never darken my door in future!

おととし〔一昨年〕
〈名、副〉The year before last

content:
おとな〔大人〕
〈名〉
1. A grown-up (person); an adult; a man

content.content: 大人になる
to grow up―attain man's estate―arrive at manhood―(女なら)―arrive at womanhood
少年が大人になる
A boy grows into a man.
親が死ぬと子どもは急に大人になるものだ
The loss of his parents will make a man of a boy.
君は東京へ来て大人になった
Tokyo life has made a man of you.
この子は大人のような口の利きようをする
The child talks as if he were a man―talks like a man.

content: 2. (=大人らしい人)a man of moderate views

content.content: あの人のいうことは大人だ
He has moderate views.
人は年をとると大人になる
As a man grows older, he will grow in moderation.

content:
おとなげない〔大人気無い〕
〈形〉Unmanly

content.content: あんな子どもを相手にけんかなどして大人気無い
It is beneath your years to quarrel with such a stripling.

content:
おとなしい〔大人しい〕
〈形〉Gentle (horse); mild (disposition); meek (wife); modest (girl); docile (pupil); lamblike (man); well-behaved (child); well-conducted (boy); good (boy or girl); moderate (views); quiet (colour, etc.)

content.content: おとなしい子だこと
What a good boy!―What a good girl!
おとなしくなさい
Be a good boy!―Be a good girl!―Learn to behave (yourself)!
おとなしくしましょう
I will be good.
たいそうおとなしい子だ
He is as good as gold.
お父様が家にいると子どもらがおとなしい
When papa is at home, the youngsters are on their good behaviour.
僕はおとなしい娘が好きだ
I like a modest girl.
おとなしい人だ
He is a man of mild disposition―a man of moderate views.
おとなしい生徒だ
He is a docile pupil―a lamb of a boy.
おとなしい馬だ
He is a gentle horse.
おとなしい色だ、おとなしい模様だ
It is a quiet colour―a quiet design.
彼はおとなしく僕の意見を聞いた
He took it like a lamb.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: おとなしく僕の話を聞いていた
He listened to me with patience.
ここはおとなしく帰って下さい
Go home quietly, will you?
彼は年を取っておとなしくなった
He has sobered down with age.
先方がおとなしく出た
The other party demeaned himself peaceably.
おとなしく出るとつけ上がる奴だ
He will presume on your good nature.

content:
おとなびた〔大人びた〕
〈形〉Precocious

content.content: 大人びた子どもは嫌いだ
I don't like a precocious child―an old head on young shoulders.

おとなぶる〔大人振る〕
〈自動〉To assume a grown-up air

content:
おとならしい〔大人らしい〕
〈形〉Manly (boy); moderate (views)

content.content: 大人らしい少年だ
He is a manly boy.
あの人のいうことは大人らしい
He holds moderate views.

おどみ〔澱み〕
〈名〉A sediment; a deposit; a precipitate

おどむ〔澱む〕
〈自動〉To be deposited; to be precipitated

おとめ〔乙女〕
〈名〉A virgin; a maiden; a maid

content:
おとも〔お供〕
〈名〉An attendant; a follower:(=する) to attend on (one's master); to accompany (a friend); to go with (any one)

content.content: 彼はお供を三人つけておった
He was attended by three followers.
おいでになるならお供致しましょう
If you are going, I will go with you.

content:
おどらす〔躍らす〕
〈他動〉

content.content: 胸を躍らす
One's heart leaps―One's heart gives a leap.

content:
おとり〔囮〕
〈名〉A call-bird; a decoy; a lure

content.content: 娘を囮に使って人を呼ぶ
She uses her daughter as a decoy to lure people.
共謀者の囮になる
to play booty

content:
おどり〔踊〕
〈名〉
1. Dancing:(一種の踊)a Japanese dance

content.content: 踊りを踊る
to dance (a Japanese dance)
踊りの手
movements of the dance―(に相当するは舞踏の足)―steps in dancing
踊りの師匠
a dancing-master―(女なら)―a dancing-mistress

content: 2. (=二重利息)double interest (for the month when the bond is renewed)

おどりあがる〔躍り上がる〕
〈自動〉To jump up; to spring up

content.content: 彼は躍り上がらんばかりに悦んだ
He nearly jumped for joy.

おどりこ〔踊子〕
〈名〉A dancing-girl; a dancer; a danseuse

content:
おどりこむ〔躍り込む〕
〈自動〉To jump into, spring into, leap into (a place)

content.content: 一人の水兵が敵艦に躍り込んだ
A seaman sprang on board.

content:
おとる〔劣る〕
〈他動〉To be inferior to (something); to be worse than (something); to be below (something); to fall behind (none); to yield to (none); to be second to (none); to fall short of (one's expectations)

content.content: 甲は乙より品が劣る
The one is inferior to the other in quality.
犬畜生にも劣る奴だ
He is worse than a brute.
乞食にも劣る奴だ
He is worse than a beggar.
畜生にも劣る仕業だ
It is an act unworthy of a brute.
彼は学問では兄に劣る
He is below his brother in scholarship―He is not so good a scholar as his brother.
学問は少し兄に劣る
He is not quite so good a scholar as his brother.
学問ははるかに兄に劣る
He is not nearly so good a scholar as his brother.
学問は兄に劣らぬ
He is quite as good a scholar as his brother―no less a scholar than his brother.
学問は兄に勝るとも劣らぬ
He is not less a scholar than his brother.
学問では誰にも劣らぬ
He is as good a scholar as anybody―He is second to none in scholarship―He falls behind none in scholarship―He yields to none in scholarship―He yields the palm to none in scholarship.
彼は勉強では誰にも劣らぬ
He works as hard as any one―He is second to none in diligence.
遊戯をやらしては誰にも劣らぬ
He can play as well as any one―with the best of them.
英語を話させては誰にも劣らぬ
He can speak English as well as any one―with the best of them.
長門は何国の戦闘艦に比べても劣らぬ
The Nagato compares favourably with any battleship afloat.
成績は予想に劣る
The result falls short of my expectations―does not come up to my expectations.
成績は予想に劣らぬ
The result has come up to my expectations.
智力においては日本人は白晢人に劣らぬ
In intellect, the Japanese are equal to the Whites―on a level with the Whites―on a plane with the Whites―on a par with the Whites.

content:
おどる〔躍る〕
〈自動〉To jump; to leap; to spring

content.content: 胸躍る
One's heart leaps―One's heart gives a leap.
嬉しさに胸躍る
My heart leaped for joy.
これを思えば血湧き肉躍る
My blood tingles at the thought.

content:
おどろ〔荊棘〕
〈名〉
1. (=叢林)a thick bush; a thicket
2. (=乱れた様)disorder

content.content: 髪をおどろに振り乱して
with dishevelled hair

content:
おとろえる〔衰える〕
〈自動〉To decline; to decay, go to decay, fall into decay; to degenerate; to deteriorate; to wane; to waste; to fade; to wither; to go downhill; to fall off

content.content: 国が衰える
A country declines in prosperity.
文明が進むに従って詩が衰える
As civilization advances, poetry declines.
あの店は衰えるばかりだ
The firm is fast declining―fast going downhill.
武士道が衰えた
Bushido has decayed―gone to decay―fallen into decay.
健康が衰える
to decline in health―Health fails
身体が衰える
to be enfeebled―be weakened―waste away―run down
彼はひどく健康(身体)が衰えている
He is broken in health―much run down.
年を取って身体が衰えている
He is infirm with age―decrepit.
病のために身体が衰えている
He is enfeebled by disease―wasted by disease―debilitated.
営養を取らないから身体が衰えるばかりだ
He is wasting away from lack of nutrition.
病人は身体が衰えているから手術ができない
The invalid is too weak to be operated upon.
運動をすると年をとっても身体が衰えない
Exercise will keep your bones green.
気力が衰える
to decline in energy
元気が衰える
to lose one's energy
彼はだいぶ元気が衰えた
He has lost much of his energy.
年を取っても少しも元気が衰えない
Though he is old, he has lost none of his energy―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Age has deprived him of none of his energy.
運が衰える
One's fortune declines―One's star wanes.
彼の人気は衰えかけている
His popularity is on the wane.
彼の勢力が衰えた
His influence has declined―His influence has waned―He has lost his influence.
容色が衰える
to lose one's good looks―Beauty fades
彼女は容色が衰えぬ
She has not lost her good looks.
年を取っても容色が衰えぬ
Age can not wither her―She is well conserved.
白晢人種は衰える
The white race is degenerating―deteriorating―falling off.
この学説は衰えた
The theory has lost credit―lost ground.
砲火が衰える
Firing slackens.

オドロオドロ
〈擬音詞〉The roll (of thunder or a drum)

content:
おどろかす〔驚かす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=驚愕せしむ)to surprise; to astonish; to astound; to amaze

content.content: 彼の成功は人を驚かした
He success surprised people.
日本の勝利は世界を驚かした
Japan's victories astonished the world―Japan's victories were a revelation to the world.
君を驚かすことがある
I have a surprise for you.
彼は一世を驚かす人だ
He will do wonders―set the river on fire.

content: 2. (=驚愕せしむ)to frighten; to scare; to terrify; to horrify; to alarm

content.content: 外敵襲来の風説が満都の人を驚かした
The rumour of an invasion alarmed the whole city.
彼は怖い話をして愚夫愚婦を驚かしている
He likes to frighten old women of both sexes by his weird tales.

content: 3. (=喫驚せしむ)to startle; to electrify; to spring a surprise upon (one)

content.content: 急報が全都を驚かした
The alarm startled―electrified―the whole city.
この事実は専門家を驚かすに足る
The fact is enough to startle the specialist.
新説を唱えて世を驚かす
to spring a new theory upon the world

content:
おどろき〔驚き〕
〈名〉
1. (=意外の驚き、驚愕)surprise; astonishment; amazement

content.content: その驚き察すべし
His surprise may be imagined.
これを見し時の彼の驚きはいかばかり
What was (not) his surprise at the sight?
あまりの驚きに茫然自失した
I was stupefied with amazement.

content: 2. (=不思議の驚き、驚嘆)wonder; admiration

content.content: その驚きはごもっとも
You may well wonder.
(Aristotle 曰く)驚きは哲学の始めなり
Wonder is the first cause of philosophy.
驚きの目を見張る
to stare in wonder

content: 3. (=怖い驚き、驚怖)fright; scare; terror; horror

content.content: 彼女はあまりの驚きに病気を起こした
She was ill of fright.

content:
おどろきいる〔驚き入る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=意外に驚き入る)to be filled with surprise ［astonishment, amazement］

content.content: 実に驚き入った成功だ
I am filled with astonishment at his success.

content: 2. (=不思議に驚き入る)to be filled with wonder ［admiration］

content.content: 実に驚き入った学問だ
I am filled with wonder at his learning―filled with admiration for his scholarship.

content:
おどろく〔驚く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=意外に驚く、驚愕する、喫驚する)to be surprised (at anything); to be astonished (at anything); to be astounded (at anything); to be amazed (at anything); to be startled (at anything); to be struck (with anything)

content.content: 彼の成功には驚く
I am surprised at his success―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His success surprises me.
彼の助かったのには実に驚く
I am astonished at his escape―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His escape astonishes me.
彼の生きていたのを見て全く驚いた
I was amazed to see him alive.
驚いたことには彼は生きておった
To my surprise,―To my astonishment,―To my amazement,―he was alive.
君がこのことを知らないとは驚く
I am surprised that you should not know it―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your ignorance surprises me.
進歩の早いのには驚く
I am surprised at the rapidity of his progress―It is surprising how rapidly he progresses―It is astonishing what progress he makes.
その女の美しいのに驚いた
I was struck with her beauty.
ぶったおれんばかりに驚いた
I was struck all of a heap.
居合わした人々の驚くまいことか死んだと思った人が起き上がった
To the amazement of the people present, the man whom they had supposed to be dead raised himself in his bed.
あれで英語が得意だというから驚くじゃないか
Is it not surprising that he should pride himself on his English?
僕の驚くのは彼の大胆不敵さ加減だ
What surprises me is his audacity.
驚いてものが言えない
I am struck dumb with astonishment―I am dumfounded―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Astonishment deprives me of my power of speech.
彼の成功は驚くことはない
His success is nothing to be surprised at.
これは驚いた
This is a surprise.
これは実に驚いた
This is, indeed, a surprise.
まぁ驚いた
Well, I never!
あれは何事があっても驚かない人だ
Nothing can startle him.
驚くなかれ税金二百万円
We pay 2,000,000 yen in taxes―What do you think of that?

content: 2. (=不思議に驚く、驚嘆する)to wonder (at anything); to marvel (at anything)

content.content: 彼が成功したというから驚く
I wonder at his success―I wonder that he should have succeeded.
僕は彼の成功したのはあえて驚かぬ
I do not wonder at his success.
彼の成功したのに驚くに足らぬ
It is no wonder that he should have succeeded―His success is not to be wondered at.
日本人の勇敢には驚かぬ者は無かった
All the world marvelled at Japanese valour.
彼の学問には実に驚く
I wonder at his learning.
彼の進歩は実に驚いたものだ
He makes wonderful progress.
彼の勉強は実に驚いたものだ
He shows wonderful industry.
彼の学問は別に驚くことはない
His scholarship is nothing to wonder at.
あれで学士だというから驚くね
I wonder that he should be a university man.
彼の大胆さ加減には驚かざるを得ぬ
I can not but wonder at his audacity.
驚いて目を見張る
to stare in wonder
驚いて眺める
to stare at anything
あの人の前でしゃれでも言おうものなら驚いて顔を眺めるぜ
If you allow yourself to be witty in his presence, he will stare at you.
あれで自分では美人のつもりだから驚く
She fancies herself to be beautiful.

content: 3. (=怖がって驚く、驚怖する)to be frightened (at anything); to be scared (at anything); to be terrified (at anything); to be horrified (at anything); to be alarmed (at anything); (a horse) takes fright, shies (at a motor-car)

content.content: 子どもが虎を見て驚いた
The child was frightened at the tiger―seared at the tiger.
市民がペスト発生と聞いて驚いた
The whole city was alarmed at the outbreak of pest.
婦人は驚いて持病を起こした
The lady was ill of fright.
彼は驚いて持病を起こした
He was frightened into fits.
驚いてほどんど発狂した
He was frightened out of his wits.
驚いて気を失った者がある
Some fainted from fright.
死ぬほど驚いた
I was frightened to death.
彼は驚いて顔色を変えた
He turned pale in alarm.
馬が驚いて落馬した
The horse took fright and threw him.
馬が自動車を見て驚いて跳ねたのだ
The horse shied at the sight of a motor-car.
驚きやすい馬だ
He is a skittish horse.
驚いたことには家は火災を起こしておった
I found to my alarm that the house was on fire.
驚いたことには火薬庫に火がついた
I found to my terror that the powder-magazine had caught fire.
驚いたことには相手がコレラにかかった
I found to my horror that my companion was attacked with cholera.
彼はどんな困難に逢っても驚かぬ
He will boggle at no difficulty.
いくら金がかかっても驚かぬ
He will stop at no expense.
いかなる難局に臨んでも驚かぬ
He is equal to any occasion―He will rise to the occasion.
あれはどんなことがあっても驚かない人だ
Nothing can discompose him.

content:
おどろくべき〔驚く可き〕
〈形〉Surprising (success); astonishing (escape); astounding (news); amazing (result); startling (fact); wonderful (man); marvellous (feat); miraculous (cure); prodigious (scholar); stupendous (achievement)

content.content: 彼は大胆驚くべし
His daring is amazing.
ここに驚くべき事実がある
Here is a startling fact.
その効実に驚くべし
The effect is miraculous.
酸素治療法の効果は驚くべきものあり
Oxypathy has done wonders.
航空術の進歩実に驚くべきものあり
Aeronautics has made wonderful progress.

content:
おないどし〔同い年〕
〈名〉The same age

content.content: 彼は君と同い年だ
He is (of) the same age as you are―(of) your own age.
皆同い年だ
They are all of an age.

content:
おなか〔お腹〕
〈名〉One's inside; the belly

content.content: お腹が空いた
(直訳すれば)My honourable inside is empty―(意訳すれば)―I am hungry.
お腹がいっぱいだ、お腹が苦しい
I am full.
お腹が張った
I am full of wind.

おながざる〔尾長猿〕
〈名〉The long-tailed monkey

おながどり〔尾長鳥〕
〈名〉The blue magpie

content:
おながれ〔お流れ〕
〈名〉Abandonment

content.content: お流れになる
to be abandoned―given up―over
京都行きはお流れになった
My trip to Kyoto is over.

content:
おなご〔女子〕
〈名〉A woman

content.content: 女子の念力
a woman's love

おなごども〔女子共〕
〈名〉The women folk

content:
おなさけ〔お情け〕
〈名〉Charity; mercy

content.content: あの男はお情けで使っておくのだ
I employ him out of charity―for charity's sake.
彼はお情けで及第したのだ
He has passed by the mercy of his examiners.
彼らはお情けで生きている
They exist on sufferance.

content:
おなじ〔同じ〕
〈形〉
1. The same; the self-same; the identical:(ある熟語においては)one's own; a:(接続詞に用いれば)as; what

content.content: 僕は君と同じ時計を持っている
I have the same watch as yours.
君と同じ店で買った
I bought it at the same store that you did.
これは僕が無くなしたのと同じ時計だ
(同じような時計なら)This is the same watch as I lost―(同一の時計なら)―This is the same watch that I lost.
僕は彼と同じ学校へ行く
I attend the same school that he does―I go to the same school with him.
僕も君と同じ意見だ
I am of the same opinion as you―We are of a mind.
彼は君と同じくらいの年輩だ
He is about your own age.
皆同じ年輩だ
They are all of an age.
皆同じ背格好だ
They are all of a size.
同じ釜の飯を食った仲だ
We have eaten off the same trencher―lived under the same roof.
英国は日本と同じ島国だ
England is an island, the same as Japan.
同じ日本でも九州と奥州はだいぶ違う
Kyushu and Oshu are widely different, though in the same country.
読書の精神を養うは食物の身体を養うと同じことだ
Reading nourishes the mind as food does the body.
東洋における日本は西洋における英国と同じ地位だ
Japan is in the East what England is in the west.
両者はほとんど同じだ
They are much the same.
君と僕はほとんど同じ事情だ
We are in much the same case.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 魚が空気を吸わずに生きておれぬのは人間も同じだ
A fish can no more live without air than man can.
鯨の魚にあらざること牛馬と同じ
A whale is no more a fish than a horse is.
彼は(生きているとは名ばかりで)死んだも同じだ
He is as good as dead―virtually dead―practically dead―dead to all intents and purposes.
僕に本を読むなというのは死刑の宣告も同じだ
To forbid me to read is as good as a death-sentence to me.
まるで牢屋へ入ったも同じ生活だ
It is no better than prison life.
まるで乞食も同じだ
He is no better than a beggar.
僕だって同じ人間だ
One man is as good as another.
帝王も乞食も同じ人間だ
Princes and paupers are fellow-men―fellow-creatures.
彼は神でもなんでもない我々と同じ人間だ
He is no more a god than we are.
君も同じ日本人だ
You are my fellow-Japanese.
同じ金を使うなら綺麗に使え
If you must spend money, be free with it.
同じ行くのなら早く行った方が好い
If you must go, you had better go quickly.
同じ生きるなら立派に生きよう
If we must live, let us live nobly.
同じ死ぬなら死に花を咲かせる
If I must die, I will die gloriously.
同じ暮らすなら面白おかしく暮らそう
If I must live, I will live merrily.
同じ物ばかりだと飽きるから何か変った物にしよう
Let us, have something else for a change.
いずこも同じ秋の夕暮
Autumn is autumn everywhere.

content:
おなじうする〔同じうする〕
〈他動〉To have the same (thing)

content.content: 二人は長短共に同じうしている
They have the same merits and the same faults.
これはあれと性質を同じうしている
This is of the same nature as that.

content:
おなじく〔同じく〕
〈副〉The same; likewise; in like manner; too; as well; equally:(同じ事を繰返す代りなら)ditto:(打消に伴えば)(not) either

content.content: 僕も君と同じく人間だ
I am a man, (the same) as you are.
僕も君と同じく感じが有る
I likewise can feel,―I can feel, too―I can feel as well.
僕も同じく知らぬ
I do not know, either.
僕は君と同じく発狂してはおらぬ
I am no more mad than you are.
皆同じく理性を有する人間だ
We are all men equally endowed with reason.

content:
おなじこと〔同じ事〕
〈名〉The same thing

content.content: 皆帰するところ同じことだ
They all come to the same thing―They are as broad as they are long.
どれも同じことだ
They are six of one and half-a-dozen of the other―There is nothing to choose between the two.
彼が成功しようと失敗しようと僕にとっては同じことだ
His success or failure is all the same to me―all one to me―His success or failure makes no difference to me.
(級の順番などは)十年も経てば同じことになる
It will make no difference ten years hence.
金は有っても無くても同じことだ
Money is indifferent to me.
彼は(生きているとは名ばかりで)死んだも同じことだ
He is as good as dead―virtually dead―practically dead―dead to all intents and purposes.
彼はいつも同じことばかり繰返している
He is constantly harping on the same string.
頂戴したも同じことです(お志でたくさん)
I will take the will for the deed.
現金でくれても同じことじゃないか
Isn't it the same to you if you pay me in cash?
同じことなら後で払おう
If it is the same to you. I'll pay you afterward.
同じことならフランス語を選ぶ
If I must take either, I will take French.
同じことなら面白おかしく暮らそう
If we must live, let us live a merry life.

content:
おなじよう〔同じ様〕
〈形〉Similar; like:(叙述に用いれば)alike

content.content: 皆同じ様だ
They all look alike.
日本にも同じ様な習慣がある
There is a similar custom in Japan.
二人は同じ様な長短を有している
They have like merits and faults.
君と僕の事情は同じ様だ
Our cases are similar―much the same.

content:
おなべ〔お鍋〕
〈名〉A kitchen-maid; a kitchen-drudge

content.content: 田吾作とお鍋
Jack and Jill.

content:
おなみ〔男波〕
〈名〉An advancing wave

content.content: 男波女波
advancing and receding waves

content:
おなら
〈名〉Wind; a fart

content.content: おならをする
to break wind―fast

content:
おなり〔お成り〕
〈名〉A visit (of an august personage)

content.content: 増上寺に公方様のお成りがあった
The Shogun was pleased to visit to Zojoji.

おなんどいろ〔お納戸色〕
〈名〉Greyish blue

content:
おに〔鬼〕
〈名〉
1. An ogre; a fiend; a demon; a devil

content.content: あれは鬼のような人だ
He is a devil incarnate.
鬼のような顔をしている
He is hard-featured―hard-favoured.
鬼のような親
unnatural parents
心を鬼にする
to steel one's heart against pity―harden oneself against mercy―divest oneself of humanity
心の鬼
conscience
心の鬼が身を責める
My conscience picks ［twinges, smites］ me―I feel the pangs of conscience.
鬼の目に涙
to wring tears from the hardest heart
鬼に法衣を着せたよう
He is a wolf in sheep's clothing.
鬼の念仏
At last the devil turns saint.
鬼の霍乱{かくらん}
The strongest are not proof against illness.
渡る世間に鬼は無い
Man is man everywhere.
来年のことを言うと鬼が笑う
Next year is the devil's joke.
鬼に金棒
That is the very thing for me―just the thing for me.
鬼も見慣れた鬼が好い
One will come to like what one is habituated to.
鬼を退治する
to slay the ogre―(西洋風に言うと)―kill the giant
鬼の首でも取ったように
He talks as if he had killed a giant.
鬼の首でもとったつもり
He has found a mare's nest.
銭ある時は鬼をも使う
“Money makes the mare to go.”
福は内鬼は外
In with luck! Out with the demon!
鬼の留守に洗濯
We will wash before the ogre comes―“When the cat is away, the mice will play.”
鬼も十八
“A girl is sweet at seventeen”―“Sweet seventeen.”
鬼も十八番茶も出花
“Everything is good in its season.”
傀儡師首に
The puppet-player comes―
掛けたる頭陀袋
A bag hangs from his neck;
仏出そうか
He can produce his saint
鬼を出そうか
Or devil at your beck.

content: 2. (=亡霊)a ghost; a departed spirit

content.content: 異城の鬼となる
to die in a foreign land

content: 3. (=債鬼)a creditor; a dun

content.content: 鬼に責められる
to be dunned for debts

content: 4. (=鬼ごっこの鬼)the tagger; it:(目隠しの鬼)the hoodman

content.content: 君が鬼だ
You are it.

おにあざみ〔鬼薊〕
〈名〉The horse-thistle

おにがしま〔鬼ケ島〕
〈名〉The ogres' island

おにがわら〔鬼瓦〕
〈名〉A ridge-end tile; a gargoyle

content:
おにごっこ〔鬼ごっこ〕
〈名〉Tag; prisoners' base:(目隠し鬼ごっこ)blindman's buff; hoodman-blind

content.content: 鬼ごっこする
to play tag―play blindman's buff
鬼ごっこの鬼
the tagger―it―the hoodman

content:
おにごと〔鬼事〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おにごっこ〔鬼ごっこ〕

おにづら〔鬼面〕
〈名〉(面)harsh feature:(人)a hard-featured man; a hard-favoured man

おにば〔鬼歯〕
〈名〉A protruding tooth

おにばば〔鬼婆〕
〈名〉A hag; a harridan; a vixen; a termagant; a virago

おにび〔鬼火〕
〈名〉A will-o'-the-wisp; a Jack-o'-lantern; ignis fatuus

おにゆり〔鬼百合〕
〈名〉The tiger-lily

content:
おねじ〔雄螺旋〕
〈名〉A male screw

content.content: 雄ねじと雌ねじ
screw and nut

content:
おの〔斧〕
〈名〉An axe; a hatchet

content.content: 二葉にして断たざれば終に斧を用うるに至る
An evil should be nipped in the bud―destroyed in the egg.
蟷螂{とうろう}の斧をもって龍車に向かうが如し
“It is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.”

おのえ〔尾上〕
〈名〉The summit of a mountain

content:
おのおの〔各〕
〈形〉Each; respective; several

content.content: 人おのおの長短あり
Each man has his own merits and faults.
国々おのおのその風俗がある
Each country has its own customs.
おのおのの位に準じて恩賞があった
They were rewarded according to their respective ranks.
おのおのの専門に熱心だ
They are devoted to their respective professions.
おのおのの家に引取った
They returned to their several homes.

content:
おのが〔己が〕
〈形〉One's own

content.content: 己が罪
one's own fault
失敗したら己が罪だ
It is your own fault if you fail―You alone will be to blame for your failure―You will have to thank yourself for your failure―Your failure will lie at your own door.
君が死んだら己が罪だ
Your blood shall be on your own head.
人は己が利益を知らぬ
People are blind to their own interests.
陰陽師己が身の上知らず
The fortune-teller can not tell his own fortune.
己が頭の蠅を追え
Mind your own business.

content:
おのがじし〔己がじし〕
〈副〉Each his own

content.content: 己がじし務めを尽すべし
Let each man do his own duty.
己がじし務めを
Let each man play his lotted part
卒えし後にこそ
With punctuality,
花の影には
And he shall stand with joyful heart
立つ可かりけれ
Beneath the blossoming tree.

content:
おのこり〔お残り〕
〈名〉One's leavings; the remnants (of one's dinner); the remains (of a feast)

content.content: お残り頂戴
Let me have your leavings!―the remnants of your dinner!―the remains of the feast!

content:
おのずから〔自ら〕
〈副〉Of itself; naturally; spontaneously

content.content: 読書百遍義おのずから通ず
Read a hundred times over, and the meaning will become clear of itself.
事実はおのずから明らかだ
The fact speaks for itself―The fact is self-evident.
湾はおのずから良港をなす
The bay makes a natural harbour.
言葉はおのずから歌になっている
The words form a spontaneous song.
美しい思想はおのずから詩になる
Beautiful sentiments naturally―readily―take the form of poetry.

content:
おのずと〔自ずと〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: おのずから〔自ら〕
雑草はおのずと生える
Weeds grow of themselves.

content:
おののく〔戦く〕
〈自動〉To tremble; to quake; to shudder

content.content: 恐れおののく
to tremble for fear―to be in fear and trembling

content:
おのれ〔己〕
〈代名詞〉Oneself:(=の) one's own

content.content: 己に克つ
to conquer oneself―control oneself―be master of oneself
己を知る
to know oneself―know one's own limitations
己を知れ
Know thyself!
己をもって人を量る
to judge of others by oneself―measure another's foot by one's own last
恭謙己を持す
to hold oneself with modesty
己より出づるものは己に返る
A wrong recoils on oneself.
己の欲せざるところを人に施すなかれ
“Do to others as you would have others do to you”―“Do to others as you would be done by.”

content: 〈人称代名詞〉You (in strong language)

content.content: おのれ親の仇敵思い知れ
You, my father's enemy, feel my vengeance!
酒無くて何の己が桜かな
What is the cherry without wine?
おのれ生かしておくべきか
By Heavens, I will have your heart's blood!

content:
おは〔尾羽〕
〈名〉Wings and tail→『

Auntie

content:
おば〔叔母、伯母、小母〕

content.content: (子どもがいう)おばちゃん
Auntie

おばあさん〔お婆さん〕
〈名〉
1. (=祖母)a grandmother; granny
2. (=老婆)an old lady; an old woman

content.content: お婆さんのおしゃれ
She persists in blooming into the midst of winter.

おばあちゃん〔お祖母ちゃん〕
〈名〉Grandma; granny

content:
おはうちからした〔尾羽打枯らした〕
〈形〉Shabby (dress); seedy (appearance)

content.content: 尾羽打ち枯らした浪人
a seedy-looking lordless samurai
こう尾羽打ち枯らしては人中へ出られぬ
I am ashamed to appear in society in my shabby dress.

おはぎ〔お萩〕
〈名〉A kind of rice-dumpling

content:
おはぐろ〔鉄漿〕
〈名〉Tooth-dye

content.content: おはぐろを付ける
to dye the teeth black

content:
おばけ〔お化け〕
〈名〉
1. A ghost; a hobgoblin; a bogey; a bugbear; a monster

content.content: お化けが出る
A ghost walks the earth―A ghost haunts a house.
あの家はお化けが出る
The house is haunted.
お化け引込め俺が出るというような顔をしている
He outmonsters a monster.

content: 2. (=お化け面)a fright

content.content: その女はまるでお化けだ
She is a perfect fright.

おばけつら〔お化け面〕
〈名〉A fright

content:
おはこ〔お箱〕
〈名〉One's hobby; one's fad; one's favourite topic; one's pet theory; one's pet folly; one's stock joke

content.content: お箱を出す
to mount one's hobby
彼はお箱を出し過ぎる
He rides his hobby to death.
いつの間にかお箱を引張り出す
He will drag in his hobby―tug in his favourite topic―lug in his stock joke―before we know where we are.
あの人のお箱は何だ
What is his hobby?
先生のお箱は即吟だ
Improvisation is his forte.
先生のお箱は浪花節だ
Naniwabushi is his pet folly.
酸素療法が先生のお箱だ
Oxypathy is his pet folly.

おばさん〔小母さん〕
〈名〉
1. (=実の伯母、叔母さん)an aunt:(呼びかけに用いれば)auntie
2. (=よその小母さん)a lady:(呼びかけに用いれば)madam

content:
おはち〔お鉢〕
〈名〉
1. (=飯櫃)a rice-tub
2. (=順番)one's turn

content.content: お鉢がまわって来た
My turn has come.
そろそろこちらへもお鉢がまわって来そうだ
It will soon be my turn.

content:
おはつに〔お初に〕
〈副〉For the first time

content.content: お初にお目にかかります
I am glad to make your acquaintance.

おばな〔尾花〕
〈名〉A kind of pampas-grass

おばな〔雄花〕
〈名〉A male flower; a neuter flower

おはなしちゅう〔お話し中〕
〈熟語〉The line is busy; Line's busy

おはね〔お跳ね〕
〈名〉A romp; a tomboy

content:
おばねからした〔尾羽根枯らした〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: おはうちからした〔尾羽打枯らした〕

content:
おはよう〔お早う〕
〈挨拶〉Good morning!

content.content: お早うと言う
to wish one good morning

content:
おはらい〔お払い〕
〈名〉Something to sell

content.content: お払いはありませんか
Have you anything to dispose of?

content:
おはらい〔お祓い〕
〈名〉The Shinto purification; exorcism

content.content: お祓いをする
to exorcise a person or place of evil spirits

content:
おはらいばこ〔お払い箱〕
〈名〉Dismissal

content.content: お払い箱になる
to be dismissed―get the sack―lose one's place
そんなことをするとお払い箱になるぞ
Such conduct will cost you your place―It is as much as your place is worth to do such a thing.

おはり〔お針〕
〈名〉
1. (=針仕事)needlework
2. (=雇われて針仕事をする女)a needlewoman; a seamstress; a sempstress

content:
おび〔帯〕
〈名〉A belt; a girdle:(飾帯)a sash

content.content: 帯を締める
to fasten one's clothes with a girdle―gird oneself
あの女は立派な帯を締めている
She wears a fine girdle.
帯を結ぶ
to tie one's girdle―knot one's girdle
帯の結び目
the knot of the girdle
帯を解く
to undo one's girdle―ungird oneself
深くなるほど帯を解く
Deeper relations will make me ungird myself.
帯が解ける
One's girdle gets loose.
帯に短かし襷に長し(ちょうど好いのが無い)
I can find no suitable one―None of them suit me.

おびあげ〔帯揚げ〕
〈名〉A cord for securing woman's girdle

おびえる〔怯える〕
〈自動〉
1. (=怖がる)to be frightened (at anything); to be scared (at anything)
2. (=怖い夢を見る)to have a nightmare

おひきずり〔お引きずり〕
〈名〉A draggle-tailed woman; a slut; a slattern; a drab; a dowdy; a trollop

content:
おびく
〈他動〉To decoy; to lure; to allure; to entice; to inveigle

content.content: おびき出す
to decoy one out―lure one out
家からおびき出す
to lure one out of the house
おびき入れる、おびき込む
to decoy one in―lure one in
敵を難地におびき入れる
to lure the enemy into a difficult position

content:
おひざもと〔お膝元〕
〈名〉The Imperial capital

content.content: 将軍のお膝元
the Shogun's own city

おびじ〔帯地〕
〈名〉Material for woman's girdle

content:
おびただしい〔夥しい〕
〈形〉Vast (crowd); immense (resources); enormous (sum); prodigious (number); tremendous (income); stupendous (power, etc.)

content.content: 夥しい金額になる
It comes to a vast sum―an enormous sum―a stupendous sum.
米国には夥しい富源が有る
America has immense resources.
夥しい人出であった
There was a vast crowd―a prodigious crowd―a tremendous crowd.
出血夥しく衰弱甚し
He has bled copiously―bled profusely―and is greatly debilitated.
亭主の野郎不見識なこと夥しい
The husband is undignified to a degree.
そうなると生き甲斐の無いこと夥しい
Then life is not in the least worth living.
つまらないこと夥しい
It is disappointing in the extreme.
日本の幅の利かないこと実に夥しい
Japan is in a humiliating situation.

content:
おひとがら〔お人柄〕
〈形〉
1. (=紳士淑女風)gentlemanly; ladylike

content.content: あの人はお人柄だ
She is quite the lady.

content: 2. (=上品)refined; elegant

content.content: この着物はお人柄だ
The kimono is elegant.

おびどめ〔帯留め〕
〈名〉A string and a clasp to secure woman's girdle

content:
おひとよし〔お人好し〕
〈形〉Good-natured; accommodating:(悪意に用いれば)soft-headed

content.content: あの人はお人好しだ
He has a soft spot in his head.

content:
おびふう〔帯封〕
〈名〉A half-wrapper

content.content: 新聞に帯封をする
to half-wrap a folded newspaper (for posting)

content:
おびやかす〔脅す〕
〈他動〉To threaten (to kill―one with death); to menace (one with death); to intimidate, frighten, terrify, scare, concuss, cow, bully, huff (one into doing anything)

content.content: 彼は僕を殺すぞと言って脅した
He threatened to kill me―threatened me with death―menaced me with death.
強盗が抜刀を突きつけて家人を脅した
The robber threatened the inmates with a drawn sword.
彼らは彼を脅して納得さした
They frightened him into compliance―intimidated him into compliance.
彼は人を脅して金を取る
He extorts money by threats―blackmails people.
かかる条約は東洋の平和を脅すものである
Such a treaty is a menace to the peace of the East.

content:
おひゃくど〔お百度〕
〈名〉(=お百度詣り)Worshipping a hundred times at a shrine, each time making the round of the grounds

content.content: お百度を踏む
to make repeated calls on a person in vain
今日はお百度を踏んだ
I have called on him several times in vain today.

おひゃらかす
〈他動〉To chaff, banter, rally, make fun of (one)

content:
おひら〔お平〕
〈名〉A lacquered wooden dish

content.content: お平の長芋
an insipidly handsome man―a wax doll

content:
おひらき〔お開き〕
〈名〉Closing a banquet

content.content: お開きにする
to close a banquet―(西洋なら)―go to the drawing-room
お開きにしましょう
Let us adjourn!

おひる〔お昼〕
〈名〉Midday meal; lunch; dinner

content:
おびる〔帯びる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=佩用する)to wear (a sword); to gird on (a sword)

content.content: 刀を(取ってこれを)帯びる
to gird on a sword
彼は剣を帯びている
He wears a sword.
彼は身に寸鉄を帯びずにけんかに飛び込んだ
He dashed unarmed into the fray.

content: 2. (=任などを負う)to be charged with (a duty); to be invested with (authority); to be entrusted with (some functions)

content.content: 彼は重任を帯びている
He is charged with an important duty.
全権を帯びている
He is invested with full powers.
条約改正の全権を帯びて渡欧した
He went to Europe with full powers to revise the treaty.
彼は重大な用を帯びて上京した
He has come to town on business of great importance.
公用を帯びて出張した
He proceeded to the scene on official business.
官命を帯びて英国に赴いた
He went to England on an official mission.
小生特別任務を帯びて今夜ある地に向かって出発致し候
I depart tonight for a certain destination on special service.

content: 3. (=含む)to wear, have (a look); to assume, put on (an attitude); to be invested with (an air); to be tinged with (red or blue); to partake of (a character)

content.content: 顔に喜色を帯びている
One's face wears a joyful look.
喜色を帯びた顔
a joyful face
憂色を帯びる
One's face wears a sad look.
憂色を帯びた顔
a sad face
怒色を帯びる
One's face wears an angry look―One frowns.
怒色を帯びた顔
an angry face―a frowning look
道具は古色を帯びている
The furniture has an antique look.
民衆は殺気を帯びて来た
The populace assumed a defiant attitude.
その建物は奥床しさを帯びている
The building is invested with a mysterious air.
古銭は赤味を帯びている
The medal is tinged with red―It has a reddish tint.
赤味を帯びた色
a reddish tint
鏡は青味を帯びている
The mirror is tinged with blue―It has a bluish tint.
青味を帯びた色
a bluish tint
昔は教師の職は多少神聖な性質を帯びていた
In former times the office of teacher partook of a sacred character.
彼は酒気を帯びている
He is intoxicated―in liquor―under the influence of wine.
雨を帯びた海棠(に相当するは)
roses bedewed with rain

content:
おひれ〔尾鰭〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おびれ〔尾鰭〕

content:
おびれ〔尾鰭〕
〈名〉Fin and tail

content.content: 尾鰭を付けて話す
to stretch the truth―exaggerate the truth―make a mountain of a mole-hill―embroider a story―(好く言うのなら)―paint an affair in bright colours―(悪く言うのなら)―paint an affair in dark colours

content:
おひろい〔お拾い〕
〈副〉On foot

content.content: お拾いでいらっしゃいますか
Are you going on foot?
お拾いですね
So you are walking it―trudging it.

content:
おぶ〔帯ぶ〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: おびる〔帯びる〕

content:
おぶう〔負ぶう〕
〈他動〉To carry, take, have (a child) on one's back; to horse (a child)

content.content: 子どもを下から負ぶう
to take a child on one's back
娘子が子どもを負ぶっている
The girl has a child on her back.
お母さんが子どもを負ぶって歩く
The mother carries her child on her back.
子どもを負ぶってやって来た
She came along with a child on her back.
子どもを帯で負ぶっている
She has a child strapped to her back.
負ぶった子より抱いた子
“Close sits my shirt, but closer sits my skin.”
負ぶおうと言えば抱かると言う
“Give him an inch, and he will take an ell.”
負ぶった子に教えられて浅瀬を渉る
“A fool may teach a wise man.”
負ぶった子を三年尋ねる
to be absent-minded

content:
おぶさる〔負ぶさる〕
〈自動〉To be carried on the back; to be carried pick-a-back

content.content: 僕はその頃は子どもで姉に負ぶさっていた
I was on my sister's back then.

content:
おぶつ〔汚物〕
〈名〉Filth; dirt; dust; muck; garbage:(下水の汚物)sewage

content.content: 汚物運搬車
a dust-cart

オブラート
〈名〉An oblate; a wafer

content:
おべっか
〈名〉Flattery; sycophancy; toadyism

content.content: あの男はおべっか使う
He is a flatterer―a sycophant―a toad-eater―a toady.

おぼうず〔お坊主〕
〈名〉A palace-attendant (of the feudal times)

content:
おぼえ〔覚え〕
〈名〉
1. (=記憶)memory

content.content: この子は覚えが好い
The boy has a good memory―He is quick at learning.
僕は覚えが悪い
I have a poor memory―I am slow at learning.
彼は覚えも早けりゃ忘れるのも早い
He learns quickly, and forgets as quickly.
あの人は言葉の拾い覚えが早い
He is quick at picking up languages.

content: 2. (=思い出)remembrance; recollection; impression

content.content: あの人には一度逢った覚えがある
I remember meeting him once.
この詩はどこかで読んだ覚えがある
I remember reading this poem somewhere.
僕はそんなことをした覚えが無い
I have no remembrance of having done such a thing―I am innocent of such an action.
そんなことを言った覚えが無い
I have no recollection of having said so.
なんでも二時過ぎであったようにぼんやりした覚えがある
I have a vague impression that it was past two.
その女は赤毛であったというはっきりした覚えがある
I have a strong impression that the woman had red hair.
彼は金を借りた覚えが無いと言う
He denies all remembrance of having borrowed money.
そんなことを言った覚えが無いと言う
He denies all recollection of having said so.
皆覚えのある顔だ
They are all familiar faces.
皆覚えの無い顔だ
They are all strange faces.

content: 3. (=経験)experience

content.content: それは僕自身も覚えのあることだ
I have had such an experience myself.
それは誰でも若い時は覚えのあることだ
Everybody has experienced it in his youth.
僕もそれと同じような覚えがある
I have had a similar experience myself.

content: 4. (=感覚)sensation; sensibility

content.content: 足が痺れて覚えが無い
My legs have lost their sensibility―My legs are numb.
手足が寒くて覚えが無い
My hands and feet are benumbed with cold.

content: 5. (=自覚)consciousness; self-consciousness

content.content: 僕は悪いことをした覚えが無い
I am not conscious of having done wrong.
腕に覚えがある
to be conscious of one's powers―(武芸なら)―know the use of arms
腕に覚えがあれば度胸もすわる
A man who is conscious of his powers, will have confidence.
町人ながらも腕に覚えのある彼はそんなおどし文句にはびくともしなかった
Commoner as he was, he knew the art of defence, and did not turn a hair at such threats.
胸に覚えがある
to be conscious of one's guilt
彼は胸に覚えがあるから赤面するのだ
He blushes, because he is conscious of his guilt.
身に覚えがある
to be guilty of the crime
彼は身に覚えがあるものだから青くなった
He turned pale, for he felt himself guilty.
身に覚えがあれば顔にも顕れる
Guilt will show itself in the face.
彼は覚えがあると言った
He has confessed himself guilty.
いくら白状しろと言われても身に覚えの無いことを白状することはできません
I can not confess what I am not guilty of.
身に覚えが無い
to be innocent of the crime
それは全く身に覚えの無いことです
I am quite innocent of the crime.
彼は身に覚えが無いと言い張っている
He asserts his innocence―protests his innocence―denies his guilt―denies the charge.

content: 6. (=恩寵)favour

content.content: 君の御覚えめでたし
He is in favour with his lord―in his master's good graces―in good odour with his lord.
彼は主人の覚えはたいそうめでたい
He is in high favour with his master―He stands high in his master's estimation.
畏きあたりに御覚えめでたし
He is in good odour with those in high places.
僕は校長にはあまり御覚えめでたくない方だ
I am in bad odour with my principal―in disgrace with my principal.→『よのおぼえ〔世の覚え〕』

content: 7. (=覚え書き)a memorandum (複数―memoranda); a note

content.content: その名前を覚えに書き付けておいた
I have made a note of their names.

content:
おぼえがき〔覚え書き〕
〈名〉A memorandum (複数―memoranda); a memo; a note

content.content: そのことは覚え書きをしておいた
I have made a note of the fact.

content:
おぼえず〔覚えず〕
〈副〉Unconsciously; involuntarily; unintentionally; unwittingly; unawares; without knowing it; in spite of oneself

content.content: つい覚えず吹き出した
I burst out laughing involuntarily―in spite of myself.
つい覚えず間違ったことをしてしまった
I have done wrong unwittingly―without knowing it.
そうすればいつの間にか覚えず学ぶ道理だ
Then it follows that you will learn unconsciously―unawares.
君は覚えず人の名誉を害するようなことを言ったのだ
You have injured a man's reputation unintentionally.

content:
おぼえちがい〔覚え違い〕
〈名〉A mistake

content.content: 僕の覚え違いでした
It was my mistake―I was mistaken.
僕の覚え違いかも知れぬが彼は退校を命ぜられたことがあるようだ
If I remember rightly, he was once expelled from school.

おぼえちょう〔覚え帳〕
〈名〉A memorandum-book

content:
おぼえる〔覚える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=学ぶ)to learn

content.content: いついろはを覚えたか
When did you learn your letters?
彼は愚鈍で何も覚えない
He is too stupid to learn anything.
何でも覚えておいて損は無い
It is always good to know anything.
英語は覚えやすい
English is easy to learn.
漢字は覚えにくい
Chinese characters are hard to learn.
この学課はむずかしくて覚えられぬ
This lesson is too hard for me to learn.
空で覚える
to learn anything by heart―get anything by heart―commit anything to memory―(米国にては)―memorize
僕はこの詩を空で覚えている
I know this poem by heart―have this poem by heart.
味を覚える
to get a taste for anything
読書の味を覚えた
I have acquired a taste for reading.
一度舟遊びの味を覚えると一生忘れられぬ
Once a sailor, always a sailor.
虎などが血の味を覚える
A tiger tastes blood for the first time.
コツを覚える
to get the knack of doing anything
会話は本では覚えられぬ
No book can teach conversation.
子どもが悪いことを覚える
A child gets into mischief.
あんな人達と遊ぶと悪いことを覚える
Such men will lead you into mischief.
忙しいと悪いことを覚えない
Business will keep you out of mischief.
彼はそろそろ道楽を覚え始めた
He is getting into evil courses.

content: 2. (=知る)to know

content.content: 春眠暁を覚えず
In spring, the sleeper knows not the hour of dawn.

content: 3. (=忘れずに覚えている)to remember

content.content: お顔を覚えています
I remember your face.
お名前は覚えていません
I do not remember your name―Your name is beyond my recollection.
あの人には一度逢ったのを覚えている
I remember meeting him once.
この詩はどこかで読んだのを覚えている
I remember reading this poem somewhere.
僕はそんなことをしたことを覚えぬ
I have no remembrance of having done such a thing.
そんなことを言ったのを覚えぬ
I have no recollection of having said so.
君はよく何でも覚えている
You remember everything―You have a good memory.
僕は何も覚えていない
I remember nothing―I have a poor memory.
僕の覚えているところでは彼は洋行はしないようだ
He has never been abroad that I remember.
(「そんなことがあったか」と問われて)覚えないね
Not that I remember.
ぼんやり覚えている、はっきり覚えている
to have a dim remembrance of―have a clear recollection of―anything
なんでもその時が十二時過ぎであったようにぼんやり覚えている
I have a vague impression that it was past twelve.
その女は赤毛であったことははっきり覚えている
I have a strong impression that the woman had red hair.
なんでもそのように覚えている
That's my impression.
僕が覚えてからの大地震だ
It is the greatest earthquake within my memory.
いま生きている人の覚えてからの大雪だ
It is the heaviest snowfall within living memory.
後の崇りを覚えていろ
You shall smart for this.

content: 4. (=忘れぬように覚えておく)to keep (a fact) in mind; to bear (a fact) in mind

content.content: この事は忘れないように覚えておくがよい
You should keep this fact in mind―bear this fact in mind―have this fact impressed on your mind.

content: 5. (=感ずる)to feel

content.content: 胸部に疼痛を覚える
I feel a pain in my chest.
禁じ難き情を覚える
I feel an irresistible impulse.
こう旧友に死なれると淋しさを覚えざるを得ぬ
When I see my friends dropping around one, I can not but feel lonely.
今日などは少し寒さを覚える
It is rather cold today.
日中は暑さを覚えるようになりました
The days are getting hotter.

content: 6. (=経験する)to experience; to feel; to know

content.content: 悲しいということを身にしみて覚えたのは母に死に別れた時だ
I experienced true sorrow when I lost my mother.
彼は身にしみて恥を覚えたろう
He must feel his disgrace keenly.
借金の味は身にしみて覚えた
I know to my cost what it is to be in debt.

content: 7. (=期待する)to expect

content.content: こは我が君の仰せとも覚えませぬ
This from my lord! (=I did not expect this from my lord.)

content:
おぼこ
〈名〉A simple child; an innocent child; an unsophisticated girl; a bread-and-butter miss

content.content: まだほんのおぼこです
She is quite unsophisticated.
まだおぼこだからそんなことはわかりません
She is too much of a child to understand such things.

content:
おぼしき〔覚しき〕
〈形〉(副詞に訳して)apparently; evidently:(動詞に訳せば) to seem (to be)

content.content: 主人と覚しき人が出て来て挨拶した
A man apparently the master of the house, appeared and bade us welcome.
陸戦隊の監督将校と覚しき士官が小勢を率いて談判に来た
An officer, who seemed to be in charge of the landing-party, came to parley with us at the head of a handful of men.
真夜中と覚しき頃船が着いた
We arrived about midnight.

content:
おぼしめし〔思召〕
〈名〉
1. (=適宜)discretion; what one thinks fit

content.content: (「いくらか」と問われて)いくらなりとおぼしめしでよろしゅうございます
Give me whatever you think fit.
どうなさろうとおぼしめしに任せます
You may do as you think fit―You may act at your discretion.

content: 2. (=御意)(your or his) will, pleasure, wish, intention, mind, inclination, liking, love, kindness

content.content: おぼしめしはいかが
What is your pleasure?
去るもとどまるもおぼしめしに任せます
You may go or stay as you please―at your pleasure.
おぼしめし通りに規則を変更しました
I have altered the rules as you wish―according to your wishes.
ご子息をどうなさるおぼしめしですか
What are your intentions regarding your son?―What are you going to do with your boy?
おぼしめしのほどはありがとう存じますがお断り致します
I thank you for your kind intentions, but I beg to decline.
この品を買おうというおぼしめしが有りますか
Have you a mind to buy the article?―Do you feel inclined to buy it?―Do you feel like buying it?
おぼしめしにかなう家があるかも知れません
I may be able to find a house you like―a house to your taste―a house after your fancy.
彼はあの女におぼしめしがあるらしい
He seems to have fallen in love with―taken a fancy to―that girl.
せっかくのおぼしめしですから戴きます
Since you are so pressing, I shall accept it.
せっかくのおぼしめしですが残念ながら
I am sorry I can not avail myself of your kind offer.
おぼしめしのほどが恐ろしい
He has some end in view―an axe to grind.

content:
おぼしめす〔思召す〕
〈自他動〉(Honorific for) to think

content.content: あの人をどうおぼしめす
What do you think of him?―How do you like him?
彼を不憫とおぼしめしお助け下さい
Take pity on him, and help him!―Help him for pity's sake!
人様が孤児を哀れとおぼしめしてお世話下さいました
People took compassion on the poor orphan, and stretched a helping hand to her.
私は十人兄弟だとおぼしめせ
You must know that I am one of a family of ten.
若い時は無論苦労したものとおぼしめせ
You may be sure that I had to struggle with adversity in my youth.

content:
おぼちゃん〔お坊っちゃん〕
〈名〉An unsophisticated boy; an ingenuous youth

content.content: 彼はまだほんのお坊っちゃんだ
He is quite unsophisticated.
お坊っちゃん育ちだ
He is an ingenuous youth.

content:
おぼつかない〔覚束ない〕
〈形〉Doubtful; uncertain; almost hopeless

content.content: 成功はおぼつかないがともかくもやってみよう
Success is doubtful, but, at any rate, I will try.
全快はおぼつかない
His recovery is doubtful―There is little hope of his recovery―His recovery is despaired of.
生命おぼつかなし
His life is despaired of.
彼の成功はおぼつかないと思う
I doubt if he will succeed―I am doubtful of his success.
彼は中学校の先生もおぼつかない
It is doubtful if he can teach a middle school.
勝利おぼつかなし
Victory is doubtful―The day is doubtful.
おぼつかない天気だ
It is doubtful weather―threatening weather.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの人の約束はおぼつかない
He is not to be relied upon.
その日その日もおぼつかない生活だ
It is a precarious existence.
その日その日もおぼつかない暮らしをする
to make a precarious living
今日明日にもおぼつかない命だ
His life hangs by a thread.

おぼらす〔溺らす〕
〈他動〉To drown (a man)

おぼれじに〔溺れ死に〕
〈名〉Drowning:(=する) to drown; to be drowned

content:
おぼれる〔溺れる〕
〈自動〉(=溺死する)to drown; to be drowned

content.content: 好く泳ぐ者は水に溺る
“Good swimmers are oftenest drowned.”
溺るる者は藁をもつかむ
“A drowning man will catch at a straw.”
彼は僕の溺れんとするところを助けてくれた
He has rescued me from drowning.

content: 〈他動〉(=溺惑する)to addict oneself to (dissipation); to abandon oneself to (pleasure); to give oneself up to (enjoyment); to indulge in (wine); to dote on (children); to be infatuated with (a woman); to be absorbed in (the ideal)

content.content: 彼は酒色に溺れる
He indulges in wine and woman―He is addicted to dissipation and debauchery.
女に溺れている
He is infatuated with a woman―gone on a girl.
子の愛に溺れる
to dote on children
老人は若い細君を持ってその愛に溺れている
The old man dotes on his young wife.
現実に溺れて理想を忘る
to be absorbed in the actual, and lose sight of the ideal
現実に溺れず理想に走らず
Neither be absorbed in the actual nor be carried away by the ideal.

content:
おぼろ〔朧〕
〈形〉Dim; indistinct:(=に) dimly; indistinctly

content.content: 遠方に島がおぼろに見える
An island is dimly seen―indistinctly: visible―in the distance.

content:
おぼろげ〔朧気〕
〈形〉
1. (=朦朧たる)dim; indistinct:(=に) dimly; indistinctly

content.content: 陸がおぼろげに見える
Land is dimly seen―indistinctly visible.

content: 2. (=漠然たる)vague; obscure; hazy; misty; foggy; dreamy:(=に) vaguely; obscurely; hazily; mistily; foggily; dreamily

content.content: 祖父の顔はおぼろげに覚えている
I have a vague remembrance of my grandfather's face.

おぼろづき〔朧月〕
〈名〉A hazy moon

おぼろづきよ〔朧月夜〕
〈名〉A hazy moonlit night

content:
おまいり〔お詣り〕
〈名〉Visiting (a temple); a pilgrimage (to a shrine):(=する) to visit (a temple); to worship (at a shrine); to make a pilgrimage (to a shrine)

content.content: お詣りに行く
to go to worship at a temple―go on a pilgrimage to a shrine

content:
おまえ〔お前〕
〈代名詞〉(Familiar) you; thou

content.content: お前百までわしゃ九十九まで
“Till death do us part.”
お前とならばどこまでも
I would go to the end of the world in your company.
(女房の言う)お前さん
my dear

content:
おまけ〔お負け〕
〈名〉Something thrown into the bargain:(=に) into the bargain; to boot; too; as well; besides; moreover; what is more; what makes matters worse; to make matters worse

content.content: 馬をお買いになれば鞍はおまけにしておきます
If you will buy the horse, I will put in the saddle―throw in the saddle―throw the saddle into the bargain.
彼は貧乏でおまけに病人と来ている
He is poor, and an invalid, into the bargain―and an invalid to boot.
金を借り倒しておまけに悪口まで言う奴だ
He bilked me, and abused me, too―and abused me as well.
彼は英語で演説をしたおまけに下手な英語で
He spoke in English, and in bad English, too―and in bad English at that.
そしておまけに病人までできた
And, what made matters worse,―to make matters worse,―one of them fell ill.
おまけに腹が減ってきた
To add to our miseries, hunger began to make itself felt.
話におまけを付ける
to embellish one's story―embroider one's story―exaggerate the truth―stretch the truth

おまつ〔雄松〕
〈名〉The black pine; the seaside pine

content:
おまつり〔お祭〕
〈名〉A festival; a festive occasion; a f?te; a celebration; a gala day

content.content: お祭りはいつか
When does the festival take place?―When does the festival come off?―When is the festival to be held?
子どもらはお祭りを楽しみにして待っている
The children look forward to the festival―look forward to the event.
しきりにお祭りへ行きたがっている
They are eager to go to the festival.
鎮守のお祭り
a village festival―a rural f?te
捷報に接して全国お祭りのようだった
The news of victory threw a festive air over the whole country.
後のお祭り
“a day after the fair”
いまさらそんなことを言っても後のお祭りだ
It is now too late―a day after the fair―to discuss the matter.

content:
おまつりさわぎ〔お祭騒ぎ〕
〈名〉Festive proceedings; festivities:(より)empty show; empty display; pageantry

content.content: お祭り騒ぎで一時空景気がついた
The festivities have made things hum for a while.
江戸っ子はお祭り騒ぎが好きだ
The Edokko loves pageantry.
せっかくの会議がお祭り騒ぎに終りはせぬかという懸念がある
There are apprehensions lest the conference may end in empty display.

content:
おまもり〔お守り〕
〈名〉A talisman; an amulet; a charm

content.content: このお守りを肌に着けていると魔除けになる
If you wear this amulet next your skin, it will protect you from harm.
あの男といっしょに歩くと女除けのお守りになる
He will serve as a charm against women.

おまる〔虎子〕
〈名〉A chamber-pot; a night-commode; a close-stool

おまわりさん〔お巡りさん〕
〈名〉A policeman; a copper; a bobby; a peeler

content:
おまんま
〈名〉(A child's name for) bioled rice; a meal

content.content: おまんまを食べる
to eat one's meal

content:
おみき〔お神酒〕
〈名〉Wine offered to a god; a drink-offering; a libation

content.content: お神酒を供える
to offer wine to a god

content:
おみしりおき〔お見知り置き〕
〈名〉Your notice

content.content: 以後お見知り置きを願います
I beg to intrude myself on your notice―I wish to make your acquaintance―I wish you would know me.
この者をお見知り置き下さい
I beg to commend him to your notice.

content:
おみなえし〔女郎花〕
〈名〉One of the three classic autumn flowers

content.content: 露をだに厭う
E'en dew of morning she doth dread,
大和の女郎花
Yamato's tender maid;
降るアメリカに
That foreign rain her sleave hath wet,
袖は濡らさじ
Shall of her ne'er be said.

content:
おみやげ〔お土産〕
〈名〉A present (made on one's arrival or return); a souvenir

content.content: お土産を買って来て頂戴
Bring me a present when you return.
その話は国への好いお土産だ
The story will be a good present for the people at home.
お土産案を提出する
to present to the Diet a bill as a souvenir for one's constituency
お土産付の花嫁
a bride with child

content:
おめい〔汚名〕
〈名〉A bad name; an ill fame; a stain on one's name; a stigma; an imputation; ignominy; infamy; disgrace; dishonour

content.content: 汚名を被{き}せる
to fasten a stigma upon a man
詐欺師の汚名を被せる
to stigmatize one as a swindler―brand one as a swindler
彼は泥棒の汚名を被せられた
He was stigmatized as a thief―branded as a thief.
汚名を雪{そそ}ぐ
to wipe out a stain on one's name―vindicate one's character―clear one's reputation―whitewash oneself
一度汚名を被せると容易に雪げないものだ
A bad name will stick to one.

content:
おめおめ〔阿容阿容〕
〈副〉Shamelessly; ignominiously; tamely

content.content: あんな者におめおめと負けておれるか
How can I allow myself to suffer an ignominious defeat from such a fellow?
おめおめと敵に後を見せるようなことはしません
I will not beat an ignominious retreat.
こんな失敗をしておいていまさらおめおめと帰られません
After such a failure, I have not the face to go home.
よくおめおめと帰られたものだ
I wonder how he can have the face to come home.
あんなことをしておめおめと生きていられまい
After such conduct on his part, he must be ashamed to live.
君はよくおめおめと生きておれるな
Are you not ashamed to live?
おめおめと捕虜になる
to be ignominiously taken prisoner―suffer oneself to be taken prisoner
おめおめと敵国の飯を食う
to suffer an ignominious confinement as prisoner
彼はおめおめと虐待に甘んずるような人でない
He is not the man to tamely submit to ill-treatment.

content:
おめかし
〈名〉Dressing smartly:(=する) to dress smartly; to smarten oneself; to trick oneself out; to spruce oneself up

content.content: あの女はおめかししている
She is smartly dressed―finely tricked out.
たいそうおめかしじゃないか
What a swell you are!―You are in your war-paint.

おめく〔喚く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=叫ぶ)to shout
2. (=大声で泣く)to howl

content:
おめこぼし〔お目零し〕
〈名〉Connivance:(=する) to connive at, wink at, pass over, overlook (one's offence, etc.)

content.content: 今度だけはお目こぼしを願います
I beg you will overlook my offence for this time.

content:
おめし〔お召し〕
〈名〉
1. (=召喚)summons

content.content: お召しによって出頭する
to present oneself at the summons of one's lord
おめしもの〔お召物〕
おめしちりめん〔お召縮緬〕

content:
』
〈形〉(=陛下御用)Imperial; state

content.content: お召し馬車
the state carriage―the Imperial carriage
お召し列車
the Imperial train
お召艦
the Imperial flagship

おめしちりめん〔お召縮緬〕
〈名〉Striped crape

content:
おめしもの〔お召物〕
〈名〉
1. (=衣服)one's dress; one's clothes

content.content: お召物をお着替え遊ばせ
Will you change your clothes?

content: 2. (=お乗物)one's carriage; one's vehicle

おめずおくせず〔怯めず臆せず〕
〈副〉Boldly; fearlessly; without flinching; without hesitation

content.content: 彼はおめず臆せず主人に直言した
He boldly―fearlessly―spoke the truth to his master.
おめず臆せず訴人の前に立った
He stood without flinching before his accusers.
おめず臆せず列を進み出た
He came forward without hesitation―He did not hesitate to come forward.

content:
おめだま〔お目玉〕
〈名〉A scolding; a reprimand

content.content: お目玉を頂戴する
to get a scolding
お目玉を喰うぞ
You will catch it.

content:
おめでた〔お目出度〕
〈名〉A happy event

content.content: 奥さんはおめでただそうで
A happy event is expected of Mrs. xxx, I hear.
お宅ではおめでたがあったそうですね
There has been a happy event in your family, I understand.

content:
おめでたい〔お目出度い〕
〈形〉
1. →『

content.content: めでたい〔目出度い〕

content:
』
2. (=ばか)foolish; soft-headed; innocent

content.content: あの人は少しおめでたい
He has a soft spot in his head.
人にからかわれるのを賞められると思っているとはよっぽどおめでたいね
What a blooming fool to take a banter for a compliment!
彼のおめでたさ加減はむしろ気の毒なくらいだ
His innocence deserves pity.
お目出度屋
a blooming fool―a holy imbecile

content:
おめでたごと〔お目出度事〕
〈名〉An occasion for rejoicing

content.content: おめでたごとがあってお客をする
We are going to give a party on a joyful occasion.

content:
おめでとう〔お目出度う〕
〈祝辞〉I wish you joy (of your success); (Heaven) give you joy (of the occasion); I congratulate you (on the event)

content.content: 及第したそうでおめでとう
I wish you joy of your successful entrance!
今日はおめでとう
I wish you joy of the occasion!―Give you joy of the occasion!―(誕生日のお祝いなら)―I wish you many happy returns of the day!
新年はおめでとう
I wish you a happy New Year!―Happy New Year to you!

content:
おめにかかる〔御目に掛かる〕
〈他動〉To have the pleasure of seeing (one)

content.content: あの方には昨日お目にかかったばかりです
It was but yesterday that I had the pleasure of seeing him.
久しくお目に掛かりませんでした
I have not seen you for an age.
あの方にはよくお目にかかります
I see much of him.
ちっともお目にかかりません
I see nothing of him.
初めてお目にかかります
I am glad to make your acquaintance.
好い処でお目にかかりました
I am glad to have met you.

content:
おめにかける〔お目に掛ける〕
〈他動〉To submit (anything) to one's inspection; to show (one anything)

content.content: 家をご覧になるならお目にかけましょう
If you wish to see the house, I will show you over it.
お目にかけるほどのものではありません
It is hardly worthy of your inspection.
お目にかけるような品はありません
We have nothing worthy of your inspection―We have nothing to show you.

content:
おめにとまる〔お目に止まる〕
〈自動〉To catch one's eye; to attract one's attention; to take one's fancy; to catch one's fancy

content.content: お目に止まった品は一つも無い
None of the articles have caught my eye―attracted my attention.
あの娘がお目に止まりましたか
Has she caught your fancy?―Have you taken a fancy to the girl?

content:
おめみえ〔お目見え〕
〈名〉
1. (=謁見)audience

content.content: 殿にお目見えを許された
I had an audience of my lord.

content: 2. (=奉公人のお目見え)trial service

content.content: 女中はお目見え中です
The waitress is on trial.

おめもじ〔お目もじ〕
〈名〉An interview:(=する) to have an interview with (one); to see (one)

content:
おもい〔思い〕
〈名〉
1. (=思想、感情、心)thought; feeling; emotion; heart; mind

content.content: 我が子を棄てる親の思いはどんなだろう
What must be the feelings of the parent who deserts his or her child?
彼は思いに沈んでいた
He was sunk in thoughts.
思い内にあれば色外に現る
One will betray one's feelings.
思いのたけを述べる
to open one's heart―lay bare one's mind
思いをこらす
to rack one's brains―cudgel one's brains―tax one's ingenuity
蘇生の思いをした
I felt myself another man―felt myself a new man.
夏の暑い日に夕立が来ると蘇生の思いをする
A shower revives us on a hot summer day.

content: 2. (=願望、希望、意志)desire; wish; hope; expectation; will; pleasure

content.content: 思いがかなう
One's wishes are fulfilled―One realizes one's wishes―One has one's wish.
思いがかなってこんな嬉しいことはない
How glad I am to have my wishes fulfilled!
思いが届く
to attain one's desire―gain the object of one's wishes
思いを遂げる
to have one's will of a woman
彼はとうとう思いを遂げた
At last he had his will of her.
去るもとどまるも君の思いのままだ
You may go or stay at your pleasure―as you please.
生徒は教師の思いのままになる
The student is wax in the hands of the teacher.
思いが残る
to have a lingering desire for the past―regret the past
思いの岸に着く
to reach the goal of one's wishes
思いのほか
beyond expectation―beyond one's expectations
結果は思いのほか好い
The result is beyond my expectations.
思いのほか悪い
It does not come up to my expectations.
思い半ばに過ぎん
It may be imagined.
この事実より見ても氏の節倹は思い半ばに過ぎん
From this fact alone, his frugality may be imagined.

content: 3. (=愛情、恋愛)love; affection

content.content: 思いを寄せる、思いを掛ける
(男が女になら)to fall in love with a woman―lose one's heart to a girl―take a fancy to a girl―be enamoured of a woman―(女が男になら)―fix her affections on a man.
思いを焦がす
to pine for―languish for―sigh for―any one
思いを遂げる
(男なら)to have one's will of a woman―(女なら)―succeed in love.
思いを遂げないのは女の恥
It is a point of honour with a woman to succeed in love.
女の思いが男の心に届かない
Her love finds no response in his heart.
あの子はお母さん思いだ
She has an affection for her mother.
思い内に有れば色外に現る
“Love can not be hidden.”
犬の思いで孕んだ
The dog's love got her with child.

content: 4. (=経験)experience

content.content: 面白い思いをした
It was a delightful experience―I had a good time.
辛い思いをした
I had a trying experience―I had a bitter experience―I had a hard time of it.
あんな思いをすると寿命を縮める
Such an experience would shorten one's natural term of existence.
こんなお思いをするなら死んだ方がましだ
I would rather die than suffer such misery.
断腸の思いをする、血を吐く思いをする
to break one's heart―have one's heart broken
身も世もあられぬ思いをした
I was in agony.
生き身を切られるような思いをした
I was cut to the quick―It was more than flesh and blood could bear.
やっとの思いで成功した
I accomplished my purpose with difficulty.

content: 5. (=執念)a vengeful spirit; an avenging spirit; furies

content.content: 人の思いに取りつかれる
to be haunted by one's furies
君が病気するのは誰かの思いだろう
It must be some one's furies that make you ill.
君のような色男の苦労するのは女の思いだ
It is woman's furies that persecute such a lady's man.

content:
おもい〔重い〕
〈形〉
1. (=軽いに対し)heavy; weighty; ponderous

content.content: 重い荷物
a heavy load
荷が重い
The burden is (too) heavy.
重い物を背負う
to bear a load―bend under a load
(彼は重い物を背負って)重い重いと言っている
He complains of the weight.
石は水よりも重いから沈む
A stone sinks in the water, because it is heavier than water.
足が重い
His steps are heavy―He treads heavily―He walks with leaden feet.
今日は頭が重い
I feel heavy in the head today.
あの女は尻が重い
She is lazy―She won't budge (an inch).
気が重い
I have a heavy heart―I am depressed in spirits.
あまり静かで気が重くなる
The silence oppresses my spirits―The silence weighs on my spirits―The silence is oppressive.

content: 2. (=重大な)weighty; important; momentous; grave; serious; severe; grievous

content.content: 君は重い役目だ
You must play an important part―play a weighty part.
重い役を勤める
to hold an important post―hold a position of trust
病気が重い
It is a serious illness.
重い病気にかかった
I was taken seriously ill―seized with a serious illness.
傷が重い
It is a severe wound.
罪が重い
It is a grave crime―a grievous crime―He is much to blame―He has much to answer for.
罰が重い
It is a heavy punishment―a severe punishment.
責任が重い
It is a heavy responsibility.
僕は両親を養わなければならないから責任が重い
It lies upon me to provide for my aged parents.
任が重い
It is an important post―a responsible post―a position of trust.
人を重く用いる
to trust a man―give one a position of trust
彼は社長に重く用いられた
He was trusted by his president.
功の疑わしきは重くせよ
Doubtful merit should be rewarded.
義は泰山よりも重く身は鴻毛よりも軽し
I hold my life at nothing as compared with my cause.

content: 3. (=困難な)difficult

content.content: 産が重かった
She had difficult delivery―a difficult labour.

おもいあい〔思い合い〕
〈名〉Mutual love; reciprocal love

content:
おもいあう〔思い合う〕
〈自動〉To love each other

content.content: もとは互いに思い合った仲だ
They were lovers once.
それほど思い合っているならいっしょにしてやっちゃどうだ
If they are so much in love with each other, what do you say to splicing them together?

content:
おもいあたる〔思い当る〕
〈自動〉(人を主格にすれば)to think of (something); to recall (something); to call (something) to mind:(事を主格とすれば)to occur to one's mind; to come home to one's heart

content.content: 思い当たることがある
I have thought of something―Something occurs to me.
それを聞いて思い当たることがある
That reminds me of something―That puts me in mind of something―That suggests something to my mind.
僕の言うことがいまに思い当たるだろう
My words will soon come home to your heart.
人生を味わって初めて文学で読んだことが心に思い当たる
Passages in literature will come home to your heart through living experience―Living experience will bring home to your heart passages in literature.

content:
おもいあわせる〔思い合わせる〕
〈他動〉To put together

content.content: かれこれ思い合わせてそうに違い無いと思った
Putting this and that together,―Putting two and two together,―I concluded it to be so.

おもいいる〔思い入る〕
〈自動〉To be lost in thoughts; to be sunk in meditation

content:
おもいいれ〔思い入れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=考え込むこと)meditation
2. ［芝居］(考え込んだ様子)a meditative attitude; a reflecting air
〈副〉(=思う存分)to one's heart's content

content.content: 思い入れ殴ってやった
I thrashed him to my heart's content.
思い入れ怒りつけてやった
I gave him a good rating.

content:
おもいうかぶ〔思い浮かぶ〕
〈自動〉
1. To occur to one's mind; to come across one's mind; to cross one's mind; to enter one's head; to come into one's head; to strike (one)

content.content: 一趣向思い浮かんだ
An idea occurs to my mind―An idea strikes me―An idea has come across my mind―An idea has come into my head.
思い浮かべる
to suggest an idea to one's mind―remind one of something［注意］以下「思い浮かべる」をもって「思い浮かぶ」に代える他動詞構文。
それを見て一趣向思い浮かんだ
The sight suggests an idea to my mind.
その唄を聞いて故郷が思い浮かんだ
That song reminds me of my home.
煙を見れば火という念が思い浮かぶ
When I see fire, the idea of fire occurs to my mind―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight of smoke suggests to my mind the idea of fire.

content:
おもいおく〔思い置く〕
〈他動〉To regret

content.content: この世に思い置くことは無い
I have nothing to regret in the world―I can leave the world without regret.
僕はたとい今死んでも思い置くことさらに無し
Even if I were to die tomorrow, I should leave the world without regret―depart in peace and contentment.

content:
おもいおこす〔思い起す〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: おもいだす〔思い出す〕

content:
おもいおもい〔思い思い〕
〈形、副〉(=の) each his own:(=に) each according to his own fancy

content.content: 人は思い思いの道楽がある
Men have each his own hobby.
娘どもは思い思いに仮装している
The girls are in fancy dress each according to her own fancy.
兄弟は思い思いの職業を選んだ
The brothers chose each the occupation to his taste.
ここは皆思い思いに解釈する処だ
Each interprets the passage according to his own light.
人は思い思い
“Every man to his taste.”
朝咲いて四つに
The morning-glories blow
萎れる朝顔さえも
At morn, to fade at noon;
思い思いの
And yet they fancy soon
色を持つ
Each its own tint and hue.

content:
おもいおよぶ〔思い及ぶ〕
〈他動〉To think as far as (that)

content.content: そこまでは思い及ばなかった
I did not think so far as that.

content:
おもいかえす〔思い返す〕
〈自動〉
1. (=思い直す)to think twice; to think better of (anything)

content.content: 思い返したらいやになった
On second thoughts, I will not do it.
思い返して決心を翻した
I thought better of my resolution.

content: 2. (=反省する)to reflect on oneself

content.content: 天を恨み人を
Never be wroth with Providence,
咎むる事はあらじ
Nor blame thy fellow-men;
我が過ちと
But well reflect on thine own fault
思い返さば
Committed 'yond thy ken!

content:
おもいがけない〔思い掛けない〕
〈形〉Unexpected; unlooked-for; unforeseen; unsuspected; unlikely; accidental; chance:(動詞に用いれば)not to expect

content.content: 思いがけない成功
unexpected success―unlooked-for success
思いがけない出来事
an unlooked-for event―an unforeseen event
思いがけない処に実があるものだ
You will find treasures in unlikely places―in unsuspected corners.
思いがけない時に報知が来た
The news arrived at a time when it was least expected.
君にここで逢おうとは思いがけなかった
You are the last man I expected to have met here―This is the last place where I expected to have met you.
こんな結果を見ようとは思いがけなかった
The result is beyond expectation.
君が来ようとは思いがけなかった
Your visit is a surprise.
これは思いがけない好運だ
It is a godsend―a windfall.
これは思いがけない邂逅{かいこう}だ
This is an accidental meeting―a chance encounter.

content:
おもいがけなく〔思い掛けなく〕
〈副〉Unexpectedly; accidentally; by accident; by chance

content.content: 思いがけなく彼に逢った
I met him by chance.
思いがけなく面白い事実を発見した
I lighted upon a curious fact by accident.

content:
おもいきった〔思い切った〕
〈形〉
1. (=大胆な)daring; bold; resolute; decisive

content.content: 思い切ったことをする
to dare
ずいぶん思い切ったことをする人だ
He is a man of daring character―of decisive character.
思い切ったことを言う
to speak out
ずいぶん思い切ったことを言う男だ
He is outspoken.
ずいぶん思い切った企てだ
It is a daring scheme―a bold enterprise.

content: 2. (=極端な)extreme; desperate; drastic

content.content: 彼は思い切った考えを懐いている
He holds extreme views.
思い切った処置をする
to take decisive measures―take desperate measures―take drastic measures
思い切った療治だ
It is a desperate remedy―a drastic remedy.
あれは思い切ったばかだ
He is a desperate fool―an egregious ass.
思い切った惚れようをする
to love one to distraction

content:
おもいきって〔思い切って〕
〈副〉
1. (=大胆に)daringly; boldly; resolutely; full fling

content.content: 何でも思い切ってやってみる
to dare to―venture to―do anything
思い切って彼を攻撃した
I boldly attacked him―I ventured to attack him.
思い切って試験を受けてみよう
I will boldly go in for the examination.
思い切って反対を試みた
I ventured to oppose the measure.
彼は思い切って事業に乗り出した
He embarked full fling in the enterprise.
思い切って言おう
I will speak out.
君に怒られる覚悟で思い切ってそう言おう
I will dare your anger, and say so.
誰も思い切って話を切り出す者が無かった
No one had the courage to break the ice.
一度思い切って遊ぶと未練が残らない
Let a man have his fling, and he will not look back.
一つ思い切ってやってみよう
I will take my chance―take the chances―chance it―take the risks―risk it.
思い切って戦争をする気は無いか
Have you no mind to risk a war?―hazard a war?
思い切って身を投ずる
to take the plunge
思い切って百円奮発しよう
I will come down with 100 yen.

content: 2. (=非常に)extremely; exceedingly; desperately

content.content: 彼は思い切ってひどい英語を使う
He speaks exceedingly bad English―as bad English as heart can desire.
二人は思い切って惚れ合っている
They are desperately in love with each other―They love each other to distraction.
思い切って安く売る
to sell at a desperate price

content:
おもいきり〔思い切り〕
〈名〉
1. (=諦め、断念)resignation; abandonment
2. (=決心、決定)resolution; determination; decision

content.content: 思い切りが好い
He is resolute―decisive.
思い切りの好い男だ
He is a man of decisive character.
思い切が悪い
He is irresolute―indecisive.
思い切りの悪い男だ
He lacks decision.
男は女と違って思い切りが好い
A man is more decisive than a woman.
いつまでもくよくよしていないで思い切り好く諦めたが好い
You ought to have done with the matter, instead of worrying over it to all eternity.

content: 〈副〉(=思う存分)to one's heart's content

content.content: 思い切り殴ってやった
I thrashed him to my heart's content.
思い切り怒りつけてやった
I gave him a good rating.

content:
おもいきる〔思い切る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=断念する)to give up; to abandon; to relinquish; to abandon all hope of, relinquish all hope of, give up all hope of, despair of (success); to give up the attempt, abandon the attempt (in despair); to abandon the idea, give up the idea (of doing something); to have done with (anything)

content.content: もう成功を思い切った
I have given up all hope of success―abandoned all hope of success―relinquished all hope of success―I now despair of success.
(幾度やっても失敗ばかりするから)もう思い切った
I have given up the attempt in despair―given it up as a bad job.
見込が無いから試験を受けるのを思い切った
I have no chance of success, so I have given up the idea of―abandoned the idea of―taking the examination.
金ができないから洋行を思い切った
I can not find the means, so I have abandoned the idea of―given up the idea of―going abroad.
切なる恋を思い切る
to give up the object of one's ardent passion―have done with a man or a woman
男だ、あんな女を思い切ってしまえ
Be a man, and have done with her!
あんな男はいくらもある、思い切れんか
Such men are to be found by the cartload. Can you not have done with him?
彼に思い切らせようと思って意見してみた
I talked seriously to him, that he might have done with her.
彼にその女を貰うことを思い切らした
I have dissuaded him from marrying her.

content:
2. (=諦める)to resign oneself to (one's fate); to get over (a loss)
3. (=決心する、決定する)to resolve; to determine; to decide; to make up one's mind

おもいご〔思い子〕
〈名〉A beloved child; a favourite child; a darling child; a pet child

content:
おもいごと〔思い事〕
〈名〉A desire; a wish

content.content: 思い事がかなった
My wishes are fulfilled―I have realized my wishes―I have had my wish.

content:
おもいこむ〔思い込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=頑固に思う)to be possessed with (an idea); to be obsessed with (a notion)

content.content: 彼は妙なことを思い込んでいる
He is obsessed with a strange notion―possessed with a strange notion―A strange notion has taken possession of his mind―taken hold of his mind.
一途にそう思い込んでいる
The notion has taken firm hold of his mind.

content: 2. (=執心する)to set one's heart on (anything); to be bent on (anything); to be determined (to do or on anything)

content.content: 彼はあの地位を得ようと思い込んでいるらしい
He seems to have set his heart on securing the position.
彼はいったんこうと思い込むとどうしても動かない
Once he is bent on anything, nothing can turn him from it.
思い込んだらできないことは無い
A man who is determined to do anything, can do it―Nothing is impossible to the man who can will.

content: 3. (=思い立つ)to take into one's head

content.content: 彼は相場をやってみようと思い込んだ
He took it into his head to engage in speculation.

content:
おもいしる〔思い知る〕
〈他動〉To feel (one's vengeance)

content.content: この恨みを思い知らさでおくべきか
He shall feel my vengeance.
思い知ったか
Do you feel my vengeance now?
きっと思い知らしてやる
He shall smart for it.

content:
おもいすごす〔思い過す〕
〈他動〉To think too much of (anything)

content.content: 困難を思い過ごしたのだ
I thought too much of the difficulty―made too much of the difficulty―made a mountain of a mole-hill.

content:
おもいそめる〔思い初める〕
〈他動〉To feel in love with (one)

content.content: (奉公に行って)主人の娘を思い初めた
He fell in love with his master's daughter.

content:
おもいだしわらい〔思い出し笑い〕
〈名〉A quiet laugh (over something past)

content.content: あの時のことを思い出すと時々思い出し笑いをする
When I think of that affair, I often enjoy a quiet laugh over it.

content:
おもいだす〔思い出す〕
〈他動〉
1. To bethink oneself of(は古文体):(現代語は) to think of (something); to call (something) to mind; to recall; to recollect; to remember

content.content: 君は故郷を思い出さないか
Don't you think of home?
ふと人に会う約束のあったことを思い出した
I suddenly thought of an appointment I had made.
その人の名が思い出せない
I can not recollect his name―His name has escaped my memory.
その名がちょいと思い出せない
I do not remember his name―His name has slipped my memory.
その名がどうしても思い出せない
I do not, for the life of me, recollect his name.
僕はあの時のことを時々思い出す
I often call the affair to mind―I often recall the affair―The affair often recurs to my mind―My thoughts often revert to the affair.
忘れねばこそ思い出さず候
You are ever present to my mind.
思い出す様じや
If you recollect your love,
惚れ様が足らぬ
You do not love enough;
思い出さずに
Be ever present to your mind
忘れずに
The object of your love!
身をつねって思い出す
to refresh one's memory―jog one's memory―fillip one's memory―touch up one's memory
彼女は子どものことを思い出しては泣いてばかりいる
She does nothing but cry at the thought of her children―at the recollection of her children.
思い出し次第に話しておこう
I will speak to him whenever I think of it―as memory serves.
近頃中あったことを思い出して考えている
I am chewing the cud of late events―chewing over late events―ruminating on recent events.
彼は時々思い出したように勉強する
He works by fits and starts―by catches―by snatches―He is a spasmodic worker.
時々思い出したように勉強熱が起こる
He has occasional fits of industry.
思い出させる

to make one think of something―remind one of something―put one in mind of something―recall something to one's mind―suggest something to one's mind―be suggestive of something―be reminiscent of the past［注意］以下は「思い出させる」をもって「思い出す」に代える他動詞構文。
それで思い出したことがある
That reminds me of something.
君を見ると弟を思い出す(君は弟に似て居る)
You make me think of my brother―You remind me of your brother.
君に逢うといつもあの時のことを思い出す
You always remind me of that day―You always put me in mind of that day.
煙を見ると火を思い出す

When you see smoke, you think of fire―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight of smoke reminds you of fire―(また)―When you see smoke, the idea of fire occurs to your mind―(これを他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight of smoke suggests to your mind the idea of fire.
その唄を聞くと昔を思い出す
That song reminds me of old times―carries my mind back to the old times.
(寡婦曰く)この着物を見ると幸福であった昔を思い出す
This gown reminds me of happier days―carries me back to happier days.
それを聞いて面白い話を思い出した
That reminds me of an amusing story―That recalls an amusing story to my mind.
故郷を思い出すような唄を聞かしてくれた
She sang me―a song that reminded me of my home―a song suggestive of my home―a song reminiscent of my home.

content:
おもいたち〔思い立ち〕
〈名〉An impulse

content.content: 急の思い立ち
a sudden impulse
急の思い立ちでしたことだ
I did it on impulse―on a sudden impulse―on the spur or the moment.
柄にもない投機とは妙な思い立ちだ
What put it in your head to engage in speculation, which is out of your line?

content:
おもいたつ〔思い立つ〕
〈他動〉To think of (doing something); to take it into one's head (to do something):(事を主格とすれば)to come into one's head; to enter one's head; to occur to one's mind

content.content: 急に思い立って来た
I suddenly thought of coming, and started on the instant.
彼は性急な質で何でも思い立ったことをすぐしなければ承知しない
He is of such an impetuous nature that he must do at once whatever comes into his head.
思い立ったが吉日
“There is no time like the present.”

content:
おもいちがい〔思い違い〕
〈名〉A mistake; a delusion; misunderstanding; misapprehension:(=する) to be mistaken; to labour under a mistake; to be under a delusion; to misunderstand; to misapprehend

content.content: 君は思い違いをしている
You are mistaken.
妙な思い違いをしている
You labour under a strange mistake.
僕はとんだ思い違いをしておった
I have been under a delusion.
そりゃ君の思い違いだろう
You must be mistaken―You must be labouring under some mistake―It must be some misapprehension on your part.
君は僕の心を思い違いしている
You misunderstand me.
その思い違いはありがちだ
One is apt to think so.

content:
おもいつき〔思い付き〕
〈名〉An idea; a plan; a suggestion

content.content: そりゃ好い思いつきだ
It is a good idea―a happy idea―a bright idea.
君何か好い思いつきは無いか
Can't you think of some good plan?―Have you any suggestion to make?

content:
おもいつく〔思い付く〕
〈自他動〉
1. To think of (a plan); to hit upon (an idea); to be struck with (an idea):(事を主格とすれば)to occur to one's mind; to come across one's mind; to cross one's mind; to enter one's head; to come into one's head; to strike (one)

content.content: 一趣向思いついた
I have thought of a plan―hit upon an idea―An idea occurs to my mind―comes across my mind―comes into my head―strikes me.
そりゃうまい趣向だ、僕にはとんと思いつかなかった
A good idea! I never thought of it.
警察で尋ねようとはつい思いつかなかった
I never thought of inquiring at the police-station―It never occurred to me to inquire at the ploice-station.
ちょうど好い言葉が思いつかない
I can not think of the right word―The right word does not occur to me.
思い付かせる
to remind one of something―suggest an idea to one's mind.［注意］以下「思い付かせる」を「思い付く」に代える他動詞構文。
それで思いついたことがある
That reminds me of something.
それを見て一趣向思いついた
The sight suggested an idea to my mind.
君は何か思いついたことは無いか
Can's you think of some plan?―Have you any suggestion to make?

content:
おもいつめる〔思い詰める〕
〈自動〉To think hard

content.content: ひと月も思い詰めてようやく一策を案じた
I thought hard for a month, till at last I thought of a plan.

content: 〈他動〉To brood over (a matter)

content.content: 彼はあまりそのことを思い詰めてとうとう発狂してしまった
He brooded so long over the matter that the thought drove him mad.

content:
おもいで〔思い出〕
〈名〉Memory; remembrance; reminiscence; association

content.content: ここは僕の少年時代の思い出の多い処だ
