This place is full of the reminiscences of my boyhood.
その唄を聞くと昔の思い出がある
That song brings back sweet memories of the past.
あの日は思い出の多い日であった
That day has left many memories on my mind―It was a memorable day.
ここは過去の思い出が多い
The place is associated with history―instinct with souvenirs of the past.
これは老後の思い出だ
This is the last effort of an old man.
思い出草
a remembrancer―a reminder―a memento―a souvenir

content:
おもいどおり〔思い通り〕
〈副〉As one thinks; as one pleases; as one wishes; all one can desire; to one's satisfaction; after one's own heart

content.content: 思い通りに問題を解決した
I have solved the problem to my satisfaction.
思い通りの人物だ
The man is all I can desire―He is a man after my own heart.

content:
おもいとどまる〔思い止まる〕
〈自他動〉To give up, abandon, relinquish (the attempt or the idea of doing something); to give up the attempt; to desist from the attempt

content.content: 後生だから今度のことは思いとどまって下さい
For God's sake, desist from the attempt!
幾度やっても失敗ばかりするからもう思いとどまった
I have failed so often that I have given up the attempt in despair―given it up as a bad job.
金が出ないから洋行を思いとどまった
I can not find the means, so I have given up the idea of―abandoned the idea of―relinquished the idea of―going abroad.
彼にあの女を貰うことを思いとどまらした
I have dissuaded him from marrying her.

content:
おもいなおす〔思い直す〕
〈自他動〉To think twice; to think better of (anything); to reconsider

content.content: 思い直していやになった
On second thoughts, I will not do it.
辞職しようかと思ったが思い直した
I thought of resigning, but I have thought better of my resolution.
僕に依頼している家族のことを考えて思い直した
When I thought of my family depending upon me for support, I took heart.

content:
おもいのこす〔思い残す〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: おもいおく〔思い置く〕

content:
おもいのほか〔思いの外〕
〈副〉Contrary to expectation; beyond expectation; beyond one's expectations; more... than one expected ［thought, hoped, feared］

content.content: 試験は思いのほかやさしかった
The examination was easier than I had expected.
仕事は思いのほか骨が折れる
I find my work harder than I expected.
思いのほか骨が折れない
I find it not so hard as I expected.
君の病気は思いのほか早く治った
You have recovered sooner than I hoped.
彼の病気は思いのほか長くかかった
His recovery has taken longer than I feared.
利益は思いのほか多い
The profit is greater than I expected.
損亡は思いのほか少ない
The loss is less than I expected.
思いのほか好くできた
He has done it better than I expected―beyond my expectations.
成績は思いのほか好い
The result is better than I expected―beyond my expectations―surprisingly good―an agreeable surprise.
成績は思いのほか悪い
The result is worse than I expected―disappointing―a disappointment――the result falls short of my expectations―does not come up to my expectations.
思いのほか好い天気になった
Contrary to expectation, the weather has turned out fine―The weather has turned out to be a pleasant surprise.

content:
おもいのままに〔思いの儘に〕
〈副〉As one pleases; at one's pleasure; at one's command

content.content: 彼は何事も思いのままにしている
He does everything at his pleasure―He has everything his own way.
世の中が思いのままになるならば天下の学校を全廃せん
If I had my way, there should be no school in the world.
あの人は金が思いのままになる
He has money at his command.
思いのままにならぬこともある
Things are not always at your command.
勝敗は思いのままになるものでない
“It is not in mortals to command success.”
思いのままに英語が話して見たい
I should like to have a perfect command of English.

おもいびと〔思い人〕
〈名〉One's love, beloved one, sweetheart:(女のは)a lover

おもいまどう〔思い惑う〕
〈自動〉To be puzzled; to be perplexed

content:
おもいまわす〔思い廻す〕
〈自動〉To turn (a matter) over in one's mind; to revolve (a scheme); to reflect upon (a matter)

content.content: いろいろ思いまわした末承諾することにきめた
After turning the matter over and over in my mind, I decided to accept the offer.
思いまわせばまわすほど涙の種が増すばかり
The more I reflect upon it, the more inclined I feel to cry.

content:
おもいめぐらす〔思い廻らす〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: おもいまわす〔思い廻す〕

おもいもの〔思い者〕
〈名〉A favourite concubine; a kept mistress

content:
おもいもよらぬ〔思いも寄らぬ〕
〈形〉(=想像にも及ばぬ、もってのほか)inconceivable; not to be thought of; out of the question; strange; extraordinary

content.content: 辞職などは思いも寄らぬことだ
Resignation is not to be thought of―out of the question―inconceivable―You must not think of resigning.
この年で結婚などとは思いも寄らぬことだ
Marriage at my age is not to be thought of―I can not think of marrying at my age.
今時分(この深夜に)出発などとは思いも寄らぬ
Departure at this time of night is out of the question―You must not think of starting at this time of night.
僕に謝まれなどとは思いも寄らぬことだ
An apology on my part is out of the question―I can not think of apologizing.
こは思いも寄らぬことを仰せられる
What you say, is very strange.
この思いも寄らぬ一言に誰も返答ができなかった
To this extraordinary remark, no one could find a reply.

content: 〈他動〉(=想像も付かぬ)can not think; can not imagine; can not conceive; to have no conception of (a battle); to have no idea of (what it is like); to little dream of (such an event)

content.content: 空中を飛ぶのはどんなものか思いも寄らぬ
I can not think what a flight is like―I can not imagine what it is like―I can not conceive what it is like.―I have no conception of what it is like―I have no idea of what it is like.
それが君であろうとは思いも寄らなかった
I had no idea that it could be you―I little dreamed that it was you.
そんなことは思いも寄らぬ
I can not think of such a thing―I can not entertain the thought―The thought is not to be entertained.
そんな処置は思いも寄らなかった
Such measures never occurred to my mind―never entered my head.
君にここで逢おうとは思いも寄らなかった
I little dreamed of meeting you here―This is the last place where I expected to meet you―You are the last person I expected to meet here.

content:
おもいやられる〔思い遣られる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=同情する)to sympathize with (one); to feel for (one)

content.content: 彼の心情が思いやられる
I sympathize with him―feel for him.

content: 2. (=察する)to imagine

content.content: 彼の悲嘆は実に思いやられる
I can well imagine his grief.
この険悪な天候に航海者の難儀が思いやられる
The hardships of the sailors in this inclement weather may be imagined―The sailors must be having a hard time of it in this weather.

content: 3. (=気遣う)to feel anxious about (anything); to feel uneasy about (anything)

content.content: 今からそんなじゃ末が思いやられる
Your goings-on make me feel uneasy about your future.
今からけんかじゃ結婚してからが思いやられる
If you quarrel before you are married, what are you going to do after you are?

content:
おもいやり〔思い遣り〕
〈名〉Sympathy; fellow-feeling; consideration; considerateness; delicacy

content.content: 彼は思いやりがある
He is considerate.
さすがは苦労人だけに思いやりがある
Like the man who has seen much of life, he has a consideration for others' feelings.
思いやりが無い
He is inconsiderate―He has no consideration for others' feelings.
彼の思いやりある仕打ちには感心した
I admire his delicate conduct.
彼は(人にきまりの悪い思いをさせないような)思いやりのあるものの言いようをする
He has a delicate way of saying things.
金を包んで出すのは日本人独特の思いやり
Giving money under cover is a delicacy peculiar to the Japanese.

content:
おもいやる〔思い遣る〕
〈他動〉To sympathize with (one); to feel for (one); to be thoughtful for (others); to consider one's feelings; to enter into one's feelings; to spare one's feelings; to put oneself in the place of others

content.content: 人を思いやる
to sympathize with others―feel for others―be thoughtful for others―put oneself in the place of others
彼は思いやるということが無い
He never considers others' feelings―never consults otheres' feelings―He has no consideration for others' feelings―no regard for others' feelings―He can not put himself in the place of others.
彼の心中を思いやってあのことは言わずにおいた
I refrained from mentioning the matter to spare his feelings―out of regard for his feelings.
老人には若い者の心が思いやれぬことがある
The old can not always enter into the feelings of the young.
人の難儀を思いやる
to enter into others' troubles

おもいれ〔思入れ〕
〈名〉Speculation in futures

content:
おもいわずらう〔思い煩う〕
〈自他動〉To be troubled about (a matter); to be distressed about (a matter); to be worried about (the examination); to be oppressed with doubts and anxieties

content.content: 国家の将来を思い煩う
I am troubled about the future of my country.
彼はいつも何かしきりに思い煩っている
His mind is always oppressed with doubts and anxieties.
明日のことを思い煩うなかれ
“Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.”

おもいわびる〔思い佗びる〕
〈自動〉To feel wretched; to feel lonely

content:
おもう〔思う〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=考える)to think; to deem; to consider; to judge; to esteem (it an honour); to take (it ill or amiss)

content.content: 誰でも自分のものは好いものだと思っている(うぬぼれと瘡気の無い者は無い)
“Everybody thinks his geese are swans.”
僕はそうでないと思う
(I think it is not so―と言わずして)I do not think it is so.［注意］日英ともに初句を打ち消す点において一致す。
彼は来ないだろうと思う
I don't think he will come.
彼は来るだろうと思った(ところが来ない)
I thought he would come.
君は来るだろうと思った(はたして来た)
I knew you would come.
こんなことだろうと思った
I knew how it would be.
必要と思うなら彼に秘密を打ち明けてもさし支え無い
You may let him into the secret if you deem it necessary.
これは些細なことだと思う
I consider the matter of no consequence―hold the matter of no moment.
それが一番好かろうと思った
I thought that was the best way―I judged that to be the best course.
彼は発狂に違い無いと思った
I thought he must be mad―I concluded him to be mad.
僕は本校の末席を汚すのを名誉と思っております
I esteem it an honour to be connected with the school.
こう言うのも老婆心で言うのだから決して悪く思い給うな
You must not take it ill,―take it amiss,―for I say this out of kindness.
慣れた故郷を離れるのかと思うと悲しかった
I felt sad at the thought of leaving my beloved home.
夫婦仲が好いものと思っていた
I thought they were happy together―They seemed to be happy together.
この品は君か欲しかろうと思った
I thought―It occurred to me―the you might want the article.
彼の様子がはて変だなと思った
I thought his appearance strange―His appearance struck me as strange.
惟うに
I think―methinks―in my opinion―in my mind―to my mind―to my thinking.
惟うに彼は善人だ
In my opinion,―In my mind,―he is a good man―to my mind―to my thinking.

content: 2. (=何々しようと思う、志す、もくろむ、決心する)I think (I will do so); to intend, mean (to do something); to determine, resolve (to do something); to contemplate (something)

content.content: 明日行こうと思う
I think I will go―I intend to go―I am going―tomorrow.
今晩来ようと思う
I think I will come―I intend to come―I am coming―this evening.
僕は洋行しようと思う
I think I will go abroad―I intend to go abroad.
洋行でもしようかと思う
I think of going abroad.
死んでしまおうと思った
I thought I would die―I resolved to die.
死んでしまおうかとまでも思った
I even thought of dying.
どんなことをしても目的を遂げようと思った
I thought I would―I determined to―accomplish my purpose at any cost.
親父は僕を医者にしようと思っている
My father intends to make a physician of me―intends that I shall be a physician―intends me to be a physician―intends me for a physician.
彼は結婚しようと思っている
He intends to marry―contemplates a marriage.

content: 3. (=どうなるだろうと思う、期待する)I think (I shall do so):(好事なら)I hope (he will recover):(凶事なら)I fear, I am afraid (he will die):(吉凶ともに)to expect (to do something―one to do something)

content.content: 彼には今日逢うだろうと思う
I think I shall meet him today―I expect to meet him today.
彼は来るだろうと思う
I think he will come―I expect him.
彼は今にも来るかと思う
I expect him every moment.
僕は今度及第するかと思う
I hope I shall pass this time―I expect to pass this time.
今度は落第するかと思った
I feared I should fail this time―I was afraid I should fail this time―I expected to fail this time.
落第しはせぬかと思った
I was afraid lest I should fail.
君は成功するだろうと思う
I hope you will succeed―I expect you to succeed.
彼は失敗するだろうと思う
I fear he will fail―I am afraid he will fail―I expect him to fail.
(あの時は)今死ぬか今死ぬかと思った
I feared I should die every moment―I expected to die every moment.
病人は全快するだろうと思う
I hope the invalid will recover―I expect him to recover―I am hopeful of his recovery.
彼は全快しまいと思う
I fear―I am afraid―he will not recover.
死ぬだろうと思う
I fear I am afraid―he will die.
死ぬまいと思う
I hope he will not die.
君がこんなことをしようとは思わなかった
I did not expect this of you.
試験は思ったより易しかった
The examination was easier than I had expected.
彼は思ったほど学問ができない
He is not so good a scholar as we expected―He does not come up to our expectations―He has fallen short of our expectations.
こんなにうまくいこうとは夢にも思わなかった
I little dreamed―little thought―that it would go so well.
思うよりも産むがやすい
It is easier than one expects.

content: 4. (=何を何と思う、看做す)to regard, look upon (one as a benefactor); to view (anything in the light of misfortune); to take (one for a burglar); to put down, set down (one as or for a fool)

content.content: 世間では彼を学者だと思っている
People regard him as a scholar―look upon him as a scholar.
敵を恩人と思え
Regard your enemy as your benefactor!
僕は英語を外国語とは思わぬ
I do not regard English as a foreign language―view English in the light of a foreign language.
人はこのたびのことを災難のように思うが僕はそう思わぬ
People look upon the occurrence as a calamity, but I do not view it in that light.
君を泥棒かと思った
I took you for a burglar.
あの人の英語を聞くと西洋人かと思う
To hear him speak English, one would take him for a foreigner.
俺を何だと思うか
What do you think I am?―What do you take me for?
俺をばかだと思うか
Do you think I am a fool?―Do you take me for a fool?
彼の話を聞いてばかだと思った
To hear him talk, I put him down for a fool―set him down as a fool.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼らは西洋人さえ見れば偉いものだと思う
They see a great man in every foreigner.

content: 5. (=仮定する、想像する、誤想する)to suppose; to imagine; to fancy

content.content: 彼は死んだものとばかり思っておった
I supposed him to be dead.
今度は大丈夫だと思って安心しておった(ところが大違い)
I imagined myself to be safe.
彼女は自分で美人だと思ってうぬぼれている
She fancies herself to be beautiful.
(彼はばかなことをしておきながら)好いことをしたと思って悦んでいる
He is rejoicing under the impression that he has done good.
敵と思った人が味方であった
I found a friend in a supposed enemy.
彼は仇を受けたと思って悔しがっている
He broods over his fancied wrongs―his imagined wrongs.

content: 6. (=信ずる)to believe

content.content: 古人は太陽が地球を回るものと思っていた
The ancients believed that the sun went round the earth.
君は来世は有るものと思うか
Do you believe in the future existence?
幽霊は有るものだと思うか
Do you believe in ghosts?
神は有るものだと思う
I believe in God.

content: 7. (=怪しむ)to suspect (one of a crime)

content.content: あの男は敵と内通していやせぬかと思う
I suspect him of treachery.
あの男があやしいと思う
I suspect him.

content: 8. (=感ずる)to feel

content.content: 僕は今度こそは義理にも成功せんければならんと思う
I feel myself bound to succeed this time.
何んとなくそのように思う
I feel that it is so.
彼を親のように思う
I feel towards him as if he were my father.

content: 9. (=思案する、省る)to think on, meditate on, reflect on, muse on (some subject)

content.content: 我が身を思う
to reflect on oneself
世のはか無さを思う
I muse on the mutability of human affairs.

content: 10. (=帰する)to attribute (anything to its cause); to give (one) credit for (something)

content.content: 世間では彼の成功を僥倖だと思っている
People attribute his success to luck.
君にこんな隠し芸があろうとは思わなかった
I did not give you credit for such skill.
君はそんなばかだとは思わなかった
I gave you credit for more sense.

content: 11. (=望む)to wish; to want; to desire; to fancy

content.content: 成功しようと思うならもっと勉強しなけりゃいかん
If you wish to succeed, you must work harder.
洋行しようと思えばいつでもできる
I could go abroad if I wanted to.
思うように書けない
I can not write as I wish to.
思う事がかなわない
I can not realize my wishes―have my wish.
思う事をかなわしてやる
You shall have your wish.
思う品が無い
I can not find the desired article―the article I fancy―an article after my fancy.

content: 12. (=愛す、慕う)to love (a man or a woman); to sigh for (somebody); to yearn after (one's child)

content.content: 僕は思う人が有る
I love somebody.
君は思う人が有るか
Are you sighing for anybody?
思うて通えば千里も一里
Love laughs at distance.
二人は思う仲だ
They are lovers.
思う仲の小いさかい
lovers' quarrels
思う人
the lady of one's heart
子を思わぬ親は無し
Every parent yearns after his or her children.

content: 13. (=記憶する)to remember

content.content: あの人にはいつか逢ったことが有るように思う
I remember meeting him once.

content: 14. (=かしらと怪しむ)to wonder (if, whether, who, what, etc.)

content.content: 僕の処置はどこが悪いかしらと思った
I wondered how I could have done wrong.
国の為を思う
to have one's country at heart
君のためを思ってこう言うのだ
I say this, for I have you interests at heart―I say this for your good.
来た人は誰かと思えば噂をしておった主人公じゃないか
Who should come in but the very man we were taking about?
今度は何をするかと思えば相場に手を出すじゃないか
What should he do next but dabble in speculation?
彼は日に十時間の授業をなんとも思わぬ(屁とも思わぬ)
He makes nothing of teaching ten hours a day.
彼は嘘をつくくらいはなんとも思わぬ
He makes no bones of lying―makes nothing of lying.
彼は人をなんとも思わない
He makes nothing of men―He holds men cheap.
人を見たら泥棒と思え
Do not trust strangers.
恩を恩とも思わない
He is insensible to kindness―He is an ingrate.
世の中は思うようにならない
We must take the world as it is.
我が子だって思うようになるものじゃない
You can not even make your own child what you wish him to be.
彼は思うようにならないことがあるとカンシャクを起こす
When anything goes wrong with him, he flies into a passion.
思うようにならなけりゃ止めるばかりだ
If I can not have my way, I can but desist.
世の中は思うに任せぬことだらけだ
Life is full of vexations.
僕は正しいと思うことをする
I do what is right in my sight.
彼らは外国人さえ見れば偉いものだと思う
They see a great man in every foreigner.
やっぱり僕の思った通りだ
I was right after all.
その名を聞てどんな色男かと思った
On hearing his name mentioned, I pictured to myself a fine gentleman.
彼はなんと思ったか相場に手を出した
He took it into his head to dabble in speculation.
君はなんと思って相場などを始めたか
What put it in your head to take to speculation?
馬がなんと思ったか立ち止まって動かない
The horse took it into his head to stand still.
何事かと思って窓から覗いて見た
I looked out of the window to see what was the matter.
誰かと思って戸を明けて見た
I opened the door to see who it was.
女だと思ってばかにするな
Do not trifle with me because I am a woman!
皆叱られるかと思ってびくびくしている
They tremble lest they should catch it.
金が要るかと思って持って来た
I have brought some money with me in case I might want it.
君も読みたかろうと思って本を持って来た
I have brought the book in case you might want to read it.
思う壺にはまる
to come in pat―hit it right
思うことを充分に言い表すことは難しい
It is difficult to express oneself to one's satisfaction.
真人間の仕業とは思われぬ
It can not be the doing of a man in his senses.
彼女を不憫に思った
I took pity on her.
彼の仕打ちを不満に思う
I am displeased at his conduct.
彼の仕打ちを失敬だと思う
I resent his conduct.
彼はこの事業を我が事と思っている
He identifies himself with the undertaking.
我が物と思えば軽し笠の雪
“A voluntary burden is no burden.”

content:
おもうぞんぶん〔思う存分〕
〈副〉To one's heart's content; to the full

content.content: 思う存分恨みを晴らしてやる
I will wreak my grudge to my heart's content.
思う存分人生を楽しんでみたい
I should like to enjoy life to the full.
思う存分食う
to eat one's fill
思う存分食った
I have had my fill.
思う存分飲ましてやれ
Let him drink his fill!
独りになってから思う存分泣いた
When I was left to myself, I cried my fill―had a good cry―had my cry out.
思う存分遊ぶと未練が残らない
Let a man have his fling, and he will not look back.

content:
おもうつぼ〔思う壺〕
〈名〉The desideratum; the want

content.content: 思う壺にはまる
to fill the want―come in pat―hit it right
計略が思う壺にはまった
The stratagem hit it right―The stratagem took.

content:
おもうに〔思うに〕
〈副〉I think; methinks; in my opinion; in my mind; to my thinking

content.content: 思うに彼は善人だ
In my opinion,―In my mind,―he is a good man―to my thinking.

content:
おもうままに〔思う儘に〕
〈副〉As one pleases; at one's pleasure; at one's command

content.content: 思うままにする
to do as one pleases―act at one's pleasure―have one's way
世の中が思うままになるならば学校を全廃する
If I had my way, there should be no school.
子どもらに思うままにさしておく
I let my children have their own way―indulge my children (in their wishes)
彼は金が思うままになる
He has money at his command.
思うままにならぬものもある
Things are not always at one's command.
勝敗は思うままにならぬ
“It is not in mortals to command success.”
英語を思うままに話してみたい
I should like to have a perfect command of English.

content:
おもえらく〔思えらく〕
〈副〉I think; methinks; meseems; it seems to me

content.content: 余思えらくこれ只事ならずと
Methought this was no common matter.

content:
おもおもしい〔重々しい〕
〈形〉Grave; serious; solemn; dignified

content.content: 彼は風采が重々しい
He has a dignified air.
重々しい口調で述べた
He stated the case in a grave tone.
行列は重々しい歩調で進んだ
The procession proceeded at a solemn pace.
重々しく
gravely―solemnly―with due solemnity

content:
おもかげ〔俤、面影〕
〈名〉
1. (=顔、姿、影像)one's face; one's figure; one's image

content.content: 彼の俤がまだ目先にちらついている
His face is still present to my senses.
その女の俤が僕に取りついて忘れられぬ
Her image haunts me.

content: 2. (=影、跡)a shadow; traces; vestiges

content.content: Greece は僅かに昔日の面影をとどめているのである
Greece is but a shadow of her ancient glory.
城は今なお昔日の面影をとどめている
The castle still retains some traces of its former grandeur.
昔日の面影だにとどめぬ
Not a vestige remains of its former grandeur.
彼は昔の面影も無い
He is a ruin―a wreck―the wreck of his former self―the ruin of what he was―the shadow of what he used to be.

content:
おもかげ〔俤、面影〕
〈名〉
1. (=顔、姿、影像)one's face; one's figure; one's image

content.content: 彼の俤がまだ目先にちらついている
His face is still present to my senses.
その女の俤が僕に取りついて忘れられぬ
Her image haunts me.

content: 2. (=影、跡)a shadow; traces; vestiges

content.content: Greece は僅かに昔日の面影をとどめているのである
Greece is but a shadow of her ancient glory.
城は今なお昔日の面影をとどめている
The castle still retains some traces of its former grandeur.
昔日の面影だにとどめぬ
Not a vestige remains of its former grandeur.
彼は昔の面影も無い
He is a ruin―a wreck―the wreck of his former self―the ruin of what he was―the shadow of what he used to be.

content:
おもかじ〔面舵〕
〈名〉Starboard

content.content: 面舵にする
to port the helm
面舵(!)(舵手への指図)
Port!
面舵いっぱい(!)
Hard a-port!
面舵いっぱいに取る
to put the helm hard a-port

content:
おもき〔重き〕
〈名〉
1. Weight

content.content: 重きを置く
to attach weight to anything―attach importance to anything―lay stress on anything―consider anything important
本校では英語に重きを置く
We attach importance to English.
語学は熟練に重きを置く
In language-study, weight is attached to practice.
軍隊では規律に特に重きを置かれる
In the army, special weight is attached to discipline.
彼は金持ちだから経費問題には重きを置かぬ
As he is rich, hi does not attach importance to the question of expense―the question of expense does not weigh with him.
先生はこの事実に重きを置かれる
He lays stress on this fact.
僕はこんなことには重きを置かぬ
I consider the matter of no consequence.
彼は生命よりも名誉に置きを置く
He values honour above life.
重きをなす
to weigh―have weight―carry weight―be important
彼は金持ちだから経費問題は重きをなさぬ
As he is rich, the question of expense does not weight with him.
そういう議論はある社会に重きをなす
Such arguments have weight with certain classes.
彼の意見が重きをなしている
His opinion carries weight.
今の戦争では飛行機が重きをなしている
The aeroplane plays an important part in modern warfare.
現今の教育では本が最も重きをなしている
Books play the most weighty part in modern education.
我が国では学問が重きをなしている
Learning is held in esteem in Japan.
あの先生は学校でだいぶ重きをなしている
He is held in high esteem in the school.
あれは大学で重きをなしている先生だ
He is an esteemed professor at the university.
あの人は世に重きをなしている
He stands high in the public estimation.

content: 〈形〉Heavy; weighty; important

content.content: 国家の為に国民の教育より重きは無い
Nothing can be more important to the State than the education of the people.

おもくるしい〔重苦しい〕
〈形〉Heavy (food); ponderous (style); cumbersome (overcoat); cumbrous (luggage); lumbering (coach); burdensome (taxation); oppressive (air); leaden (feet); clumsy (expression); gloomy (weather, etc.)

content:
おもさ〔重さ〕
〈名〉Weight

content.content: 六インチ砲弾の重さは百ポンドある
A 6-inch shell weighs 100 pounds.
重さを量る
to weigh anything
手で重さを量る
to heft anything

content:
おもざし〔面差〕
〈名〉A face; features

content.content: 彼女は面差はお母さんそっくりだ
Her face is her mother's to a hair.

content:
おもし〔重し〕
〈名〉A weight

content.content: 重しをする
to put a weight on anything―weight anything
あの人は重しが利く
He is a man of weight―He has weight with his subordinates.

content:
おもしろい〔面白い〕
〈形〉［注意］この言葉には二つの訳し方がある。
〈主観的動詞〉To enjoy (a game); to be interested (in a book); to be amused (at or by or with anything); to delight in (novels)

content.content: この本は面白い
(客観的に言えば)This book is interesting―(主観的に言えば)―I am interested in this book―I enjoy reading this book.
この本を読んで面白かった
I have enjoyed reading this book―I was interested in this book.
芝居が面白かった
I have enjoyed the play.
旅行に行って面白かった
I have enjoyed my journey.
政治は面白くない
I am not interested in politics―Politics does not interest me.
英語が面白くなってきた
I am getting interested in English.
彼は学問が面白くなってきたと見える
He seems to be getting interested in his studies.
学問が面白い
I delight in my studies―take delight in my studies.
面白く暮らす
to enjoy oneself―have a good time
昨日は面白かった
I had a good time―passed a pleasant day―yesterday.
生まれてからあんな面白い思いをしたことが無い
I never had a better time―never had a more delightful experience―in my life.
この休暇はどうして遊んだらいちばん面白いだろうか
How can I make the most of my holidays?
子どもらが面白く遊んでいる
The children are absorbed in play.
船中生活は面白いか
How do you find life on board ship?

content:
〈客観的形容詞〉
1. Interesting (book); amusing (story); entertaining (play); diverting (game); exciting (sport); enjoyable (party); pleasant (man); jolly (fellow); delightful (old man); funny (tale); merry (life); mirthful (mood); romantic (life, etc.)

content.content: この本を読んでご覧、面白いから
You will find this book interesting.
面白い本だ
It is an interesting book.
面白くない本だ
It is a dull book.
あの先生は面白い話をする
He tells us amusing stories―entertaining stories―funny stories.
面白い慰みだ
It is an entertaining pastime―a diverting amusement―an exciting sport.
面白い宴会だった
It was an enjoyable party.
先生の講議は面白くない
His lectures are uninteresting―dull.
あれは面白い人だ
He is a pleasant man.
面白い男だ
He is a jolly fellow.
面白い老人だ
He is a delightful old dear.
そりゃ面白い趣向だ
It is a good idea!―a happy idea!―a bright idea!
面白い生涯
(陽気で面白いのなら)a merry life―(変って面白いのなら)―a romantic career.
彼は面白い生涯を送った
He lived a romantic life.
きまり切った道を踏んでは面白くない
There is no romance in treading the beaten track.
人は一律にはいかない、かえって変化が有って面白いのだ
Men can not be rendered uniform; it is variety that gives interest to character.
博物館には面白い物がたくさんある
There are many objects of interest in the museum.
何か面白い物は無いか
Have you anything interesting?
面白くさえありゃ何でも好い
Anything will do so long as it is interesting.
何か面白い物を捜して上げよう
I will find you something interesting―something that will interest you.
僕は何でも面白いものを読む
I read whatever pleases my fancy.
面白い舞踏会だった
It was an enjoyable ball.
この雑誌は面白い
This magazine reads well―It is good reading.
読んで面白い
It can be read with interest.
子どもが球を奪い合うのが面白い
It is good fun―great fun―to see the boys scramble for the ball.
飛行機に乗ったら面白かろう
It must be great fun to fly on an aeroplane.
彼は面白いように(どんどん)働く
He works like fun.
そこが面白い処だ
There lies the fun of the thing.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 面白いことが始まった
Here is a game―What a game!
何か面白いことはありませんか
Is there no news?
何も面白いことはありませんね
There is no news stirring.
これは実に面白い
It is as good as a play.
非常に面白い、こんな面白いことは無い
It is as good as a play―It beats cock-fighting.
話が面白くなる(佳境に入る)
The plot thickens.
あの人は付合って面白い
He is good company.
付合ってあんな面白い人は無い
I find him the height of company.
付合って面白くない男だ
He is poor company.
彼は付合ってみるとだんだん面白くなる
He will improve on acquaintance.
この本はしまいの方になると面白くなくなる
The book drags―The interest flags―towards the end.
何事でも深く研究してみると面白い
“Go deep enough, and there is music every where.”
景色は変化が有って面白い
The scenery is diversified.
この文は変化が無くて面白くない
The style is dull and monotonous.
そこがこの遊びの面白いところだ
Therein lies the beauty of the game.

content: 2. (=奇妙)curious; singular; fantastic

content.content: この本の趣向が面白い
The book is on a curious plan.
この果物は面白い味がする
The fruit has a singular taste.
古木は面白くいじけている
The old trunk is gnarled and fantastic.

content: 3. (=思わしい)encouraging; satisfactory; favourable; pleasing

content.content: 形勢が面白い、面白くない
The prospects are encouraging―discouraging.
結果が面白くない
The result is discouraging―disappointing―unsatisfactory.
返事が面白くない
The answer is unfavourable.
病気が面白くなくなってきた
His illness has taken an unfavourable turn.
彼の仕打ちが面白くない
I am displeased at his conduct.

content:
おもしろおかしい〔面白可笑しい〕
〈形〉Amusing (story); diverting (game); funny (story); merry (life, etc.)

content.content: 同じことなら面白おかしく暮らす方が好い
If we must live, let us live a merry life.

content:
おもしろがる〔面白がる〕
〈他動〉To enjoy (a game); to be interested (in a book); to be amused (at or by or with something); to delight in (novels); to take delight in (one's studies); to take pleasure in (doing good)

content.content: 彼はこの本を面白がって読んでいる
He enjoys reading the book―He is interested in the book.
旅行に行ってたいそう面白がった
He enjoyed the journey very much.
皆彼の話を聞いて面白がっている
They are interested in his stories―amused at his stories.
彼は芝居を面白がる
He enjoys a play―delights in plays.
学校の学科を面白がっている
He takes delight in his studies.
彼は人を困らせて面白がっている
He takes a malicious pleasure in annoying people.
先生までも面白がって生徒といっしょになって遊ぶ
The teachers enter into the spirit of the sport.
老人はおかしな話をして子どもらを面白がらせる
The old man amuses the children by telling funny stories.

content:
おもしろさ〔面白さ〕
〈名〉Joy; enjoyment; pleasure; fun

content.content: 海上生活の面白さはこんなものさ
Such are the joys of a sailor's life.
君は読書の面白さを知るまい
Perhaps you do not know the pleasure of reading.
ここの面白さは来てみなけりゃわからん
You can form no idea of what a time we are having unless you come and see for yourself.
君は芝居の面白さがわかるか
Can you appreciate a play?
自転車の面白さを初めて知った
I have learned what fun it is to ride a bicycle.

content:
おもしろそう〔面白そう〕
〈形〉(動詞に訳して)to seem to enjoy; to seem to be interesting:(=に) with seeming enjoyment, with seeming interest; like fun; merrily

content.content: その本は面白そうだね
The book seems to be interesting―You seem to enjoy reading that book.
面白そうな遊びだ
It seems to be an exciting sport.
面白そうな人だ
He seems to be a pleasant man.
彼は面白そうに働く
He works with seeming enjoyment―He works like fun.
娘どもが面白そうに歌っている
The girls are singing merrily.

content:
おもしろはんぶんに〔面白半分に〕
〈副〉Half in fun; out of fun; for fun; for the fun of the thing

content.content: 面白半分に入会した者がある
Some joined the society half in fun.
皆 Esperanto を面白半分にやる
They learn Esperanto for the fun of the thing.

content:
おもしろみ〔面白味〕
〈名〉Interest; enjoyment

content.content: この学科は面白味がある
The subject is interesting―full of interest.
面白味が無い
It is uninteresting―devoid of interest.
この本はしまいの方へ行くと面白味が無くなる
The book drags―The interest flags―towards the end.
旅行は連れが無いと面白味が無い
Travelling lacks enjoyment without a companion.

おもたせもの〔お持たせ物〕
〈名〉A present

content:
おもだった〔重立った〕
〈形〉Chief; principal; leading; prominent

content.content: 重立った学者
the leading scholars
重立った実業家
prominent business-men
重立った会員
the chief members
重立った学科
the principal branches of study

content:
おもちゃ〔玩具〕
〈名〉
1. A toy; a plaything:(大人の玩具)a gewgaw; a kickshaw; a knicknack; a bauble

content.content: 子どもがおもちゃを弄ぶ
A child plays with a toy.
(小形の)おもちゃ犬
a toy dog
おもちゃ箱
a toy-box
おもちゃ屋
a toy-shop
人をおもちゃにする
to play with a man―flirt with a party
君はおもちゃにされたのだ
You have been played with.
彼は人が好いものだから人におもちゃにされる
He is so good-natured that people play with him.
人におもちゃにされるな
Do not suffer yourself to be played with!
彼は相手をおもちゃにしている
He is playing with―flirting with―his man.
女をおもちゃにする
to make a plaything of a woman―trifle with a girl―play fast and loose with a girl
女をおもちゃにする人が多い
Many people make playthings of women―treat women as playthings.
あの人は私をおもちゃにして飽きたら捨てるのだ
He will make a plaything of me, and throw me away when he is tired of me.
人の娘をおもちゃにするとはけしからん
It is outrageous that he should trifle with a girl's feelings.
女が男をおもちゃにする
A woman fools a man―makes a fool of a man―turns or twists a man round her little finger.
あんな女にかかるとおもちゃにされるぞ
She will make a fool of you.
女におもちゃにされた
I have been made a fool of.
あの子は兄さんをおもちゃにしている
She turns him round her little finger―twists him round her little finger.
大事な物をおもちゃにする
to trifle with―palter with―fribble with―sacred things
宗教をおもちゃにするものでない
You should not trifle with religion―palter with religion.
彼は職務をおもちゃにしている
He palters with his duties―fribbles with his duties.
船が波におもちゃにされる
A ship is tossed about by the sea.

content:
おもて〔表〕
〈名〉
1. (=表面)the surface; the obverse (of a medal); the head (of a coin); the right side (of cloth)

content.content: 賞牌の表
the obverse of a medal
銭の表
the head of a coin
(裏返しじゃない)表が出してある
The right side is out.
この羅紗には裏表が有る
This cloth has its right and its wrong side.
キズは表に現れておらぬ
The flaw does not appear on the surface.

content: 2. (=外面)the outside; outward show; appearance

content.content: 上衣の表
the outside of a coat
表を張る
to keep up appearances
表を張る商売だから骨が折れる
I have much ado to keep up appearances, which are everything in this business.

content: 3. (=前面)the front

content.content: 家の表に庭がある
There is a court in front of the house.
表門
the front-door
表二階
one-pair front
表日本
the Pacific seaboard of Japan

content: 4. (=家の前の通り)the street

content.content: 表に人立ちがある
There is a crowd out in the street.
子どもが表に遊んでいる
The child is playing in the street.
家が揺れたから表へ飛び出した
I felt the house shake, and I ran out into the street.

content:
おもて〔面〕
〈名〉The face

content.content: 面を上げ
Raise your face!―Look up!
面を伏せる
to hang one's head―look down
面を振らず一直線に進んだ
He held on his course without looking right or left.
彼は感情を面に表さぬ
He betrays no emotions.
感情を面に表すまいとする
He tries to hide his emotions.
面を犯して主人を諫めた
He expostulated with his master in defiance of his anger.

content:
おもで〔重手〕
〈名〉A severe wound

content.content: 重手を負う
to sustain a severe wound―be severely wounded

content:
おもてかんばん〔表看板〕
〈名〉The picture-signboard (of a theatre):(より)an ostensible name; a mask

content.content: 酒屋を表看板にして実はばくち宿だ
He keeps a gambling-den under the mask of the wine trade.

content:
おもてぐち〔表口〕
〈名〉The front-door; the street-door

content.content: 表口から入って裏口から出た
He entered at the front-door, and went out at the back entrance.

おもてげんかん〔表玄関〕
〈名〉The front-door

content:
おもてざた〔表沙汰〕
〈名〉A public affair; a lawsuit

content.content: 表沙汰にする
to make a matter public―bring a matter before the court―go to law
どうか話がつくなら表沙汰にしたくはない
If we can come to an understanding, I do not wish to bring the matter before the court.
これが表沙汰になれば免職だ
If the matter is made public, I shall lose my place.
先方が要求を容れなければ表沙汰にするよりほか無い
If the other party will not comply with my demands, I shall be obliged to go to law.
表沙汰にしないで済ましたいものだ
I should like to have the matter settled out of court.

おもてだつ〔表立つ〕
〈自動〉To become public

content:
おもてだった〔表立った〕
〈形〉Public; open; official

content.content: 表立った処置をする
to take open measures
表立った地位を占める
to be at the front
表立った地位にいる人々
the men at the front

content:
おもてだって〔表立って〕
〈副〉In public; publicly; openly; officially

content.content: 表立って反対はせぬ
They do not oppose us openly.
表立って働く
to work in public―to be at the front
彼は表立って働かない
He keeps in the background.

content:
おもてだてる〔表立てる〕
〈他動〉To make (a matter) public; to bring (a matter) before the court

content.content: どうか話がつくなら事を表立てることは無い
If we can come to an understanding, we need not bring the matter before the court.

content:
おもてむき〔表向き〕
〈副〉In public; openly; officially; formally; ostensibly:(=の) public; open; official; formal; ostensible

content.content: 彼は表向き相続人ときまった
He has been formally decided upon as heir.
表向きの許可は無い
There is no official permission.
彼は表向きに反対はしない
He does not oppose the plan openly.
離縁というのは表向きだけ
The divorce is merely ostensible.
貧窮というのは表向きだけの理由
Poverty is only the ostensible reason.
表向きは養女実は女房
She is ostensibly an adopted daughter, but in reality a wife.
表向きにする
to make anything public―publish
この事件は表向きにできない
The affair can not be made public―published.

おもと〔万年青〕
〈名〉A pot-plant (Rhodea Japonica)

content:
おもなる〔重なる〕
〈形〉Chief; principal; leading; main

content.content: 重なる都会
the chief cities of the land
重なる市民
the principal inhabitants of the city
重なる会員
the leading members of the society
それが辞職の重なる理由である
That is the main reason why I must resign.
失敗の重なる原因は怠慢である
His negligence is the chief cause―the principal cause―of his failure.
重なる産物
the staple products of a country

content:
おもに〔重に〕
〈副〉
1. (=主として)chiefly; principally; mainly

content.content: あの店は重に外国と取引きをしている
The firm chiefly deals with foreign parts.
失敗は重に怠慢に起因する
Failure is mainly due to negligence.
人の重に勉強する動機は成功である
What principally induces men to work, is the hope of success.

content: 2. (=たいてい、たいがい)mostly; for the most part

content.content: 彼の居処はきまらないが重に東京だ
He lives nowhere in particular, but mostly in Tokyo.
生徒は重に地方から出ている
The students are, for the most part, from the provinces.

content:
おもに〔重荷〕
〈名〉A heavy load; a burden; an encumbrance

content.content: 重荷を負う
to bear a burden
重荷を負わせる
to impose a burden on one
彼は重荷に堪えない
He is sinking under his burden.
重荷を下ろす
to ease oneself of a burden―be relieved of a burden
その重荷を下ろしてやろう
I will ease you of your burden―take your burden off your shoulders.
やっと重荷を下ろした
I am relieved of my burden―The burden is off my shoulders.
心の重荷
a load on one's mind―a weight on one's mind
重荷を下ろしたような気がする
A load is off my mind―I feel relieved.
それを聞いて重荷を下ろした心地がする
You have taken a load off my mind.
家族は重荷だ
A family is an encumbrance.
彼は家族という重荷を背負っている
He is encumbered with a family.

content:
おもねる〔阿る〕
〈他動〉To flatter (people); to fawn upon (the great); to cringe to (the powerful); to pander to (the public); to truckle to (the times)

content.content: 権門におもねる
to fawn upon the great―cringe to the powerful
世におもねる
to pander to the public―truckle to the times

content:
おもみ〔重み〕
〈名〉
1. (=重量)weight

content.content: 屋根の重みが柱にかかる
The weight of the roof bears on the posts.
柱が屋根の重みに堪える
The posts bear the weight of the roof.
人の重みで桟敷が落ちた
The stand gave way beneath the people.
重みが有る、重みが無い
It is heavy―light.
重みを量る
to weigh anything

content: 2. (=事の重要さ)weight; importance

content.content: 彼の言うことは重みがある
His words carry weight―carry authority―carry conviction.
彼の意見は重みが無い
His opinions do not carry weight.
彼の意見は重みを加えてきた
His opinions have grown in weight.
日本は東洋において重みの有る地位を占めている
Japan holds an important position in the East.
東洋における日本の地位は殊に近年重きを加えてきた
Japan's position in the East has specially grown in importance of late years.

content: 3. (=人の貫目)weight of character; dignity

content.content: 彼は重みの有る人だ
He is a man of dignified presence.
重みの無い人だ
He is wanting in dignity―He lacks dignity.
若いから重みが無い
He is too young to have weight of character.

content:
おもむき〔趣き〕
〈名〉
1. (=趣意)import, purport, tenor, drift, gist (of a speech or writing); contents (of a letter); (to this or that) effect

content.content: 御書面の趣き承知仕候
I have noted the contents of your letter.
ドイツが開戦したと言う趣きの電報に接したのはこの時であった
Then it was that we received a telegram to the effect that Germany had declared war.
病気で行かれないからその趣きを言ってやった
Illness prevents my going, and I have written word to that effect.

content: 2. (=趣致)taste, elegance (of a garden, house, dress, etc.); effect (of a picture); flavor, charm, beauty (of a writing, scenery, etc.)

content.content: 趣きが有る
to be tasteful―in taste―elegant
趣きが無い
to be tasteless―out of taste―inelegant
この庭は趣きが有る
The garden is tastefully laid out―laid out in admirable taste.
趣きの有る建物だ
It is an elegant building.
この建物は趣きが無い
The building is out of taste.
あの婦人の支度は趣きが有る
She dresses in good taste.
この絵は趣きが有る
The painting has a good effect.
その場のだいたいを趣きをとらえて描く
to give the general effect―the tout ensemble―of the scene
雨の庭もまた趣き有る
A garden in the rain has a charm of its own.
訳文は原文の趣きを失わぬ
The translation retains the flavour of the original.
原文の趣きを存して翻訳することは難い
It is difficult to translate so as to preserve the original beauty.

content: 3. (=様子)look; appearance; aspect; feature

content.content: 同市は古雅の趣きを呈す
The city presents a quaint appearance.
山は樹木を切り払って一種異様な趣きを呈している
The hills, denuded of their trees, present a peculiar aspect.
ここは万事内地とは趣きを異にしている
Everything here has a different look from things at home.
あの学校は趣きを異にしている
That school presents some peculiar features.
この庭は深山幽谷の趣きが有る
This garden reminds one of mountain glens.

content:
おもむく〔赴く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=行く)to go to, repair to, proceed to (a place); to steer for, head for, make for (some point)

content.content: 本船はハワイに寄港してしかる後サンフランシスコに赴く
We touch at Hawaii, and then proceed to San Francisco.
到着するや否や大使館に赴いた
Immediately on arrival, I repaired to the Embassy.
舵機を転じて長崎に赴いた
We steered for―headed for―bore up for―Nagasaki.
火事と聞いて皆入口の方へ赴いた
At the cry of “Fire!” everybody made for the door.
任に赴く
to proceed to one's post―leave for one's new post
応援に赴く
to go to one's rescue
国家の急に赴くべし
Come to the rescue of your country!
死地に赴く
to go to certain death―go to certain destruction―ride into the jaws of death
慷慨{こうがい}死地に赴くはやすし
It is easy to die for one's cause.
心の赴くままにぶらついた
I rambled wherever my fancy led me.

content: 2. (=向かう)to tend towards, advance towards, progress towards (recovery, etc.)

content.content: 病気は快方に赴く
One's illness progresses towards recovery―takes a favorable turn―takes a turn for the better.
病人は快方に赴く
The invalid is getting better―improving in health―on the mend―on the mending hand―convalescent.
日増に快方に赴く
He daily grows better.
世は開明に赴く
The world advances in civilization.
業務は隆盛に赴く
The business grows in prosperity.
時候は寒気に赴く
It is getting colder.
この一事をもってしても風潮の赴くところは察すべきである
This one fact shows how the tide of opinion is setting.

content:
おもむろに〔徐ろに〕
〈副〉Slowly; by slow degrees; deliberately; with deliberation; patiently; with patience

content.content: おもむろに進むよりほかは無い
There is nothing for it but to advance by slow degrees.
彼はおもむろに筆を取って文字を消した
He deliberately took a pen and struck out the word.
おもむろに時機を待つよりほかは無い
There is nothing for it but to bide our time with patience.
彼は勢力を扶植しつつおもむろに時機の到るを待った
He patiently bided his time, taking care to extend his influence at the same time.

content:
おももち〔面持〕
〈名〉Look, countenance; expression of countenance

content.content: 彼はけげんな面持ちで相手の顔を見た
He looked at his companion with a dubious look.

おもや〔母屋〕
〈名〉The main house; the main building

おもゆ〔重湯〕
〈名〉Rice-gruel (clear from grains)

content:
おもり〔錘〕
〈名〉(分銅)a weight:(垂線の錘)a plumb:(垂線、測鉛の錘)a plummet:(釣糸の錘)a sinker

content.content: 糸に錘を付ける
to weight a line

content:
おもる〔重る〕
〈自動〉To become heavy; to grow serious

content.content: 病気が重る
One's illness grows serious―takes a serious turn.

content:
おもわく〔思惑〕
〈名〉
1. (=思うところ)thought; intention; wish; mind; heart; fancy

content.content: 思惑通りだ
It is as I thought.
思惑通りの人だ
He is a man after my own heart.
思惑通りの家が無い
I can not find a house after my fancy.
思惑通りになった
I have my wish―I have realized my wishes.
思惑がはずれた、思惑違いだ
I am out in my reckoning.

content: 2. (=内証の目的)private ends; some end in view; an ulterior aim

content.content: あれはなにか思惑が有ってしたことだ
He did it to gain some private ends.
あの人が面前で人を賞める時はなにか思惑がある(から後が怖い)
When he praises you to your face, he has some end in view―some ulterior aim―an axe to grind.

content: 3. (=投機)speculation

content.content: 思惑買い
speculative purchase―buying bull―buying long
思惑買いをする
to buy on spec

content:
おもわしい〔思わしい〕
〈形〉Satisfactory; desirable; to one's taste; after one's fancy

content.content: どうも思わしい結果が出ない
I can not get a satisfactory result.
思わしい本が無い
I can not find a book to my taste.
思わしい家が無い
I can not find a house after my fancy.
思わしい品が無い
I can not find a desirable article―an article that will do.
仕事が思わしくはかどらない
The work does not make satisfactory progress.

content:
おもわしくない〔思わしくない〕
〈形〉Unsatisfactory; discouraging; disappointing; unfavourable

content.content: 結果が思わしくない
The result is unsatisfactory―discouraging―disappointing.
病気の経過が思わしくない
His illness has taken an unfavourable turn.
仕事はよいが条件が思わしくない
The work is all right, but the terms are not satisfactory―not what I could wish.

content:
おもわず〔思わず〕
〈副〉Involuntarily; unconsciously; in spite of oneself

content.content: 思わず吹き出した
I laughed in spite of myself.
雄弁に感じて思わず喝采した
The speech was so eloquent that I involuntarily applauded.
その話に気を取られて思わず知らず乗り出して聴いておった
The story interested me so much that I was unconsciously leaning forward to listen.

おもわすれ〔面忘れ〕
〈名〉Failure to recognize:(=する) to fail to recognize (one's acquaintance)

content:
おもわせぶり〔思わせ振り〕
〈名〉Mystification:(女なら)coquetry:(=する) to feign mystery; to mystify (one); to hoax (one); to coquette; to play the coquette

content.content: 思わせぶりは止し給え
You are mystifying me.
あの人は思わせぶりをすることが好きだ
He likes to feign mystery―He affects mystery.
あれは思わせぶりをする女だ
She is a coquette.
思わせぶりをしているのだ
She is playing the coquette.
奴ちょっと思わせぶりをやっているのだ
He is trying to hoax us.

content:
おもわせる〔思わせる〕
〈他動〉To make (one) think of (anything); to remind (one of anything); to put (one) in mind of (anything); to suggest (anything) to one's mind

content.content: お前の食い方は豚を思わせる
You make me think of a pig―remind me of a pig―put me in mind of a pig.
蛮人の酋長を思わせるような顔をしている
His face suggests a savage chief to your mind―His face is suggestive of a savage chief.

content:
おもわれぬ〔思われぬ〕
〈自動〉Can not

content.content: これは本当とは思われぬ
This can not be true.
人間業とは思われない
It can not be the work of man.
真人間の仕業とは思われぬ
It can not be the doing of a man in his senses.

content:
おもわれる〔思われる〕
〈被動〉To be thought (of)

content.content: 誰でも人に好く思われたい(のは人情だ)
Everybody wishes to be well thought of.
彼は学者だと思われたがっている
He wishes to be thought of as a scholar―be regarded as a scholar.

content:
〈自動〉
1. To seem; to appear; to strike (one as something); to impress (one as something)

content.content: 彼は偉い人のように思われる
He seems (to me) to be a great man―He has impressed me as a great man.
この評判は本当のように思われる
The report appears to be true.
彼の様子が変に思われる
His appearance strikes me as strange.

content: 2. (=どうもそう思われる)to have reason to, have every reason to (think, believe, suspect, etc.)

content.content: この論文を書いたのはどうもあの人じゃないかと思われる
I have reason to think―have every reason to think―that he is the author of the article.
どうも他殺のように思われる
There is reason to believe―every reason to believe―that violent hands have been laid on him.
どうもうあの男が怪しいと思われる
I have reason to suspect that man.

content:
おもんずる〔重んずる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=尊重する)to respect (the laws); to reverence (the Throne); to have a regard for (truth); to value, set a value on (one's profession); to esteem (one's abilities); to hold (learning) in esteem; to consider (a person); to value, prize, esteem (one thing above another)

content.content: 法律を重んずる
to respect the laws―have a regard for the laws
皇室を重んずる
to reverence the Throne
人の個性を重んずる
to respect one's personality
真実を重んずる(虚言を吐かぬ)
to have a regard for truth
彼は真実を重んぜぬ(平気で嘘を吐く)
He has no regard for truth.
人の感情を重んずる
to have a regard for one's feelings
彼は人の感情を重んぜぬ(感情を害することを言う、がみがみ言う)
He has no regard for others' feelings.
学問を重んずる
to hold learning in esteem
我が国では学問を重んずる
Learning is held in high esteem in our country.
職業を重んずる
to set a value on one's profession
人は己が専門を重んじ過ぎる傾向がある
One is apt to set too high a value upon―overrate―overestimate―one's profession.
言責を重んずる
to have a regard for the virtue of the spoken word
彼は友人間に重んじられている
He is esteemed by his friends―highly considered by his friends.
武士は生命よりも名を重んずる
The samurai values honour above life.
英国人は生命よりも自由を重んずる
The English prize liberty above life―put liberty before life.
世人は肩書よりも実力を重んずるようになった
People have come to esteem real ability above titles.

content: 2. (=大事にする)to make account of (a man); to make much of (one's birth); to think much of (one's honour); to set store by (one's riches); to lay great store on (one's wealth); to take good care of (one's health); to be careful of (one's health); to attach importance to (credit); to be jealous of (one's honour); to have a high sense of (honour); to have a deep sense of (responsibility); to be true to (one's trust or cause)

content.content: 彼は家柄を重んずる
He makes much of his birth―thinks much of his birth.
僕は彼の友情を重んずる
I set store by his friendship.
僕は名利を重んぜぬ
I do not set store by wealth or fame.
名誉を重んずる
to think much of one's honour―be jealous of one's honour
信用を重んずる
to attach importance to credit
実業界において最も重んずべきものは信用である
Credit is the most important thing in business.
信義を重んずる
to be faithful
軍人は信義を重んずべし
A soldier should be faithful unto death.
彼は責任を重んずる
He has a deep sense of responsibility―He is true to his trust.
彼は責任を重んじて職に殉じた
True to his trust, he died at his post.
義を重んずる
He has a high sense of honour―He is true to his cause.
義を重んじ身を軽んずる
He holds his life at nothing as compared with his cause.
徳を養い義を重んず
Be virtuous and honourable!
身体を重んずる
to be careful of one's health

content:
おもんぱかり〔慮り〕
〈名〉
1. (=思慮)thought; consideration; prudence

content.content: 遠き慮り有れば近き憂い無し
Prudence averts danger―“A danger foreseen is half avoided.”
遠き慮り無ければ近き憂い有り
Imprudence courts danger.

content:
2. (=懸念)fears; apprehensions
3. (=処理)management
4. (=謀計)strategy

おもんぱかる〔慮る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=熟考する)to consider

content.content: 将来を慮る
to take thought for the morrow―be thoughtful of the future
遠く慮る
to be prudent―use prudence

content: 2. (=気遣う)to fear; to apprehend

content.content: 安寧秩序を慮る
to fear for peace and order―be apprehensive for law and order

content:
3. (=処理する)to manage
4. (=謀計をめぐらす)to devise a stratagem

おもんみる〔惟る〕
〈自動〉To consider; to reflect

content.content: つくづく惟るに国家の為国民の教育より重きは無し
On careful consideration, I find that nothing can be more important to the State than the education of the people.

content:
おや
〈間投詞〉Dear me!; Bless me!; Mercy on me!; O my!; My eye!

content.content: おやおや
Goodness gracious me!
おやまぁ
La!―Well, I never!
おや、もう十二時だ
Dear me! It is twelve already.

content:
おや〔親〕
〈名〉
1. (両親)one's parents:(片親)a parent:(父親)a father:(母親)a mother:(=の) parental; paternal; maternal

content.content: 彼の親はわからない
His parentage is unknown.
生みの親
one's true parents
育ての親
one's adoptive parents
生みの親より育ての親
Those who brought me up are dearer to me than those who only brought me forth.
親が大事だ
My parents are dear to me.
親に孝を尽す
to be dutiful to one's parents
親に孝行をせよ
Be a good son―Be a good daughter.
彼(女)は親孝行だ
He is a good son―She is a good daughter.
孝行をしたい時には親は無い
When I wish to show myself a good son, my parents are no more.
子どもは親に養って貰う
Children depend on their parents for support.
子を養うは親の義務
It is a parental duty to provide for one's children.
西洋では子が親を養う義務は無い
In foreign countries, it does not lie upon the son to provide for his aged parents.
親の膝下を辞す
to bid adieu to one's paternal roof
親の死に目に逢う
to attend one's father's deathbed
親に先立つ不孝の罪をゆるし給え
Forgive this undutiful child who goes to a better place before his parents!
親譲りの身代
a patrimony―a heritage
親の財産を当てにする
to wait for a dead man's shoes
まだ親の脛をかじっているのか
Are you still dependent on your father?
親の威光
one's father's influence―parental authority
日本では親の威光が強い
The Japanese father has great authority over his children.
彼は親の威光で出世したのだ
He has risen through his father's influence―He owes his advancement to his father's influence.
親の威光を笠に着る
to shelter oneself under one's father's influence
彼は親の威光を笠に着てわがままを仕尽している
He has everything his own way under the shelter of his father's influence.
親の威光を笠に着るものでない
You should stand upon your own merits.
三千世界に子を持った親の心は皆一つ
Universal is parental love.
親の心子知らず
No child knows how dear he is to his parents.
子を持って知る親の恩
No man knows what he owes to his parents till he comes to have children of his own.
子に引かされる親心
The parent yearns after the child.
子は親に似る
Like begets like.
この親にしてこの子あり
Like father, like son―The son is worthy of the father.
親を見習う子
“As the old cock crows, the young cock learns.”
親は無くとも子は育つ
“Nature is a good mother.”
親知らず子知らず
“Everybody for himself, and God for us all.”
この子を親のように世話をしよう
I will be a father to the child.
第二の親となれ
Be a second father to the child!
親に苦労をかけて親の寿命を縮める
to bring one's father's gray hairs to the grave
親の頸に縄をかける奴だ
He will involve his father in disgrace.
親の因果が子に報う
The father's sins are visited on the children.
主人と親には勝てぬ
“It is hard to kick against the pricks.”
親ばか
It is a wise father who knows his own child.
子を見ること親に如かず
The father is the best judge of the child.
親の慾目、親の贔屓目
“Everybody thinks his geese are swans.”
筍親勝り
“A black hen will lay a while egg.”
君は僕にとっては命の親だ
You are the preserver of my life―I owe you my life.
君は僕にとっては出世の親だ
I owe you everything in life―You have made me what I am―You have been the making of me.
彼を親のように思う
I feel towards him as if he were my father.
親無し子
an orphan
親達
the old folks
親兄弟
one's nearest relations―natural guardians

content: 2. (=ばくちの親)the banker

content.content: 親をつぶす
to break the bank

content: 3. (=トランプの親)the dealer

content.content: 今度は誰が親ですか
Whose deal is it?

content:
おやおもい〔親思い〕
〈名〉One who loves one's parents

content.content: この子は親思いです
She loves her mother.

content:
おやがかり〔親掛かり〕
〈名〉Dependence on one's father

content.content: まだ親がかりだから身が自由にならない
I am still dependent on my father, and not my own master.

content:
おやかぜ〔親風〕
〈名〉A parental air

content.content: 親風を吹かせる
to assume a parental air

content:
おやかた〔親方〕
〈名〉Governor; boss

content.content: 親方内か(在宅か)
Governor in?

おやかぶ〔親株〕
〈名〉
1. (=母樹)a stool
2. (=株式の親株)the parent stock

おやかましゅう〔お喧しう〕
〈謝辞〉Excuse me for disturbing you! I am sorry to have disturbed you

おやきょうだい〔親兄弟〕
〈名〉One's nearest relation; one's natural guardians

おやぎんこう〔親銀行〕
〈名〉The parent bank

content:
おやく〔お役〕
〈名〉Use; service

content.content: お役に立つ
to prove useful―prove of service―stand one in stead
女房悦べ、忰がお役に立ったぞや
Rejoice, wife, our boy has proved of service to his lord.
彼もお役に立ったか(戦死)
He has proved of service to his country.
覚えて置いた英語がお役に立った
My English has stood me in good stead.
私でお役に立つなら幸いです
I shall be happy to be of service to you.

content:
おやくめ〔お役目〕
〈名〉Perfunctory performance:(=的) perfunctory

content.content: お役目に仕事をする
to do perfunctory work
葬式をお役目的に済ました
The funeral was gone through in a perfunctory manner.
あの学校の授業はお役目的だ
They teach perfunctorily at that school.

content:
おやこ〔親子〕
〈名〉Parent and child; father and son; mother and daughter

content.content: 親子の情
parental affection―family ties
親子の情として打ち捨て置くことはできない
My parental affection forbids my leaving him alone.
親子は一世
The relation of parent and child lasts only for one existence.
揃いも揃った親子だ
Like father, like son.
親子力を合わして成就した
It was accomplished by the united efforts of father and son.

content:
おやこうこう〔親孝行〕
〈名〉Filial piety; dutifulness to one's parents:(=する) to be dutiful to one's parents:(=な) dutiful, good (son or daughter)

content.content: 彼(女)は親孝行だ
He is a dutiful son―a good son―She is a dutiful daughter―a good daughter.
俺に代わって親孝行してくれ
Be a good son to them in my place!

content:
おやごころ〔親心〕
〈名〉Parental love

content.content: 子に引かさるる親心
The parent yearns after the child.

おやころし〔親殺し〕
〈名〉(事)parricide:(母親なら)matricide:(人)a parricide; a matricide

おやざと〔親里〕
〈名〉One's parents' house

content:
おやじ〔親父〕
〈名〉
1. (=父親)father; pater

content.content: 僕も親父になってしまった
I have become a father.
親父の息子だ
He is a chip of the old block.
貴様は親父をばかにする気か
Dare you set your father's authority at naught?

content: 2. (=老爺)an old man; a patriarch

content.content: 頑固親父だ
He is an opinionated old man.
やかましい親父だ
He is a rigid disciplinarian.
旧弊親父だ
He is an old fogey―an antediluvian.
田舎親父
a gaffer

おやしお〔親潮〕
〈固名〉The Kurile Current

おやしらず〔親知らず〕
〈名〉(=歯)A wisdom-tooth

content:
おやしらずこしらず〔親知らず子知らず〕
〈熟語〉Everybody for himself, and God for us all

content.content: すわという時は親知らず子知らずだ
In the moment of peril, it is “Everybody for himself!”

content:
おやすい〔お易い〕
〈形〉Easy

content.content: お易いご用です
It is no trouble at all.

It is a case of true love beyond price.

お休みなさい
Good night!―(I wish you) Sweet dreams!

そんなことをする奴はばかの親玉だ
Such a man would be the greatest fool in the world.

He is a bad son―an unnatural son.

親不孝声を出す
to yell

content.content: この子は親勝りだ
This child is a white egg laid by a black hen―The boy has outdone his father.
筍親勝り
“A black hen will lay a white egg.”

おやみ〔小止み〕

content.content: 親許はしっかりしている
He is of good parentage.
親許を離れる
to bid adieu to one's paternal roof
嫁が親許へ帰っている
She has gone home to her parents.
嫁を親許へ引き取った
The bride was taken back by her parents.

〈名〉Inheritance; heredity:(=の) inherited; hereditary

an inheritance―a heritage―a patrimony
彼の天才は親譲りだ
His genius is hereditary.
あの癖は親譲りだ
He has inherited the fault from his father.

content:

content.content: 親指でまむしをこしらえる
to throw one's thumb out of joint
親指の腹
the ball of the thumb

content:
およぎ〔泳ぎ〕
〈名〉Swimming

content.content: 泳ぎ方
how to swim
君は泳ぎ方を知っているか
Do you know how to swim?
今泳ぎ方の稽古中だ
I am learning how to swim.
泳ぎ方を教えて上げよう
I will teach you how to swim―show you how to swim.
彼は泳ぎ方が上手だ
He is good at swimming―He is a good swimmer―He swims well.
仰向き泳ぎする
to swim on one's back
立ち泳ぎする
to tread the water
泳ぎくら
a swimming match
泳ぎ場
a watering-place―a swimming-pool

content:
およぐ〔泳ぐ〕
〈自動〉To swim

content.content: 水を泳ぐ
to swim in the water
彼はよく泳ぐ
He swims well―swims like a cork.
よく泳ぐ者はよく溺る
“Good swimmers are the oftenest drowned.”
ひとつ泳ごうじゃないか
Let us have a swim!―Let us go for a swim!
河を泳いで越す
to swim across a river
馬を泳がして河を渡る
to swim a horse across the river
泳ぎ着く
to swim to a point
泳いで行けるか
Can you swim it?
泳いで来られんか
Can't you swim it?

content:
およそ〔凡そ〕
〈副〉
1. (=博く)all(この意味の場合は次に冠詞、代名詞を置かず)

content.content: およそ人たるものは尽すべき義務あり
All men have their duties.
およそ生なるものは活動なり
All life is an activity.
およそ人間でこのことを為し遂げた者は未だ曾て無い
No mortal has ever accomplished this.
およそ世界に海風ほど清いものは無い
Nothing in the world can be purer than sea-air.
およそ世界に日本ほど景色の好い国はあるまい
No country in the world can be more beautiful than Japan.

content: 2. (=ざっと、殆ど)roughly; approximately; about; in round numbers

content.content: およそ一万
about ten thousand―10,000 in round numbers
会する者およそ一万
These who gathered may be roughly estimated at 10,000―They gathered to the number of 10,000.

content:
およばずながら〔及ばず乍ら〕
〈副〉To the best of one's poor ability

content.content: 及ばずながらご尽力申そう
I will do what (little) I can for you―exert myself to the best of my poor ability in your behalf―use what (little) influence I have in yous behalf.
及ばずながら応分の寄付を致します
I will give what (little) I can toward the expenses―give my mite towards the expenses.
及ばずながらご助力しよう
I will render you what (little) aid is in my power.

content:
およばぬ〔及ばぬ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=達せぬ)not to come up to (the mark); fall short of (some standard)

content.content: 結果は予想に及ばぬ
The result does not come up to my expectations―falls short of my expectations.

content: 2. (=匹敵せぬ)to be no match for (the other); (it) is not so good as (the other)

content.content: 力では君に及ばない
I am no match for you in strength―I am not so strong as you are.
遠く及ばない
I am not a patch upon you―I am not nearly so strong as you are―I am nothing like as strong as you are―I am far behind you in strength.
少し及ばない
I am not quite so strong as you are.
彼は英語では君に及ばない
He is no match for you in English.
学問では遠く兄に及ばない
He is not nearly so good a scholar as his brother―nothing like as good a scholar as his brother―not a patch upon his brother in scholarship―far behind his brother in scholarship.
器量は遠く姉に及ばぬ
She is not nearly so beautiful as her sister―nothing like as beautiful as her sister―not a patch upon her sister in beauty―far behind her sister in beauty.
彼女は親身も及ばぬ世話をしてくれた
She cared for me better than my own people could have done.
親身も及ばないお世話になりました
You have been better to me than my own people could have been.

content: 3. (=範囲外なり)to be beyond (one's power); to be above (one's means); to be past (cure); to baffle (description); to defy (calculation); to beggar (description)

content.content: 彼を助けることは僕の力に及ばぬ
It is beyond my power to save him.
そんなぜいたくは僕の力に及ばぬ
Such extravagance is beyond my reach―I can not afford such extravagance.
この病人を治すことは人力に及ばぬ
The invalid is beyond human help―past the help of man.
その光景の美なること筆にも口にも及ばない
The sight is beautiful beyond description―The beauty of the sight beggars description―baffles description―defies description.
その壮絶なることは想像も及ばぬ
The sublimity is above conception―One can not conceive how sublime it is―One can form no idea of its sublimity.
いまさら悔いても及ばぬことだ
Regrets will not mend matters―“It is no use crying over spilt milk.”
及ばぬ恋をする
to aspire to one's hand
彼は主人の娘に及ばぬ恋をした
He aspired to the hand of his master's daughter.
是非に及ばぬ
There is no help for it―There is no alternative.
待てとあれば是非に及ばぬ
If I must wait, there is no help for it.

content: 〈助動詞〉(=必要無し)need not

content.content: 貧は恥じるに及ばぬ
You need not be ashamed of your poverty.
急ぐに及ばぬ
You need not make haste―(を通例)―There is no occasion for haste.
言い訳には及ばぬ
You need not excuse yourself―There is need of an apology.
医者には及ばぬ
There is no need of a doctor.
それには及ばぬ
There is no need of that.
言うに及ばぬ(言うにや及ぶ)
I need not say―It is needless to say―It goes without saying―that...
なにも憚るには及ばぬ
Why should I fear?―There is no reason why I should fear.
なにも死ぬには及ばぬ
Why should you die?―There is no reason why you should die.
騒ぐに及ばず
You need not be alarmed―There is no cause for alarm.

content:
およびがない〔及びが無い〕
〈形〉Beyond one's power

content.content: そんなぜいたくは及びが無い
Such extravagance is beyond my reach―I can not afford such extravagance.
おしよろ高島
Oshoro, Takashima lie
及びも無いが
Far, far beyond my reach;
せめてうたすつ
Let me, at least, to Utasutsu go
磯谷まで
Or to Isoya's beach!

およびごしになる〔及び腰になる〕
〈自動〉To reach over (without moving from one's place)

content:
およびもつかぬ〔及びも付かぬ〕
〈形〉Beyond one's power

content.content: そんな贅沢は及びもつかぬ
Such extravagance is beyond my reach―I can not afford such extravagance.

content:
およぶ〔及ぶ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=達する)to come up to (some standard); to extend to (some limit); to stretch to (some limit)

content.content: 結果は予想に及ばぬ
The result does not come up to my expectations―falls short of my expectations.
過激派の影響は支那に及んでいる
The influence of Bolshevism extends to China.
キリスト教の感化は教外国に及んでいる
The influence of Christianity extends beyond its pale.
同盟罷工は下女下男に及んだ
The strikes extended to the servants.
日本の領土は熱帯地方に及んでいる
Japanese possession stretch to the tropics.
この線の延長は一千マイルに及んでいる
The line extends to a length of 1,000 miles.
密談三時間に及ぶ
The closet consultation lasted three hours.
聖恩枯骨に及ぶ
Posthumous honours are conferred on the dead.
過ぎたるは及ばざるが如し
“Too much is as bad as too little.”

content: 2. (=到る)to come to (something); to happen to (one)

content.content: 事ここに及ぶ
Things have come to this.
事ここに及んでは策の施すべきもの無し
Things having come to this, there is nothing to be done.
災難が身に及ぶ
A calamity happens to one―befalls one.
談種々の事に及ぶ
The conversation turned on various topics.
談たまたま教育の事に及ぶ
The conversation happened to turn on education.
議論に及ぶ
to argue a point with one―join issue with one's opponent
殿中刃傷に及んだ
He shed blood in the palace.
けしからぬ挙動に及んだ
He took liberties with her.
落花狼藉に及ぶ
to deflower a maiden―seduce a woman
支度に及べ
Make preparations!
その時に及んで
at that moment
いざ出発という時に及んで病気になった
He fell ill at the moment of departure.
いよいよという時に及んで挫折した
He faltered at the last moment―at the supreme moment.
この場に及んで後へは退けぬ
I can not recede at the eleventh hour.
調査するに及んで多くの誤りを発見した
On investigation, many errors were discovered.
彼と会見するに及んで知人なりしことを知った
On seeing him, I found him to be an old acquaintance.

content: 3. (=匹敵する)to equal (the other); to match (the other); to be a match for (the other); to compare with (the other)

content.content: 英語では彼に及ぶ者が無い
He has no equal in English―No one can compare with him in English.
彼の足下にも及ぶ者が無い
No one can hold a candle to him.→『およばぬ〔及ばぬ〕』

content: 4. (=範囲内にある)to be within (one's power); to lie in (one's power)

content.content: 力に及ぶ限り
as far as one can―to the best of one's ability
及ぶ限り力を尽そう
I will exert myself to the best of my ability―exert myself to the utmost―do all I can―do all that lies in my power―do all that in me lies―do the utmost in my power―do my best.
力に及ぶ限りの手段を尽した
I have tried every means in my power.→『およばぬ〔及ばぬ〕』

content: 5. (=何々するに及ばぬ)→『

content.content: およばぬ〔及ばぬ〕

content:
およぼす〔及ぼす〕
〈他動〉To extend (benefits to people); to exert (an influence on people)

content.content: 博愛衆に及ぼす
to extend one's charity to all mankind
人に恩沢を及ぼす
to extend benefits to others
欧州大戦は世界中に影響を及ぼした
The European war has exerted an influence on the whole world.
天候は米価に影響を及ぼす
The weather affects the price of rice.
キリスト教は教外国に感化を及ぼしている
Christianity has exerted its influence beyond its pale.
風教に悪影響を及ぼすような活動写真は禁じてある
Such films are prohibited as have harmful influence on public morals.
生命に危険を及ぼす
to endanger life―imperil life―jeopardize life
そんな処置をしては国家に危険を及ぼす
Such measures will endanger the State―bring the State into danger.
他人に累を及ぼす
to implicate others in trouble―involve others in trouble
銀行が破産すると多くの人に累を及ぼす
If a bank fails, many people are involved in the loss―The failure of a bank involves many people in the loss.
あの銀行の破産はいまなお多くの人に累を及ぼしている
The failure of that bank is still exerting a baleful influence on many people―still blighting many lives.
失恋は人の生涯に累を及ぼすことがある
Disappointment in love sometimes has an evil effect on one's whole life―blights one's life―blasts one's life.
朝鮮は累を我が国に及ぼすこと無しとせず
Korea may prove a drag upon Japan.
朝鮮の経営は累を国庫に及ぼしている
The administration of Korea has proved a drain upon the Treasury.

およる
〈自動〉To go to bed

to offer one's congratulations
お悦び申上げます
I offer my congratulations―I wish you joy.
このたびは高等学校に御入学の由御悦び申上候
Allow me to congratulate you on your successful entrance to the High School.

a Dutchman―(総称すれば)―the Dutch
オランダ語

オランダ芹

content:
おらんだ〔和蘭<オランダ>〕
〈固名〉Holland; the Netherlands; the Low Countries

content.content: オランダ人
a Dutchman―(総称すれば)―the Dutch
オランダ語
(the) Dutch (language)
オランダ苺
the strawberry
オランダ三つ葉
the celery
オランダ芹
the parsley
オランダげんげ
the clover

the carnation

content:
おり〔織〕
〈名〉A textile fabric

content.content: これは何織か
What fabric is this?

content:
おり〔折り〕
〈名〉
1. (=際)an occasion; a juncture; a time:(接続詞に用いれば)when

content.content: あの人には大阪へ行った折り初めて逢った
I made his acquaintance when I was in Osaka.
その折りも彼に注意しておいた
I warned him of the danger on that occasion.
この折りも彼は相変らず酔っておった
He was drunk as usual on the present occasion.
このめでたい折りにそんな縁起でもないことを言うな
You must not croak on this festive occasion.
折りを見て彼に話しておこう
I shall find occasion―take occasion―to speak to him.
この折りを利用して彼に話しておこう
I shall take this occasion to speak to him.
折りを見はからって言わなけりゃいかん
You must time your remark well.
彼は折りさえ有れば英語を練習する
He takes every occasion―loses no occasion―to practise English.
物事には折りがある
There is a time for everything.
折りに触れて
on occasion
彼は折りに触れて詩を作る
He writes poems on occasion.
折りに触れての作
an occasional piece
折り好く彼は在宅であった
Fortunately,―As good luck would have it,―I found him at home.
折り悪しく僕は不在であった
Unfortunately,―As ill luck would have it,―I was away from home.
君の言は折りが好かった、折りが悪かった
Your remark was well timed―ill timed.
僕の到着したのは折りも折り上を下への混雑の際であった
I arrived at a time when the house was topsyturvy.
折りも折りとてちょうどにその人が来ておった
As good luck would have it, the man happened to be with me.
折りも折りとて僕はちょうどに不在であった
As ill luck would have it, I happened to be away from home.
折りも折りとてゆっくり話もできなかった
I was at a juncture when we could not talk at our leisure.

content: 2. (=機会)an opportunity; a chance; a time

content.content: 君は英語を話す折りが有るか
Have you any opportunities to speak English?
そんな折りはほとんど無い
I have few opportunities to do so.
折りが有れば英語を話す
I speak English when I get a chance.
折りが有るごとに英語を話すことにしている
I make it a rule to speak English whenever I get a chance.
折りの有り次第に彼に話しておこう
I will speak to him on the first opportunity―as occasion serves.
そのうちに折りがあるだろう
It will not be long before an opportunity presents itself―an opportunity occurs―an opportunity offers.
折りを待つことにしよう
I shall wait for an opportunity―watch for a chance―bide my time.
これは又と無い折りだ
We shall never have such another opportunity―Now is the time, or never!
こんな好い折りを取り逃がしてはならぬ
We must not miss this opportunity―let slip this opportunity―lose this chance.

content: 3. (=折箱)a chip-box

content.content: 折詰め
food packed in a chip-box

content: 4. (=折ること)folding

content.content: 二つ折りの本
a folio
四つ折りの本
a quarto
八つ折りの本
an octavo
十二折りの本
a duodecimo
三十二折りの本
thirty-two-mo

content:
おり〔檻〕
〈名〉
1. (猛獣を入れる檻)a cage:(牛を入れる檻)a pen:(羊を入れる檻)a fold; a sheepfold:(牛馬を入れ、又は野獣を追い込む檻)a corral:(豚を入れる檻)a sty; a pig-sty:(放れ馬や放れ牛を収監する官設の檻)a pound

content.content: 檻に入れた獅子
a caged lion
牛を檻に入れる
to pen cattle
羊を檻に入れる
to fold sheep
放れ牛を檻に入れる
to impound a stray cow

content:
2. (=獄舎)a prison
3. (=獄房)a cell

おり〔滓〕
〈名〉(酒などのおり)dregs; lees; draff:(珈琲などのおり)grounds:(沈澱したおり)sediment; settlings:(蒸発して残ったおり)residuum

content.content: おりを立てる
to disturb the sediment

content:
おりあい〔折合い〕
〈名〉
1. (=交際関係)Social relations

content.content: 君はあの連中と折合いはどうか
What are your social relations with that set?―How do you get on with that set?
折合いが好い
I get on very well with them―I agree with them―I hit it off with them―We get on very well together.
新校長は教員との折合いはどうか
How does the new principal get on with the teachers?
折合いが悪い
He can't get on with them―He can't agree with them―They can't get on together―They don't pull together―They don't hit it off together.
彼は他の教員と折合いの悪いために止めたのだ
He has left owing to a disagreement with the other teachers.

content: 2. (=話し合い、妥協)agreement; understanding; compromise

content.content: 折合いが付く
to come to an agreement―come to an understanding―come to terms
どうしても折合いが付かない
We can not come to an agreement―We have failed to arrive at an understanding.
折合いを付ける
to compromise the matter―adjust the matter
とうか折合いが付かないものか
Can't we compromise the matter in some way?
折合い値段
the agreed price

content:
おりあう〔折合う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=仲良く付合う)to agree with, get on with (some one); to get on together; to pull together; to hit it off (together―with some one)

content.content: 今度の先生は他の先生と折合わない
The new teacher can not agree with―can not get on with―the others.
教員室が折合わない
They can't get on together―don't pull together―don't hit it off together.
労働者と金主が折合わぬ
The labourer is at variance―at odds―at loggerheads―with the capitalist.
あんな邪推深い人とは折合いにくい
There is no living with such a suspicious man.

content: 2. (=折合いが付く)to agree; to come to an agreement; to come to an understanding; to come to terms; to compromise (with one); to meet (one) half-way; to split the difference

content.content: どうしても折合わない
We have failed to arrive at an understanding.
値段が折合わない
We can not agree about the terms―come to an agreement about the terms.
先方と折合いが付いた
We have come to an understanding―We have come to terms―We have compromised with the other party―They have met us half-way.
(十五円に売る、十円に買おう)折合って十二円五十銭ではどうか
Suppose we split the difference, and make it \12.50.

content:
おりあしき〔折悪しき〕
〈形〉
1. (=時宜を得ざる)ill-timed; untimely; unseasonable; inopportune

content.content: 干渉が折悪かった
The interference was ill-timed.

to thank one―offer one's thanks―tender one's thanks―return one thanks―express one's thanks―express one's gratitude―acknowledge a favour
君にお礼を言わなければならぬ
I must thank you―I owe you thanks.
厚くお礼を申し上げます

content.content: 卸し並みに願います
You shall have it at wholesale price.

おろしね〔卸し値〕
〈名〉Wholesale price; trade-price

content:
おろす〔下ろす、卸す、降す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=高い処から下ろす)to lower; to take down; to bring down; to let down

content.content: ボートを下ろす
to lower a boat
帆を下ろす
to lower a sail―douse a sail―strike sail
旗を下ろす
to lower a flag―(ちょいと下ろしてまた揚げる)―dip a flag―(降参のしるしなら)―strike one's colours
天幕を下ろす
to strike a tent
錨を下ろす
to cast anchor―drop anchor
簾を下ろす
to let down a blind―draw down a blind
網を下ろす
to lower a net―dip a net―let out a net
梯子を下ろす
to let down a ladder
棚から本を下ろす
to take down a book from a shelf―(全部なら)―remove the books off the shelves

content: 2. (=荷を下ろす)to discharge (a cargo―a ship of her cargo); to unload (a ship or a cart); to disburden, unburden (one of a load); to ease, relieve (one of one's burden); to lighten (a ship of her cargo)

content.content: 船は積荷を下ろしている
The ship is discharging her cargo―discharging freight.
船の積荷を下ろす
to unload a ship―discharge a ship of her cargo―lighten a ship of her cargo
船は積荷を下ろさなけりゃ浮かない
The ship must be lightened of her cargo before she can float.
戦闘艦は重砲を下ろさなければ運河は通れぬ
A battleship must be lightened of her heavy guns before she can pass through the canal.
車の荷を下ろす
to unload a cart
馬の荷を下ろす
to unpack a horse
重荷を下ろす
(人のなら)to case one of a burden―relieve one of a burden―(自分のなら)―ease oneself of a burden―be relived of a burden
重荷を下ろしてやれ
Ease him of his burden!―Take his burden off his shoulders!
やっと重荷を下ろした
I am relieved of my burden―My burden is off my shoulders.
重荷を下ろした心地がする
A load is off my mind―I feel relieved.
それを承って重荷を下ろした心地がする
You have removed a load off my mind.

content: 3. (=下車させる)to set (one) down; to drop (a passenger):(手を貸してなら)to help (one) out of (a carriage)

content.content: 日比谷で下ろして下さい
Set me down at Hibiya―Drop me at Hibiya.
汽車が停車して乗客を下ろしたり乗せたりする
A train stops at a station to drop and pick up passengers.
お婆さんを下ろしてお上げ
Help the old lady out of the car!

content: 4. (=商品を卸す)to sell (goods) wholesale

content.content: 八掛けで卸す
to sell wholesale at 80 percent of the price―sell wholesale at 20 percent. discount
どっこい、そうは安くは問屋で卸さぬ
Not so fast!―There are two words to that bargain.

content:
5. (=大根や山葵をおろす)to grate (radishes or horse-radishes)
6. (=新しい物を初めて使用する)to use (anything) for first time

content.content: 手拭をおろす
to use a new towel for the first time
おろし立ての手拭
a towel almost new
靴をおろす
to wear a new pair of shoes for the first time

〈以下特例〉

to launch a ship
(難船を救う為に)救助艇を下ろす
to launch a life-boat
暗礁から船を下ろす
to get a ship off the rocks

to ground arms
錠を下ろす
to lock the door―lock up a box

to lop the branches off or away―lops a tree―prune the branches off or away―prune (down) a tree―trim the branches off or away―trim a tree

to put pen to paper―write
手を下ろす

to take the pot from over the fire
魚の片身をおろす
to sliver a fish
子をおろす
to commit foeticide―cause abortion
神を降ろす
to invoke a deity

content:
おろそか〔疎か〕
〈形〉Negligent; neglectful; remiss; careless

content.content: 疎かにする
to neglect―slight
学問を疎かにする
to neglect one's studies
学問を疎かにするな
Attend to your studies!
務めを疎かにする
to neglect one's duties―be neglectful of one's duties―be negligent in attending to one's duties―be remiss in the discharge of one's duties
務めを疎かには致しません
I attend to my duties.
これは子どもの教育を疎かにした結果だ
This comes of neglecting the education―slighting the education―of the children.
仕事を疎かにする
to slight one's work―fudge one's work―scamp one's work
このご恩をあだや疎かには思いません
I shall never forget your kindness.

おろち〔大蛇〕
〈名〉A monster serpent

おわいや〔汚穢屋〕
〈名〉A night-soil man; a night-man

content:
おわします〔御座します〕
〈自動〉(Honorific for) to be

content.content: 何事の御座します
I know not what it is that moves
かは知らねども
My heart to such a mood;
忝けなさに
But yet my tears unbidden flow
涙こぼるる
In blissful gratitude.

content:
おわせる〔負わせる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=重荷を負わせる)to impose (a burden on one); to lay (a burden on one)

content.content: 老人に重荷を負わせるのは気の毒だ
It is cruel to lay heavy burdens on the old.
日本では長男に義務を負わせ過ぎる
Too heavy obligations are imposed on the eldest son in Japan.
人民に重税を負わせる
to impose heavy taxes on the people―burden the people with heavy taxes
子どもにあまり課業を負わせるのは悪い
It is wrong to impose hard tasks on children.
人に費用を負わせる
to charge one with the expenses―charge the expenses on one
この入費を誰に負わせるのか
Whom shall we charge with the expenses?―On whom shall we charge the expenses?
袋を負わせる
To give or leave one the bag to hold.
とうとう僕が袋を負わされた
In fine I had the bag left me to hold.

content: 2. (=任を負わせる)to charge (one with a duty)

content.content: 重任を負わせられた
I am charged with an important duty.
君に責任を負わせる
I will hold you responsible for the consequences.
彼は自分の責任を人に負わせる
He shuffles off his responsibility on others.
君に債務を負わせる
I will hold you liable for the debt.

content: 3. (=罪を負わせる)to charge (one with a crime―the guilt on one); to lay (the blame on one); to lay (a failure) at one's door; to lay (a failure) to one's charge

content.content: 可哀そうに罪を負わせるな
Don't lay the blame on the poor fellow!
きっと失敗の罪を君に負わせるぞ
They will lay the failure at your door―lay the failure to your charge.

content: 4. (=傷を負わせる)to inflict (a wound on one)

content.content: 相手に重傷を負わしてやった
I inflicted a severe wound on my adversary―wounded him severely.

content:
おわらいぐさ〔お笑い草〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: わらいぐさ〔笑い草〕

content:
おわり〔終り〕
〈名〉The end (of a play); the finis (of a book); the close (of a season); the termination (of an affair); the conclusion (of a speech); the expiration (of a term):(=の) last; final

content.content: 終りまで
to the end
始めから終りまで
from beginning to end―from start to finish
終りを告げる
to end―come to an end―close―come to a close―terminate―come to a termination―conclude―come to a conclusion
会議も終りを告げた
The conference has come to an end.
終りに臨んで将来に関して一言申しましょう
To conclude,―In conclusion,―I have a word to say in regard to the future.
彼は演説の終りに臨んでこう言った
He concluded his speech with these words.
終りを全うする
to end well―come to a good end―come to a happy termination
この業に従事して終りを全うする者は少ない
Few who engage in this business, come to a good end.
公人として終りを全うした
His public career came to a happy termination.
政治家として終りを全うしなかった
His political career came to a bad end.
彼は始めは善かったが終りは悪かった
His life, which began so well, ended badly.
終り善ければすべて善し
“All is well that ends well.”
学期は終りに近い
The term draws to a close.
この本は終りの方になると興味が無くなる
The book drags towards the end.
始めは処女の如く終りは脱兎の如し
Be deliberate in counsel, prompt in action.
世の終り
the end of the world―the Day of Judgment

おわりはつもの〔終り初物〕
〈名〉The last fruit of the season

content:
おわる〔終る〕
〈自動〉To end; to come to an end; to be brought to an end; to close; to come to a close; to be brought to a close; to terminate; to come to a termination; to be brought to a termination; to conclude; to come to a conclusion; to be brought to a conclusion

content.content: 授業が終わった
School has come to an end―School is at an end―School is over.
授業が終わってから先生を訪問した
School over, I called on my teacher.
日本外史は平氏から始まって徳川氏で終わる
The Nihon Gaishi begins with the Tairas and ends with the Tokugawas.
事は冗談から始まってけんかに終わった
The matter began in a joke and ended in a quarrel.
試みは失敗に終わった
The attempt ended in a failure.
事不結果に終わった
The scheme proved abortive.
相談会は不得要領に終わった
The conference led to no result―led nowhere.
事業は資本の消費に終わった
The undertaking ended in―resulted in―the waste of capital.

content: 〈他動〉To finish (one's task); to complete (one's work)

content.content: もう食い終わった
I have finished eating―done eating.
この本を読み終わった
I have finished reading―done reading―this book.
仕事をし終わったらすぐ行く
I am coming as soon as I finish my task―get through with my task.
今日の仕事をし終わった
I have finished my day's work―The day's work is done―(米国にては)―I am through for today.

content:
おん〔恩〕
〈名〉
1. Kindness; goodness; a favour; a benefit; an obligation; a debt of gratitude

content.content: あなたにはご恩がある
I owe you a debt of gratitude―I lie under obligations to you―I am obliged to you―I am indebted to you.
恩をこうむる、恩になる
to receive favours―receive benefits―at one's hands
あなたにはご恩になりました
I have received favours at your hands.
恩を知る、恩に感ずる
to be sensible of favours―grateful for favours―thankful for favours
彼は恩を知る
He is sensible of favours―Kindness is not thrown away upon him.
恩を知らぬ、恩に感ぜぬ
to be insensible of favours―ungrateful for favours
あの男は恩を知らぬ
He is insensible of kindness―Kindness is thrown away upon him―He is an ingrate.
恩を忘れる
to be ungrateful
ご恩に感泣す
I am deeply sensible of your favours.
恩を施す
to do one a favour―bestow favours on one―lay one under obligations
恩を返す、恩に報いる
to repay one's kindness―requite one's favours
恩をもって仇に報いる
to return good for evil―heap coals of fire on one's head
恩を仇で返す
to return evil for good
このご恩は忘れません
I shall never forget your kindness―I shall be eternally grateful to you.
ご恩は生涯忘れません
I shall not forget your kindness as long as I live―I shall be grateful to you the longest day I have to live.
恩にきせる(恩きせがましくする)
to assume a patronizing air―treat one patronizingly
彼は少しのことで恩にきせる
He will come the benefactor over you for a trifle.
こうして下されば恩にきます
If you will do so, I shall feel indebted to you―consider myself your debtor.
恩にきられてはかえって迷惑だ
I should be rather annoyed to have you consider yourself my debtor.
恩を売る
to try to gain one's gratitude
君には再生の恩がある(再生の恩人)
I owe you my life―You are the preserver of my life.
親の恩、撫育の恩
one's debt to one's parents―what one owes to one's parents
子を持って知る親の恩
It is not till we come to have children of our own that we know our debt to our parents.
生みの恩より育ての恩
The one brought me up, the other only brought me forth―The one who brought me up is dearer to me than the one who brought me forth.
師の恩
one's debt to one's teacher―what one owes to one's teacher
犬は三日の恩を三年忘れぬ
Keep a dog for three days, and he will not forget you for three years.

content:
おん〔音〕
〈名〉
1. (=音{おと})a sound

content.content: 長音、短音
a long sound―a short sound

content: 2. (=発音)pronunciation

content.content: 言葉の音
the pronunciation of a word

content:
おんあい〔恩愛〕
〈名〉Love; affection

content.content: 恩愛の情にほだされる
to be tied by bonds of affection
恩愛の契りを断つ
to sever family ties

content:
おんい〔恩威〕
〈名〉Justice and mercy

content.content: 恩威並びに行わる
Justice is tempered with mercy.
恩威並び行う
to temper justice with mercy

content:
おんが〔温雅〕
〈形〉Graceful, affable; bland

content.content: 応対の温雅な紳士だ
He is an affable gentleman―a gentleman of bland manners.
温雅な作品だ
It is a graceful work of art.

content:
おんかい〔音階〕
〈名〉The musical scale

content.content: 全音階
the gamut

content:
おんがえし〔恩返し〕
〈名〉Requital, repayment (of kindness):(=する) to repay one's kindness; to requite one's favours

content.content: ご恩返しに今一年ご奉公致します
I will serve another year in requital of your favours―out of gratitude.

おんかく〔温覚〕
〈名〉The sense of heat

content:
おんがく〔音楽〕
〈名〉Music:(=の) musical

content.content: 唄が音楽に合う
The song harmonizes with music―goes to music.
唄を音楽に合わせる
to set a song to music
音楽に合わして歌う
to sing to music
音楽に合わして踊る
to dance to music
君は音楽の耳が有るか
Have you an ear for music?
僕は音楽がわからぬ
I have no ear for music―I am deaf to music.
嬢は音楽が堪能だ
She is a skilful musician.
音楽を習う
to practise music―take lessons in music
僕は慰みに音楽をやる
I take to music as a recreation.
音楽学校
a music school
音楽の先生
a music master
音楽の大家
a great musician

content:
おんがくたい〔音楽隊〕
〈名〉A music band; an orchestra

content.content: 管楽器音楽隊
a brass band
音楽隊長
a bandmaster―the leader of an orchestra

content:
おんがくどう〔音楽堂〕
〈名〉A music hall

content.content: 日比谷公園の音楽堂
the bandstand in Hibiya Park

おんがっか〔音楽家〕
〈名〉A musician

content.content: お乳母日傘で育つ
to be brought up in luxury

content:
おんびん〔穏便〕
〈形〉Peaceful; amicable; private:(=に) peaceably; amicably; privately

content.content: 事を穏便に済ます
to bring the matter to an amicable settlement―(内証にの意味なら)―settle the matter privately―settle the matter without making it public
世間がうるさいから穏便にしてもらいたい
If the affair gets abroad, people will talk; so I wish to have it hushed up.
何か穏便な方法があるだろう
There must be some peaceable means―amicable way―to settle the matter.
穏便に計らう
to make amicable arrangement―hush up the affair

content:
おんびん〔音便〕
〈名〉Euphony

content.content: 「同じ年」が音便で「同い年」になる
“Onaji toshi” is made“onaidoshi” for the sake of enphony.

content:
おんぶ〔負んぶ〕
〈名〉Being carried on the back:(=する) to be carried on one's back; to be carried pick-a-back

content.content: おんぶ(!)
Get on my back!
